results.description:
PLEASE READ:

Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7-7:05 - chat

7:05-7:30 - introductions (please be on time for intros)

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 10 pgs (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation


3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work


- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified


(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

See you there,

Dan

347 - 743 - 1854
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:50 pm
12 – 1 pm before monthly Miracles in Manhattan lectures (usually 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

You can also receive healing at the weekly Inner Vision Workouts:

Thursday's 7 – 8:30 pm

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

 

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

results.description:
Join Be Social Change on Monday, September 14th from 7PM to 9PM for our class on Intro to Facilitation - Fundamentals in Becoming an Effective Facilitator with Kristina Drury, Founder and Creative Director of TYTHEdesign.

===========================================

LIMITED TICKETS AVAILABLE! This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: bit.ly/Facilitate101Sept14

**BSC Unlimited pass holders get a 50% discount on this workshop**

===========================================

 Are you looking to enhance your leadership skills while infusing your work with more collaboration? Facilitating activities (design thinking based and beyond) with your team or community can lead to more team collaboration, greater team capacity, and productive communication with your community. This intro class answers ‘what is facilitation?’ and will demystify why you facilitate collaboration, your role as a facilitator, when to prepare a facilitated collaborative session and how to build it around your own style.

In addition to introducing the foundational basics of facilitation, we will model a participatory activity to demonstrate tips and tricks to guiding a collaborative experience. Identifying the tools and strategies to maximize working with the various stakeholders involved with your project, program or organization. This class gives an overview of the key tenets to being a strong facilitator, introduces design-based facilitation frameworks, and provides TYTHEdesign's own examples of implementation. Come ready to learn, ask, and engage!


WHAT YOU’LL LEARN 

• The basics of facilitation

• Keys to being a strong facilitator

• Strategies for building your collaboration session

• Activities that demonstrate how to brainstorm in a participatory design process

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR

• Individuals interested in facilitation and relatively new to the role or looking for a refresher of the basics

• Individuals from all professional or educational backgrounds interested in developing their group management and leadership skills

• Managers looking for tools to activate collaboration within their teams

• Professionals who work in community engagement or are about to begin community engagement projects or programs

• Individuals looking to add creative thinking methodology to their work

INSTRUCTOR BIO

Kristina Drury (@TYTHEdesign) founder of TYTHEdesign, is a social entrepreneur, designer and educator. TYTHE, a social impact firm, uses the lens of design and strategy to support organizations build their capacity in the social good community. Under her leadership TYTHE has increased the community impact of over 75 local and global social good organizations including the NYC Dept. of Education, Citi Community Development, Public Policy Lab and California State Library System. Recently, Kristina has been named a UNDP Innovation Expert. Prior to starting TYTHE, Kristina co-led the nonprofit Project H and worked in corporate social responsibility consulting. As an educator she has taught classes, workshops and training to build the capacity of over 600 change-makers, leaders, and entrepreneurs. Her teaching and speaking experience includes engagements at the Clinton Global Initiative University, Cooper-Hewitt Museum and New Museum’s Ideas City Festival.

You can learn about Kristina’s current work here and find out more about her background here.

SPACE PARTNER


The Centre for Social Innovation (@csiSL) is a home for nonprofits and social entrepreneurs in New York City. They’re building a movement of passionate people committed to a better world. Learn more at http://nyc.socialinnovation.org/

Refund Policy: Refunds can be issued in full up to 48 hours prior to the start of the class by contacting Be Social Change.
results.name: BSC Partner Workshop: Intro to Facilitation - Become an Effective Facilitator

This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

75min. This Soccer Workout will help to increase your leg power, core and upper body strength, overall agility as well as mental strength. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

Hello Dancers!

Welcome back.  Hope you enjoyed your summer.  Nahara's Monday night class continues with an Absolute Beginner Level from 7:00-8:00 pm and Intermediate Level from 8:00-9:00 pm, followed by Troupe Performance from 9:00-9:30 pm.  The Banat al Nahar Troupe will be performing at Rakassah East this October 10 (Saturday) @ 12:30 pm.

Belly Dance For Body & Soul - MONDAY NIGHTS w/Nahara

Beginner:  7:00-8:00 pm
Intermediate:  8:00-9:00 pmPerformance Troupe/Choreography:  9:00-9:30 pm 

Learn this captivating dance from the Middle East. Enrich your cultural knowledge. Whether you want to belly dance professionally or just have fun and get in shape, Nahara’s class is the place for you to start! The beginner class presents the basic movements and articulations of the hip, chest and arms along with simple improvisational choreographies. The intermediate class focuses on more complex choreography and layering movements for more precise interpretation of the music. An introduction and continuation of props such as veil, cane and zils. All body types and ages welcome.  Coin belts, hip wraps, zils available at the studio for purchase.  Videos:  Nahara @ Tava’s, Nahara @ Jebon, NYC.

For class registration please visit the website or call Josie  @[masked] if you have any questions!

Looking forward to another great year of dancing!


Josie & Nahara

 When: 7 pm - 8 pm
Level: Beginners and Advanced Beginners (but all welcome)
Max Players: 10 


How to RSVP for the next Tennis Lesson:

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 class = $35 Promo code = T15GR1

3 classes = $99 Promo code = T15GR3

6 classes = $179 Promo code = T15GR6

10 classes  = $269 Promo code = T15GR10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance


What's included? 
- Tennis Pro
- Learn something new 
- Meet fun people 
- Get some exercise 
- 1 hour lesson from a Tennis Pro and 1 hour of social hitting
- Racquet available if necessary


Attendance

Unable to attend or need to change the day?  If you change your RSVP on the the MindBodyOnline account with more than 48 hours of notice, you will have that class credited to use in the future with with no problem.  If you try to cancel within 48 hours on your MindBodyOnline account, you will be charged for the class as a late cancellation or No-Show. I understand things can come up, just be respectful to the class and other students to change your RSVP on the MindBodyOnline account to allow others to join in on that time slot.

WATCH THE VIDEO BELOW AND SEE THE F-U-N !!!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m86vJgPvsxo

ARE YOU READY FOR SOME TENNIS?!?!?


The main reason people don't play tennis in NYC is because: 

It is Too Costly (lessons and permit)

It is Difficult to obtain court space

It is too Hard to find someone to play with

People don't have a Racquet to play with

The good news is you found this site and the #1 resource for anyone interested in tennis in NYC.  At Tennis World, You will be able to:

Find Affordable Lessons

Have an available court

Plenty of People to Meet & Play With (Very Social Fun Group)

There is always extra racquets on hand to use at no cost

It doesn't matter if you have never played or a little rusty, this class is for you because everyone is a little rusty :-)

You'll learn the basics to stop hitting that tennis ball over the fence or chasing it on the other courts. You will learn great tips to start enjoying the game immediately.

Throughout these sessions, you will learn/practice: Ground strokes, serving, volleys, overheads, lobs, footwork and strategies. Each session will focus on different aspects and will provide ample time to practice too! 

In addition to improving your game, you will also get to MEET LOTS OF NEW PEOPLE and have an AWESOME TIME MAKING NEW TENNIS FRIENDS AND HITTING THE BALL. The sessions are both very social and technique oriented.

This event has sold out quickly in the past, so please make sure you RSVP quickly.

What to wear: You'll be running, jumping and moving around.  Make sure to wear sneakers & an outfit that will be appropriate for the weather and exercise. 

What to bring: We recommend water, towel and possibly a snack bar.  If you have a racquet, bring it down, otherwise one can be provided for you at no cost.

Want a Private or Semi-Private Lesson?

A package of Private lessons cost between $55-$65 and Semi-Private lessons (2 people in a class) cost $86.  Create an account at:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

Book your appointment online and Call or Text <a>[masked]</a> to confirm.

Weather and Refunds (Rain out?) 

In the event of the class being cancelled due to rain, you will not receive a refund, rather a credit that you will be able to apply for any future class during the week or weekend.  You can also contact: <a>[masked]</a>, to confirm before leaving your apartment to be on the safe side regarding weather and cancellations. 

Remember just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers, that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area but not where the courts are.  Lastly, if it does rain, how much rain is estimated, mostly it is passing showers and tennis can resume soon thereafter.

Check out the weather report on the link below:

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

Questions? 
- Please refrain from using the comment/conversation fields below. 

TEXT: <a>[masked]</a> for a quicker response. 

- Your instructor can be reached at <a>[masked]</a>, if you're running late/lost 
- Yes, bathrooms and fountains are close by the courts

DIRECTIONS:

These beautiful tennis courts are conveniently located at the end of the 3 train in Manhattan, which means they are just one block north. The surface is softer than most, well maintained, and has LIGHTS.


https://www.google.com/maps/place/2601+Adam+Clayton+Powell+Jr+Blvd,+New+York,+NY+10039/@40.8258611,-73.936799,17z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x89c2f67f79c87e27:0xba25e4f78a0fd23a

To see all possible directions of the various locations on how to arrive, visit the link below:

http://www.tennisworldnyc.com/where-to-play/

Though compassion is often confused with putting others’ welfare above our own, the fact is that genuine self-concern is the necessary foundation for kindness and compassion towards all beings.


In this unique offering, we’ll look at the difference between self-compassion and self-indulgence, transform emotional barriers and resistances, and learn to work with self-judgements and criticism through understanding and patience.


Due to the nature of the course, enrollment will be limited to 30 people.  We are offering this course at the discounted price of $80 to Brainiac Members.  Please select "Basic Members" rate when registering at this link.  

We are located on the third floor of an elevator building.  There is no elevator.  Chairs will be provided.


Details at this link: http://theidproject.org/events/2015/09/14/discovering-self-compassion

Meet a diverse group of women, our artistic conductor and accomplished pianist, and sing some of the exciting new music for our December 2015 concert. Concord Singers welcomes both novice and experienced singers. While no audition is necessary, prior singing experience is preferred. Enjoy singing a wide variety of contemporary and classical music including sacred, folk, world beat, contemporary, show music, tone poems and more.

We use vocal/piano rehearsal tracks to learn our parts, hold sectionals throughout the season, and offer individual support as needed.

results.description:
As hard as it is to believe, it's the end of summer already.  A new season is beginning.  We're again at another ending and at a new beginning.  Life offers us so many of these, over and over again, in all aspects of our lives.  It always gives us another chance, another opportunity, if we allow ourselves to see it and take it - the door is never completely closed.  This time is also an opportunity to take stock of where we've been and where we're headed, and are we pointed in the right direction for where it is we want to go?

What in your life is dying and falling away, and what is it that's being born?  For whenever something is dying and falling away something new is being born in our lives. 


In this gathering of like-minded, spiritual-minded, supportive women who are on the path of personal and spiritual growth, development and evolution, we will have an opportunity to steep in questions such as this, and in discussion of where we are in our lives in general and what we are needing to move us in the direction we'd like to go.


I know it will be another interesting and enlightening night for all of us as we journey together.  I look forward to being in the circle with you.

Please take a few moments to reflect on the question in bold above, make a few notes and bring them to share at our gathering.
results.name: Women's Wisdom Circle Gathering, Monday September 14

results.description:
We will be discussing the contents of The World Peace Diet, Chapters 1 and 2: "Foods Power" & "Our Culture's Roots"

• Chapter 1: Food's Power; "The most violent weapon on earth is the fork".  [Gandhi] What does food mean to us in our busy culture? It is the most intimate thing we do. How can something so pedestrian be so powerful? 

• Chapter 2: Our culture's Roots; "As long as men massacre animals, they will kill each other. He who sows the seeds of murder and pain cannot reap joy and love" [Pythagoras] How did we get here, to a culture that is so meat obsessed, yet cannot bare to see how our food is harvested. Where did we depart from our innate and childlike sense of compassion toward animals.

The World Peace Diet provides a transformative perspective on the multiple consequences of the food choices we make (or are made for us)—not just in terms of personal physical health, but also environmental health, cultural well-being, economic well-being, and alignment with our ethical and spiritual values.

If you have read the book, this study group will be a good forum for sharing sections that meant something to you, seeking clarity on more challenging sections through open discussion, and sharing how you have been effected by your food choices.

If you have not read the book but are an ethical and environmentally compassionate individual, and would like to explore ways to live more in alignment with your values, I think you will enjoy the discussion and be a valuable contributor to the deep discussions that will inevitably come from discussing the text.

Remaining chapters will be discussed in the following weeks.

results.name: Let's discuss The World Peace Diet - Chapters 1 & 2

A recommended reading, from Philosophy Now, can be found here.

RSVP for this event will begin on 8/25 at 7:30pm.

This meetup will take place at Massimo's apartment in Chelsea (near the 1, C, E, F, N, and R subways), which is conducive to a much more relaxed and far less noisy experience than a restaurant setting. 

The fee for the meetup is of $20/person, which includes food for the evening, a contribution toward the meetup.com fees to maintain the site, credit card fee, and taxes. Feel free to BYOB, or contribute $5/person/glass if you are okay with whatever we have in the house.

> Please notice new starting time! See you at 7:30pm! <

Details on how to get to the meetup will be provided to registered participants who have paid the fee. Please keep in mind that this event will take place at a private residence, so do NOT arrive early, since we will be cooking and setting things up, and do NOT linger afterwards, since your hosts will be cleaning up and relaxing after a good evening’s work. results.description:
The history of this globe that we call Earth (and the globes before it) as well as the great ages represented by the 5 major Races (so far) has been a well kept secret that only an Initiate was entitled to know. H.P.B. changed this in 1888 with the publication of her monumental work the Secret Doctrine. This will be a multi-part interactive lecture series so that we can cover this vast topic in some detail.

As H.P.B. stated in the Introduction to the Secret Doctrine:

"There were portions of the Secret Science that for incalculable ages had to remain concealed from the profane gaze. But this was because to impart to the unprepared multitude secrets of such tremendous importance, was equivalent to giving a child a lighted candle in a powder magazine.

"The danger was this: Doctrines such as the planetary chain, or the seven races, at once give a clue to the seven-fold nature of man, for each principle is correlated to a plane, a planet, and a race; and the human principles are, on every plane, correlated to seven-fold occult forces — those of the higher planes being of tremendous power. So that any septenary division at once gives a clue to tremendous occult powers, the abuse of which would cause incalculable evil to humanity. A clue, which is, perhaps, no clue to the present generation — especially the Westerns — protected as they are by their very blindness and ignorant materialistic disbelief in the occult; but a clue which would, nevertheless, have been very real in the early centuries of the Christian era, to people fully convinced of the reality of occultism, and entering a cycle of degradation, which made them rife for abuse of occult powers and sorcery of the worst description."
results.name: Rounds & Races - Secret Doctrine - Lecture & Discussion

results.description: The purpose of this group is to establish a safe place where people can deal with the pain and isolation brought about by the ending of a significant relationship. We are not a singles group or a dating network. Instead, we are a family where it is safe to be ourselves. The goal of the meeting is to help members to develop into healthier, more complete, independent, loving men and women. We hope that by being together, listening to each other, and by sharing our experiences, strength and hope, we will learn to see the value of life in a new context. For the first hour of each meeting members share their experiences. The second half of the meeting is reserved for a guest speaker relating to either the legal or emotional aspects of separation/divorce. We meet every Monday eveing at the Church in the Highlands, 35 Bryant Ave. White Plains, New York. We are a mixed group of men and women. There are about 50 members, with approximately 20 attendees per meeting. There are no fees, new members are welcome, no reservation is necessary. We pass a basket at each meeting and suggest a five dollar donation per meeting to cover the cost of the meeting place and coffee/cookies served at the meeting.
results.name: Separation and Divorce Recovery Group Weekly Meetup

Join us for an evening of discovery, connection and realignment to our soul's purpose. Reconnect to the wisdom and energies that fully support our path. Gain insight and understanding to the energies that influence your 7 lower bodies; DNA, genetic, physical, etheric, emotional, mental, and spiritual/soul. These 7 bodies affect your human expression of self and experiences and realities here on Earth. 

A Universal Ray Soul Reading offers you the cosmic wisdom and support so you may align to the truth of who you are and experience your life with more joy, ease and grace.

results.description:
Hello...

It's not easy contemplating or going through a divorce. Please join us for an informative meet-up about how to make it through divorce wisely--in the most amicable, cost-effective, and respectful way possible.

We will discuss the pros and cons of litigation versus collaborative practice versus mediation and help you decide which approach is best for you and your circumstances.  We will discuss the process and how it works, tips on how to be most effective when discussing the issues, and ways to reduce your stress during the process.

Finally, if you have children, we will discuss the risks of divorce to children, which factors increase and decrease these risks, and what you can do to protect your children from the negative impact of divorce.  In particular, we will discuss ways to keep the children out of the middle, communicate effectively versus harmfully with your ex-spouse, and ways to preserve important bonds if at all possible so that the two of you can have a positive and supportive co-parenting relationship after the divorce.

And, of course, since it's your meet-up, if you have something else on your mind, we can talk about that, too, and I'll help in whatever way I can.

Please RSVP either way.  And please come.  It will really help. Promise.

Kind regards,

Judie

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked]

results.description:
Mondays from 8 – 9:30 pm with Yasuko Kasaki (lecture)
Wednesdays from 7 – 8:30 pm with Christopher Pelham (lab)

Know your life purpose and the meaning of your current situation clearly. Communicate with your Inner Teacher. Heal yourself and others.


These ongoing classes focus on mind training designed to help you to experience the lessons and wisdom of ACIM. 

Each Monday class contains some lecture from the ACIM Textbook and/or Urtext, some discussion and Q&A, and typically 20 – 30 minutes of meditation, creative visualization and/or spiritual reading practice in order to experience mind change.

Thursday classes skip the lecture to devote more time to discussion and practice.

Our primary goal in these classes is for each student to learn to listen to the guidance of Holy Spirit and live his/her life with certainty and peace. Slowly, you will re-train your eyes to see the world around you without judgment. You will learn to communicate with your holy spirit.

It is OK to attend without having done the reading, but we highly encourage you to do the reading (and the workbook lessons on your own) if you can! This course is meant to be experienced rather than simply talked about. You can find the text online here, among other places.

Students of all experience levels and backgrounds are welcome!

 

Yasuko Kasaki has been teaching A Course in Miracles and offering spiritual counseling and healing since 1999. She has approximately 1,000 students and clients. In 2004, she opened CRS, the first and only spiritual center in New York City devoted to the study and practice of ACIM. Ms. Kasaki is the author of 21 books published by major publishers in Japan. Read more...

You can listen to a sampling of Yasuko's recent guided meditations here:
http://crsny.podbean.com

Christopher Pelham currently serves as teaching assistant for the Monday class and will sometimes lead the group when Ms. Kasaki is away. He is the Director and a co-founder of CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing). He balances his time between overseeing the growth and health of the CRS community, producing arts/cultural/educational events at the Center, and working as a CRS Healer and student and teacher of A Course in Miracles. In addition to studying ACIM with Yasuko Kasaki since 2003, he studied the Spiritual Psychology of Acting with London-based teacher John Osborne Hughes and Keith Johnstone-based Improvisation with the late Gloria Maddox. Read more...

Another great way to get a taste of our approach is to attend one of our free Healing Events, each of which is open to the public:

Spiritual Healing Clinic 
M 7 – 7:50 pm, Tu 7 – 7:50 pm
Sundays 12 – 1 pm preceding Jon Mundy's Miracles in Manhattan lectures
suggested donation $20, nobody turned away

Guided Meditation
Tu 6:30 – 7 pm
Free!
results.why: It's a concrete and energizing way to develop the ability to meditate and to come to know your life purpose and the meaning of your current situation more clearly. You can also learn to communicate with your Inner Teacher and find peace!

results.description:
Join Lana for this creative, Shiva Rea inspired, vinyasa flow yoga class.  This is an all levels class with just the right amount of alignment cues and modifications to make it intuitive and appropriately challenging for beginners to advanced practitioners.  

The vinyasa style of yoga links the yoga poses (asanas) with the breath, focusing as much on the transitions from pose to pose, as on the actual poses.  This class starts with a mindful and centering warm-up, building into a moderately to fast paced yoga flow and allowing for deeper stretches and longer holds toward the end of the class. By the final pose, savasana, your body and mind will feel totally prepared to melt into a blissful state of peace and relaxation.

Pricing: $10.  

Please make an effort to arrive 5 to 15 minutes in advance of class and always RSVP (even if it's last moment).  If you need to be late, please walk-in and set up as quietly as you can.  Thank you.
results.name: Candlelit Vinyasa Yoga (with Lana)

results.description:
Guys, This meetup is to talk about the issues we each face. Some of the things that cause a lot of trouble: Problems with the ex. Harm to the children, and how to reduce it. If you have visitation and not custody, there are visitation problems we all deal with. Everyone pays child support. My idea is to kick around our problems and experiences, and see if that helps in dealing with the issues. I have changed the location for the meetup: at TGI Fridays 826 New Jersey 3 Clifton. This is a pretty nice TGI Fridays, and it is easy to get to.

Please come on time, and bring a friend with you. And please be ready to listen as well as ask questions.  This is a bunch of us who have been through it.  It is a good group!

see you then,

Bob Davies

results.description:
This group meets on the second Monday of each month to discuss a specific mystery, horror, or intrigue novel. Join Moderator Aurelia Long as we discuss this month's featured selection, Enemies and Allies, by Kevin J. Anderson.

Enemies and Allies, by Kevin J. Anderson

Description:  As America and the Soviet Union race to build their nuclear stockpiles, two extraordinary heroes must form an uneasy alliance. These studies in opposites—shadow and light—must overcome their distrust of each other to battle evil and injustice.

Sputnik silently circles in the skies above the fabled cities of the United States as danger lurks in the Earth's darkest corners.

In Gotham, the shadowy vigilante known as the Batman haunts Gotham's streets . . . and the police are just as afraid of this Dark Knight as the city's criminals are.

In Metropolis, the notorious Lex Luthor is leveraging international tensions to build LuthorCorp into a military-industrial empire, competing against his business rival Wayne Industries, which is run by Gotham's enigmatic millionaire, Bruce Wayne. Luthor's activities have raised the interest of Daily Planet reporter Lois Lane, who is beginning to realize that Luthor may stop at nothing to achieve success.

At the same time, Clark Kent and Jimmy Olsen are investigating the rumored crash of a flying saucer. Clark is desperate to know if there may be other lost interplanetary visitors on Earth secretly living among them—visitors like himself.

When Batman's and Superman's paths cross, their lives change, and history will never be the same.
results.name: Suspense Central:  Enemies and Allies, by Kevin J. Anderson

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, get a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

results.description:
The Crossroads (http://www.xxroads.com/)

Very lively and young spot with well organized and fun trivia. Along with the usual question rounds there is a name that tune and name the movie from A/V clips. There are random questions between rounds for a free shot. A DJ spins after trivia and there is a pretty serious beer pong tournament set up afterwards. Best part about the night is the ridiculously cheap beer. Bring a giant glass and they will fill it for $3 - $5, with real beer, not just junk. This place rocks and is pretty popular so you may have a very short walk after you park.

results.description:
Access the webinar here: https://www.innerengineering.com/online/free-meditation-webinars-2?signinsrc=Meetup-NewYork

***REGISTRATION closes 45 minutes prior to the webcast.***  Please make sure you sign-up on our website at least 45 mins prior to the webcast to receive your live log-in link via email. 


(Technical Support: <a>[masked]</a>) 


----------------------------------------------------------------

Isha Kriya Guided Meditation-

A lot of people find it really difficult to calm the mind and settle the body for meditation when they first try it. Too many people get frustrated and give up on meditation before they can experience its many benefits.


These 1-hour guided sessions offer a simple, but powerful kriya practice that aligns your mind, body, and inner-energies to easily and naturally become meditative. Once meditative, your experience of the life within you and the world around you becomes much deeper and richer. Daily activity becomes effortless and joyful.


You can easily learn this 12-to-18 minute Isha Kriya process in one session and practice on their own, or return to class to ask questions and deepen the experience with the group. Benefits of regular practice include improving health, energy and vitality; enhancing mental focus, memory and clarity; reducing stress and establishing a deep sense of peace and inner balance.

Isha Kriya is a gentle, seated practice, which can be practiced in a chair. No previous meditation experience is necessary.

The Isha Kriya process was developed by realized yogi, Sadhguru Vasudev. Sadhguru is renowned for his powerful yoga and meditation programs, as well as thriving humanitarian initiatives. He has been hosted to speak and offer meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress.

This free session will be facilitated by a trained Isha Kriya instructor. Contact: [masked],[masked] for more information about Isha USA or this session.

For more on Sadhguru and Isha, visit IshaUSA.org/blog
results.name: Isha Kriya Guided Meditation-FREE Class-(Online Webinar)

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE

 


 A steady pace all the way so we make the sunrise and can get to work after ,,,, not good for a first time hiker .


4 miles 

Hiking Poles are helpful


Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

+++

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

Don't be late , we start on time : )
results.name: Mt. Beacon ~ Fire Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE ~

Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters. 

BRING LOTS OF BUSINESS CARDS!!!
Cost is $20, which includes breakfast.

results.description:
NYPH is happy to share this upcoming NYSERDA workshop, just in time for NYC Climate Week!

Register here with NYSERDA directly

If you're going, let us know here on the NYPH Meetup page too! 

The Getting to Net Zero Workshop is a great way to learn about NYSERDA’s Low-rise New Construction Program, and how it supports homebuilding aimed at net zero performance goals and renewables integration. Workshop modules will show attendees how to build the team, optimize the design and energy modeling, and analyze the economics that will help ensure a successful outcome.


Module 1: Introduction, Performance Criteria, and Collaboration

Module 2: Design

Module 3: Economics

Module 4: Energy Modeling in REM 


This is a FREE event!

Register here with NYSERDA directly

If you're going, let us know here on the NYPH Meetup page too! 


Become a NY Passive House member
Visit the NY Passive House website
Read the NY Passive House blog
Register for the NY Passive House newsletter
results.name: CLIMATE WEEK - NYSERDA Getting to Net Zero Workshop, NYC Edition

results.description:
Eddie - one of our longest-standing members - is organizing a new Tuesday morning pick-up...

He'll have square goals, one of my EPL balls, and a handsome set of bibs.

Please abide by the usual RSVP rules for Tuesday's matches:

Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!

results.description:
Every Tuesday the CHA will meet at 12pm at the NY Hilton hotel. The Cannabis and Hemp Association can only accept CHA Affiliates who RSVP to the event. If you wish to attend a Meetup and bring a friend, they must become a CHA Affiliate. Your friend's or collegues may become an affiliate by joining the group www.meetup.com/cannabisandhemp . Here the CHA will discuss membership benefits, offer free consultations to anyone interested in the cannabis industry, and have an open forum to discuss future Meetups and CHA monthly events.

At the Meetup, the CHA often provides written materials for the lecture. Only those who RSVP will receive a copy of the meeting notes. Our materials are distributed based on those who have RSVP'd only.

The CHA Small Business Incubator is an event that all aspiring and current canna-business entrepreneurs may come and meet with Scott Giannotti for any assistance or advice on their business.  All observers are welcome. Please RSVP and unRSVP if you cannot attend.

The NY Hilton is free to all members of the group and members are encouraged to bring friends, business ideas, business cards, and anything they would like to discuss about all things cannabis.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be in Bridges Bar. Email if you can't find us cannabisandhemp@gmail.com

** Do NOT bring any outside food to the shop.  La Casita sells refreshments & snacks. **

 

We are meeting at La Casita Yarn Store at 253 Smith St between Douglas & Degraw from 2-4pm. The Carroll Street F stop is the closest and the 57 bus stops at Douglass St.

The yarn store is small and cozy and has a cafe with yummy snacks, small meals and drinks - including wine and beer!  In order to support LaCasita, who generously hosts our weekly meeting, we ask that you buy something while attending.

As always with meetups, you'll probably want to leave your more complex projects at home...

Attendance for this meet up is limited to 10 people due to the size of the venue. Please be sure to RSVP if you plan to attend and change your RSVP if your plans change.

venue.name: The Nightly Show With Larry Wilmore

results.description:
We have a block of 20 tickets for our group to see a live taping of the Comedy Central show The Nightly Show with Larry Wilmore. Continuing in Comedy Central’s grand tradition of producing groundbreaking late night formats, “The Nightly Show” highlight's Larry Wilmore’s distinct point of view and comedic take on current events and pop culture. Hosted by Wilmore, the show features a diverse panel of voices, providing a perspective largely missing in the late night television landscape.

PLEASE DO NOT SIGN UP FOR THIS EVENT UNLESS YOU KNOW THAT YOU CAN 100% BE AT THE TAPING AT 4:30PM.

Can I come alone?  Yes 99% of those attending will come on their own. Each person will have the opportunity to invite a guest. If you wish to bring more people (up to 4 you must guarantee that they will all come)

How should I dress? business casual

How long does it last? We will be out of the taping by 7pm.  Following the taping the group may go to a nearby restaurant for dinner.

You can join us for FREE, but again PLEASE DO NOT SIGN UP FOR THIS EVENT UNLESS YOU KNOW THAT YOU CAN 100% BE AT THE TAPING AT 4:30PM
results.name: FREE VIP Tix -LIVE Taping of Comedy Central's The Nightly Show w/Larry Wilmore

results.description:
The time has come to WRITE!

For this meetup we may have some small chit chat here and there, but our purpose is singular: to get some writing done. If you have been looking for a time and space to get busy adding words to a current project, then this meetup is for you. I will bring along my bag full of prompts if anyone wants to peruse them to get started, but, for all intents and purposes, this meetup is an opportunity to support you in whatever you need to be working on now.

We will be meeting in the events room at the Todt Hill-Westerleigh Library on Victory Blvd close to CSI. They are tables and chairs for us, so bring your notebooks, journals or laptops with you to get your work done. There are outlets in the room and the library offers free wi-fi. We are permitted to have food and beverages, but they must remain in the room (they can't be brought out to the library itself). There is also a parking lot and bus stop right outside the building for your convenience!
results.name: Weekly Write-In!

results.description:
John Gagliardi, our favorite Regional Brokerage Consultant from Fidelity Investments, will host an encore presentation delving deeper into the tools and techniques of successful trading. This time John will focus on strategies for managing trading risk.

Topics to be covered:

• VIX

• benefits of risk management

• trade management strategies

• stop losses and conditional trades

• technical indicators

About our Speaker:

John Gagliardi has been the regional brokerage consultant for Fidelity Active Trader Services throughout the New York tri-state area since 2004. His primary responsibility is to educate traders about the tools and services that are provided by Fidelity Investments. Additionally, Mr. Gagliardi conducts local seminars on educational topics, including fundamental and technical trading, research and options, market mechanics, and trading software. Previously, he worked on Wall Street with the convertible and risk arbitrage desk at Cuttone & Co. Mr. Gagliardi left his career on the floor to pursue the newest technology in the brokerage business and worked for one of the earliest pioneers in direct-access trading, EdgeTrade.com. He is also well-versed in technical analysis and was an instructor for Pristine Capital Management. Prior to entering the financial industry, Mr. Gagliardi owned and operated several businesses that he sold to Barnes and Noble. Mr. Gagliardi holds both Series 7 and 63 securities licenses. He received a BA in business and legal studies from New York University.

More info at: http://www.moneyshow.com/experts.asp?speakerid=8C5991E07E7C4C2288ED311CF192F53D

NOTE: Attendance has been strictly capped due to space limitations. If you reserve and your plans should change, PLEASE update your reservation to release a seat to someone on the waiting list.
results.name: Risk Management for Traders and Investors

results.description:
NB. RSVP's through Meetup are now closed but there will be cash tickets on the door

----------------------------------------------------------


Hi Everyone,

Welcome to our FinTech Open Mic Night series in New York. Please join us for our monthly mixture of presentations, skype-ins, fireside chats and shout-outs plus plenty of networking.

This monthly session is designed to provide an opportunity to catch up with your peers, to see what's going on in the New York and International FinTech scenes and to tell us all about yourself and your own work.

This month's topic is Social Finance, the crowd pooling their ideas and information to beat the markets. Crowd has become such a powerful force now it's no surprise that the markets are being addressed. Please join us to see a range of companies pitch their platforms followed by a panel session discussion with the audience.


                                                  Agenda

Please be aware that the agenda is updated on a regular basis

6:00pm - Doors open

Refreshments and networking opportunities

7:00pm - Session starts

-> Welcome address 

Ashish Singal, NewFinance New York Chapter Organiser

-> Presentations

Leigh Drogen Founder and CEO at Estimize, crowdsourced earnings and economic estimates

Pierce Crosby, Director of Business Development and Partnerships, StockTwits, the largest social network for investors and traders


Delaney Granizo-Mackenzie, Lead for Academic Outreach at Quantopian, a platform for you to build, test, and execute trading algorithms


-> Panel Session

Our panel will be hosted by Stephane Dubois, CEO and Founder, Xignite, in the process of revolutionizing the $25B financial market data industry

And in addition to our speakers, we're pleased to welcome to the panel:

Igor Gonta, CEO of Market Prophit, a financial Big Data analytics company that ranks financial bloggers in social media chatter based on the accuracy of their stock market commentary and generates Crowd-sourced intelligence for the investment community


8:00pm - Closing

Shout-outs, communications, feedback and thanks

Further networking opportunities

9:00pm - Session ends

For those of you who would like to continue networking we'll retire to a local bar.

Cheers

Ashish


-------------------------------------------------------------

Thank you to our Partners:


WeWork is the community of creators. We transform buildings into beautiful, collaborative workspaces and provide infrastructure, services, events and technology so our members can focus on doing what they love.
results.name: NewFinance September FinTech Open Mic Night - Social finance

venue.name: Lexington Bar at the Court Hotel

results.description:
This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and too many people to talk to. 

This FREE event brings together entrepreneurs, decision-makers and investors to network and build new business relationships in a great venue. You will find many who are open to share information about their business and are willing to build a future business relationship with you!

This way of meeting people is 1200 times better than Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn, both in terms of reaching new and other entrepreneurs and investors, and doing so on practically on a ZERO dollarbudget and you do not need to depend on advertising to grow your business.


Remember to bring plenty of business cards.

The Lexington Lounge at The Court Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere. The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

What: Interesting After Hour Networking Event
Hosts: Roger
Why: Establish new contacts and/or reconnect with old ones.
Cost: FREE admission
Atmosphere: The dress code is business casual. 

Cocktail Hour till 8 PM - Select Beer 6.00 - House Wine 7.00
   - Well Drinks 8.00 - 25% off Appetizers.

Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

THIS IS A MULTI GROUP EVENT. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A PORTION OF THOSE ACTUALLY ATTENDING. 

We look forward to see you networking with the best business professionals that New York City has to offer. We ask that you put your name and industry on the name tag that we will provide.

VOLUNTEERING: We will need extra hands. Anyone that would like to assist us with registration, please call or email me. 

SPAM: Please don't spam our members with your products/services or company name/website because your message will be deleted and you will be banned from this group

This event is organized by Roger Kuperways (212)[masked]
results.how_to_find_us: Entrance on Lexington Avenue
results.name: FREE Professional Business Networking Event

results.description:
We are happy to invite you to New York's leading Microsoft Azure User Group Meetup - designed to bring together New York's Microsoft Azure development and infrastructure community to talk about challenges, roadmap, what we'd like to see in future releases, and overall user experience.

Topic:

Azure and HPC: Join to see Nimbo create a Microsoft HPC environment and highlight the integration with Azure.

Abstract:  

Microsoft Azure and HPC : Deep Dive discussion on running and optimizing HPC clusters in Azure. Attendees will learn how they can use Azure to burst compute to effectively run their workloads.

Speaker: 

Kevin Keeler from Nimbo

Kevin has been working on enterprise IT solutions for over 15 years. At Nimbo Kevin has worked with a wide range of customers across many industries helping develop strategies for utilizing the cloud.

Feedback


We are dedicated to remain New York's best Microsoft Azure Meetup Group - a high reaching goal that can only be achieved with our group members' input. If you have any suggestions on which topics you'd like to see covered, speakers you want to hear present or anything else you can think of, don't hesitate to <a>contact us</a>.

Please use our hashtag on Twitter to tweet about this user group: #NYCAZURE

Hope to see you there!

We will now be meeting every 3rd Wednesday of each month at 6pm.

If you have suggestions or are interested in presenting please e-mail us: [masked].
results.name: Azure and HPC

Empowering 1,000 women technology entrepreneurs by 2018!

This is no ordinary pitch session we are ELEVATING the pitch event to the next level. With a superior panel of seasoned entrepreneurs, VC’s and angels all extremely passionate about helping women founded tech businesses to be successful.  Serving wine, horderves, and maybe some beer… 

We have 3 fabulous women tech founders pitching to our esteemed panel of experts. 

Format for the evening: 

6:00pm: Doors open

6:30pm: Event kick-off, pitches & panel feedback

8:00pm: Networking

8:30pm: Close

Ticket Price is $20.  RSVP to this event & book your spot now on General Assembly’s </a><a href="https://generalassemb.ly/education/women-tech-founders-pitch-event-men-welcome/new-york-city/16479">website here!RSVP alone does not grant you a ticket.


Our founders include:

Lisa Wang | Founder @ Fooze | former 3x US National Champion Gymnast 

Fooze is the 1-tap delivery app for your favorite late night munchies. Download Fooze on iOS! 

Coralee Dixon | Founder @ Shortcake 

Shortcake helps new parents and grandparents create keepsake baby albums and photo books using their existing social media content. www.shortcakeinc.com

Nataliya Nada | Founder @ Nataliya Nada 

Nataliya Nada empowering senior Ukrainian women by connecting them to the luxury knitwear market in the US. www.nataliyanada.com


Our panel includes:

Anita Gardyne | CEO & Founder @ Oneva 

Oneva takes the hassle from finding trusted in-home caregivers for kids and parents.  Our caregivers are all FBI background checked and available for jobs of any duration. www.oneva.com

Mike Edelhart | Lead Partner @ Social Starts

Social Starts invests in early stage Social start-ups. www.socialstarts.com

Jennifer Yemu Li | CoFounder & CEO @ MuseFind 

MuseFind is a platform to connect Brands to the Best social media influencers to grow their businesses in an authentic & meaningful way. www.musefind.com

Tania Yuki | Founder & CEO @Shareablee 

Shareablee is the leading authority on audience intelligence, competitive benchmarking and actionable insights for social media. www.shareablee.com

Ramphis Castro | Managing Director @ Founder Institute NYC | Kauffman Fellow

Founder Institute is the world's largest idea-stage accelerator, supporting 1,600+ companies that have collectively raised over $500MM in venture capital to date. </a><a href="http://about.me/jramphis">www.about.me/jramphis</a>

results.description:
PLEASE NOTE - We are using Eventjoy for registration, so please RSVP and pay using the following link: 


http://entsale.co/sept15sales


In the rush to hire and get reps as productive as soon as possible, sales training often does not get much attention. Many companies have the expectation that sales reps already know what to do. Then many managers that are already under pressure to make the numbers, do not spend the time to effective coach reps.

We will ask the experts during our panel discussion what it takes to create a world-class sales training program, how to make training a priority for the organization, and how managers and sales reps can make the most of ongoing coaching to improve sales results.

Our speakers for the panel include:

·  Jordan Gutman - Head of Sales Training at Yotpo

·  Michael Sclafani - VP of Sales at ADP TotalSource

·  Lou Diamond - President & CEO at FOBIA

·  Melyssa Plunkett-Gomez - Sales Executive at Allego

We look forward to seeing you at our September event!
results.name: Sales Training and Coaching

results.description:
</a>

Jason Malki, Founder of Alley Boost and Sports Wonks will be hosting a sports tech panel featuring special guests, Brooke Eaton, Director, Digital Media at Brooklyn Nets, Jayne Bussman-Wise, Director, Digital Marketing at New York City Football Club, Kiril Savino, Founder & Chief Product Officer at Game Changer, and Wim Sweldens, Co-Founder & CEO at Kiswe Mobile.

Topics that will be covered include unique challenges that sports startups should expect to face, how startups should approach sports organizations for partnerships, potential for innovation, and more!

Agenda:

6:00-6:15 PM Networking
6:15-7:00 PM Panel
7:00-7:30 PM Q & A between the panel/crowd
7:30-8 PM Networking

You can check out the <a href="http://sportstechpanel.strikingly.com/">Alley Boost: Sports Tech Panel website for more details.

Panel

Jason is the founder of Alley Boost, which is a startup events series that hosts startup mixers, panels, investor nights, and expos in NYC. He is also the founder of Sports Wonks, a sports social network. Jason holds a B.A. from Montclair State University.

As Director of Digital Media for the Brooklyn Nets and Barclays Center, Brooke Eaton oversees strategy and execution across web, mobile, social and email marketing. With a background in digital and sports media, Brooke has worked on a variety of projects including the London and Sochi Olympics, the French Open and the US Open. Brooke is a graduate of Boston University, where she studied Journalism.


Jayne Bussman-Wise oversees the digital marketing efforts on behalf of New York City FC (NYCFC), Major League Soccer’s (MLS) 20th soccer club. She leads a team that manages the club’s website, social media platforms and mobile marketing efforts.

</a>

<a href="https://twitter.com/jasonnabilmalki">

</a>

<a href="https://twitter.com/jasonnabilmalki">

</a>

<a href="https://twitter.com/jasonnabilmalki">

</a>

<a href="https://twitter.com/jasonnabilmalki">

</a>

<a href="https://twitter.com/jasonnabilmalki">

</a>

<a href="https://twitter.com/jasonnabilmalki">

Kiril is a technology generalist and armchair linguist who has spent over 15 years building startups. He cut his teeth as the first engineer at Higher One (NYSE:ONE), led video and flash advertising at DoubleClick (now Google), and served as CTO at search engine ShopWiki and Director of Engineering at Conductor before co-founding GameChanger Media, initially as CTO and now Chief Product Officer, where he oversees strategy and all of product development. 

Wim Sweldens is the CEO and co-founder of Kiswe Mobile an interactive live mobile video provider. Kiswe allows users to pick their own camera angles, replays, and highlights. Previously Wim lead the mobile division and venture group of Alcatel-Lucent. Wim has a PhD from University of Leuven, Belgium. He is also an entrepreneur-in-residence at Columbia University.

Thank you to our sponsors!

Facilitated Growth is a business and management consultancy committed to assisting entrepreneurs seeking expansion through the various phases of the business cycle. 

SportOn is the world’s first full-featured sports messaging application for a new generation of sports fans. As sports fanatics ourselves, we wanted more than just news and scores at our fingertips. We believe sports are all about the experiences you share with your friends and family. SportOn allows you to share those experiences with whom you please, in real-time, no matter where they are around the world. You won't have to switch between multiple apps to communicate your excitement over a score, or a frustration over a penalty. It's simple, it's elegant, and it's the world's first full-featured sports messaging application; we present to you: SportOn.


Sports Mobile Summit is the only conference focused on how mobile technology is impacting fan engagement strategies in the sports industry. Taking place on December 2-3 in LA, Sports Mobile Summit brings together senior execs from across the sports and tech communities for two full days of learning and networking. Participating speakers include the NFL, NHL, Fox Sports, Yahoo Sports, and USA Today.


Think and grow social with Napoleon Media.


</a>We are former television bookers, producers and publicists with over 20 years experience in booking guests on television and radio. We seek resources for Shows upholding the integrity of journalistic standard with each booking. Our niche is not just in finding the guest, but coming up with elements such as potential full-screens, graphics, b-roll and a solid pre-interview. Our team is based in New York City, Washington, DC, Miami, and Nashville. Learn more - <a href="http://guestbooker.com/">http://guestbooker.com/.


Contact: Tiffany Daenecke, Director of Business Development and Talent Booker;[masked] or[masked]
Thank you to our media partner!


AT PEAK is a fitness app that improves athlete performance while reducing sports injuries. AT PEAK app delivers strength and conditioning exercises and video workouts, specific to age, gender and sport, that are designed by medical professionals and based on medical studies that show a 50% reduction in injuries. AT PEAK comes with exercise videos demonstrating proper form and has a social platform where teammates can interact, upload photos, view sports-related video content and challenge one another in skills and trivia contests. Teams can sign up for AT PEAK by contacting [masked], and individuals can download AT PEAK for FREE through the Apple App Store, search AT PEAK SPORTS. 

All sales are final.
results.name: Alley Boost: Sports Tech Panel

We hope that you will consider becoming or renewing your status as a "Pints 'n' Purls Contributor."  These voluntary dues help cover the costs of running the group, which include dues to Meetup.com, prizes for events, thank yous for hosts, etc.   ALL the money goes back into the group.  We are just hoping that you will share in some of the expenses that come out of organizing these fun and friendly events.  You can pay online or in person ($24/year- We organize over 70 meetups a year.)

results.description:
Tonight we will talk about Ink and Bone (The Great Library #1) by Rachel Caine as our Book of the Month. Ruthless and supremely powerful, the Great Library is now a presence in every major city, governing the flow of knowledge to the masses. Alchemy allows the Library to deliver the content of the greatest works of history instantly—but the personal ownership of books is expressly forbidden.

Jess Brightwell believes in the value of the Library, but the majority of his knowledge comes from illegal books obtained by his family, who are involved in the thriving black market. Jess has been sent to be his family’s spy, but his loyalties are tested in the final months of his training to enter the Library’s service.

When he inadvertently commits heresy by creating a device that could change the world, Jess discovers that those who control the Great Library believe that knowledge is more valuable than any human life—and soon both heretics and books will burn.…

We will also be choosing our next title for our next meetup. Come out, have some fun, chat about all things Ink and Bone and books!

Happy reading!!!
results.name: Let's Discuss Ink and Bone (The Great Library #1) as Book of the Month

results.description:
Updated March 8th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside as a backup.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

results.description:
Weather: Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.

Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play. 
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup? 
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be? 
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like? 
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything? 
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome? 
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect? 
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions? 
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
WOW !  SOCCER (football) BOOTCAMP? Right After Work? 

 YES, YES, YES !  GET IN SHAPE WITH FIT AND FUN !!   

TIME TO GET OFF THE COUCH AND GET IN SHAPE FOR THE SUMMER ! 

We will get together at 100th st and Central Park West

Stretch, Do a mini Exercise Boot Camp and LEARN to Play SOCCER. 

for BEGINNERS 

If you are an advanced Soccer player, you are welcome to join in the drills and exercise and play in our beginner game at the end of the session. Bring a ball. 

!!!!! Sign up fast, Only 25 spaces open for this event.  We Encourage first timers to come out and have fun!

PS Ladies, We always have too many men! :-)

Ladies and Gentlemen, you will be learning some basic techniques, getting Boot Camp style exercise and play in a fun easy going SOCCER GAME the first day ! WOOOHOOO !!!

LADIES: Maybe this will be your soccer partner for the lesson!

      Or GUYS, Maybe this will be your partner for the soccer game! Hmmm....

SCHEDULE:


We will stretch for the first 5 minutes

10 minutes of passing, receiving and ball handling drills

then we will play a "BEGINNER ONLY"game until the sun sets behind us!  :-)

IF YOU ARE A MORE ADVANCED PLAYER, YOU MUST BRING YOUR OWN BALL AS WE WILL ONLY HAVE BALLS FOR THE BEGINNERS TO USE IN BOOT CAMP.

WHAT YOU NEED TO BRING ! Water, Snacks if you havent had dinner before you arrive.!

You also need to bring your cross trainers, running shoes or turf cleats, shorts or exercise pants.

DIRECTIONS :::  B or C SubwayTrain to 103rd street, walk South 3 Blocks to100st St. and walk into CENTRAL PARK

Try to be there before 6:15pm! We will be finished at 7:45pm.


************************************************************

George, Fit and Fun Organizer 


FIT AND FUN SINGLES !
results.name: Singles Co-ed Soccer for Beginners: Lessons, Exercise Bootcamp / game
