results.description:
Join us for an advanced screening of the highly anticipated film that's getting some early Oscar Buzz, SICARIO on Tuesday, Sept 15 at the AMC Kips Bay Theater on 2nd Avenue at 32nd Street. Show time is 7:00PM, but please arrive at the theater no later than 6:30PM to guarantee admission to the film.


More details here:

* scheduled to have a screening on Tues, Sept 15 at 7:00pm.  Get there by 6:15/6:30pm to guarantee admission

* we have 40 slots, so this is a NYC Dads Group members only event (Members will be allowed to RSVP with a +1)

* RSVP by monday at noon, Sept 15, when we have to provide the final list

*Theater: AMC Kips Bay on 2nd Ave at 32nd Street . THEATER LOCATION IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE TO ANOTHER TIMES SQUARE LOCATION.


The screening company, Allied-THA will have a table set up, so members can just go inside to the Allied-THA table inside the theater.  

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

SICARIO Advance Screening


Tuesday, September 15th

7pm at a Manhattan Theater, AMC Kips Bay

Social Media Hashtag: #Sicario


Synopsis: In Mexico, SICARIO means hitman. In the lawless border area stretching between the U.S. and Mexico, an idealistic FBI agent (Emily Blunt) is enlisted by an elite government task force official (Josh Brolin) to aid in the escalating war against drugs. Led by an enigmatic consultant with a questionable past (Benicio Del Toro), the team sets out on a clandestine journey forcing Kate to question everything that she believes in order to survive.

TRAILER: http://trailers.apple.com/trailers/lions_gate/sicario/

COMING TO NY THEATERS SEPTEMBER 18

results.description:
Want to kickstart your fall? Join us for refreshments and a glimpse into our 19-week bootcamp program that transforms beginners into full-stack web developers! 

Thinking about switching careers and becoming a software developer? Interested in learning how to code? Dev Bootcamp is a 19-week intensive program for beginners, dabblers, and those with some prior programming experience. Our monthly open house gives you the inside scoop from Dev Bootcamp students, instructors, and alumni.  

Hear from members of our community about why they chose Dev Bootcamp, what they learned, and what they do after. Hear from staff and instructors about our educational style, resources, and application process. Tour our space and imagine what it would be like to come here and solve problems, build things, and learn something new.

Have you already been accepted to Dev Bootcamp? Join us to hear from our alumni and meet our instructors. Get a feel for what it's like to attend Dev Bootcamp, our curriculum, and our learning environment, and meet other accepted students. 


Agenda:
6:00 Accepted students meetup: meet with other accepted students, alumni and staff
6:15 Tour #1 (you can take a tour before or after the Info Session)
6:30-7:15 Info Session: Panel of current students, alumni, and staff
7:15 Tour #2 (you can take a tour before or after the Info Session)
7:15-7:30 Mingle and wrap-up 

Can't make this event? Come in for a tour on Tuesday or Wednesday between 5:30 and 7pm.
Sign up here for a tour here

Questions? Email [masked] or read our FAQ page.

results.description:
This is such a fun wine tasting and sells out every time! If you are new to wine or a die hard fan, it's a great experience for all! Walk table to table at your own pace to sample each wine. 

You will get a wine glass that you can have filled as many times as you'd like.  There are 3 tables or stations where they will be pouring the wines and explaining each one.  There is also a table full of appetizers! 

Socialize and network in a relaxed atmosphere during one of our very popular walk around wine tasting events. Unlike other wine tastings where you are stuck at one table, this walk around format gives you the opportunity to easily meet other members and wine enthusiasts.  

You will enjoy up to 24 different wines all carefully explained by Vinoversity’s friendly and knowledgeable sommeliers. Just $29 to taste 24 wines (normally $33).  Price will go up as event gets closer.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT. Must purchase ticket in advance at this link below (limited space and no tickets sold at door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Sep-15-2015_at_0630PM

What kinds of wine/apps?  24 whites, reds, sparklers, rose's, & dessert wines. These wines will not disappoint, and will amaze you with their unique flavors, styles, and mineralities. A super tasting from an incredible wine region! Complimentary cheeses, dips, olives, & flatbreads will be served. 

Can I come alone?  Yes 90%  attending come on their own. 

Do I need to know about wine? No, most come for socializing, learning and the enjoyment of wine.

What's dress code? Wear what you had on at work.  It is a casual and comfortable atmosphere. 

Who will be there? This is a multi-Meetup event so don't just go by RSVP's here. There will be 40+ others there.

What are the ages?  This is non-age specific event.  We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang and taste with. 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance?  Yes.  Space is limited. This a Prepay Only Event. Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Sep-15-2015_at_0630PM
results.name: Wine Tasting Social - Enjoy 24 Wines + Light Apps (PREPAY ONLY EVENT)

Look into 12 weeks full time program, apply for Sept 2015 and Jan 2016 program to be a Data Scientist.

LayoutHTML ContentHeadersFormatted textImages

Adding widgets

results.description:
Come out and play some games, hang out, have fun and may be make some new friends.


This is a co-event with the Queens NYC Board Games Meetup. So there will be more people than you see on this group RSVP list. Average attendee count is 10-15 people.

Leave a comment if you are bringing or want to play any game. It's totally OK if you do not bring anything. We'll most likely have enough games for everyone to play. If you are new to games, we'll teach you how to play. New-comers are always welcome.

The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there. Please support them by making purchases of food & drink while we are using their establishment. We want to keep a good relationship with them so we can continue to meet up there.


Note: On occasions the Steinway Billiard Cafe has special events or is simply too crowded to accommodate our group, we would move to the Panera Bread a block away on 35th Ave.


If you want to join our board game Facebook group to connect with other gamers, please join us here: https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/

results.description:
Speed Dating - Ages 26 to 39
WHEN: Tuesday, September 15th , 2015
6:30 PM - 8:30 PM (Check-in at 6:20)
WHERE: Playwright (27 West 35th St.)

Get Your Tickets At This Link: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speeddatingnewyork.html

PRICE: $34  (Must Pre-Pay Online. No Tickets Sold At Event Door)
(We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because once we fill up for a certain gender we will list event as sold out for that gender. Sign up now to secure your spot).

The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup

EVENT DETAILS:
Speed dating is so much fun and a great way to meet quality, single professionals in the busy city of NYC. Most people know within a few minutes if they would like to see someone again. We may be biased but we definitely think this is a much better way to meet people than online dating or at a random bar.

You will go on between 8 and 15 mini dates lasting between 4 and 7 minutes each (we lengthen or shorten the date time according to how many people attend). Women stay seated and the men rotate from table to table until they meet each woman.

You will get a match card and at the end of each mini date you'll discreetly indicate whether or not you'd like to see the person again. At the end of the evening you will hand your match card in to the event host. If you both select each other, we will send you each others' email address the next day so you can set up a future date!

GET YOUR TICKETS AT THIS LINK: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speeddatingnewyork.html

FAQ:

WHAT IS THE DRESS CODE?
Please no sneakers, t-shirts or gym attire.

CAN I PAY AT THE EVENT DOOR?
We do no accept payment at the event door. You must pre-pay online.

WHEN WILL I GET MY MATCHES EMAILED TO ME?
We will email you matches within 48 hours after the event.

IS THERE A REFUND POLICY?
If you need to cancel, please email us and we can transfer you to a future event. However we do not offer refunds if you cancel on the day of the event or don't show up.

WHO IS ATTENDING?
The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup. You can feel free to RSVP page to let the group know you're attending but you still have to go to the above link to pay for the event.

GET YOUR TICKETS AT THIS LINK: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speeddatingnewyork.html
results.name: Speed Dating - Ages 26 to 39

You will go on between 8 and 15 mini dates lasting between 4 and 7 minutes each (we lengthen or shorten the date time according to how many people attend). Women stay seated and the men rotate from table to table until they meet each woman.

You will get a match card and at the end of each mini date you'll discreetly indicate whether or not you'd like to see the person again. At the end of the evening you will hand your match card in to the event host. If you both select each other, we will send you each others' email address the next day so you can set up a future date!

GET YOUR TICKETS AT THIS LINK: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speeddatingnewyork.html

FAQ:

WHAT IS THE DRESS CODE?
Please no sneakers, t-shirts or gym attire.

CAN I PAY AT THE EVENT DOOR?
We do no accept payment at the event door. You must pre-pay online.

WHEN WILL I GET MY MATCHES EMAILED TO ME?
We will email you matches within 48 hours after the event.

IS THERE A REFUND POLICY?
If you need to cancel, please email us and we can transfer you to a future event. However we do not offer refunds if you cancel on the day of the event or don't show up.

WHO IS ATTENDING?
The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup. You can feel free to RSVP page to let the group know you're attending but you still have to go to the above link to pay for the event.

GET YOUR TICKETS AT THIS LINK: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speeddatingnewyork.html
results.name: Speed Dating - Ages 26 to 39

results.description: Come meet other NYC travel lovers! Find some travel buddies and learn about some of our trips. Good people, good times.
results.how_to_find_us: Location change! Go to the second floor in Atwood!
results.name: Happy hour to meet other group members

group.name: NYCers Who Love to Travel for 20s & 30s

results.description:
Join us every Tuesday 6:30-8:30 all summer long! Intercambio is an “exchange” (as translated in English) of language and culture in a friendly atmosphere. The primary purpose is to provide an open forum for both English and Spanish learners to practice their conversational skills with native speakers. Intercambio is an essential compliment to formal language study, as it exposes participants to everyday dialects, idiomatic expressions and usages that are best explained by a native speaker.

Intercambio is free and all skill levels are welcome!
results.name: Intercambio - Spanish/English language exchange

group.name: El Centro, volunteer led language classes in Midtown

results.description:
This is such a fun wine tasting and sells out every time! If you are new to wine or a die hard fan, it's a great experience for all! Walk table to table at your own pace to sample each wine. 

You will get a wine glass that you can have filled as many times as you'd like.  There are 3 tables or stations where they will be pouring the wines and explaining each one.  There is also a table full of appetizers! 

Socialize and network in a relaxed atmosphere during one of our very popular walk around wine tasting events. Unlike other wine tastings where you are stuck at one table, this walk around format gives you the opportunity to easily meet other members and wine enthusiasts.  

You will enjoy up to 24 different wines all carefully explained by Vinoversity’s friendly and knowledgeable sommeliers. Just $29 to taste 24 wines (normally $33).  Price will go up as event gets closer.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT. Must purchase ticket in advance at this link below (limited space and no tickets sold at door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Sep-15-2015_at_0630PM

What kinds of wine/apps?  24 whites, reds, sparklers, rose's, & dessert wines. These wines will not disappoint, and will amaze you with their unique flavors, styles, and mineralities. A super tasting from an incredible wine region! Complimentary cheeses, dips, olives, & flatbreads will be served. 

Can I come alone?  Yes 90%  attending come on their own. 

Do I need to know about wine? No, most come for socializing, learning and the enjoyment of wine.

What's dress code? Wear what you had on at work.  It is a casual and comfortable atmosphere. 

Who will be there? This is a multi-Meetup event so don't just go by RSVP's here. There will be 40+ others there.

What are the ages?  This is non-age specific event.  We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang and taste with. 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance?  Yes.  Space is limited. This a Prepay Only Event. Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Sep-15-2015_at_0630PM
results.name: Wine Tasting Social - Enjoy 24 Wines + Light Apps (PREPAY ONLY EVENT)

group.name: #1 NYC Singles Group - Meet, Mix, & Mingle

results.description:
Join NYC's hottest fashionistas for this special Pre-Fashion Week Rooftop Mixer!  200+ attend every time we host this event!! 

This is a FREE multi-group event with a great fashion show, drink & food specials, DJ, and breath taking views of the Manhattan Skyline at NYC's highest luxury penthouse/rooftop! 

• Drink & Food Specials until 7pm

• DJ spins from 7pm-11pm!

• LIVE FASHION SHOW starts @ 9:30pm!

• Meet the models and designer after the show 

• Professional Photography (Cameras allowed) 

• NO COVER.  Just RSVP w/ group & say MEETUP at door 

Come check out the hottest fashion trends of the season! 

Fellow Meetup organizer Lyndon will be your host on 34th Fl (where DJ is located).  Optional name tags will be available. 

Dress: Business Casual. No shorts, sneakers, sweats, hats.  Jeans ok.  21+. 

MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. 200+ WILL BE ATTENDING. RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.
results.how_to_find_us: 34th fl - ask for your host Lyndon by DJ booth
results.name: FREE Rooftop Fashion Mixer (Fashion Show, DJ, Drink/Food Specials)

results.description:
This event is intended for people who have coded and identify as a woman.  


One of the most common pieces of feedback we get from members is how much everyone loves the opportunity to chat with other female developers of all experience levels, and "just be us." And it was a big part of our motivation for founding the NYC chapter.

So we created an event to focus on chatting and getting to know each other better!

Inspired by eXtreme Tuesday Club, we'll be meeting at a bar that's great for conversation, and simply enjoy each others' company and our beverage of choice (beverages not sponsored by Write/Speak/Code, sorry! If your company wants to help out, though, message us.) 

This event is open for evolution and reinterpretation, so feel free to bring bar-friendly games (DevOps Against Humanity, anyone?), and ideas!
results.name: Our inaugural Dev-Ladies' Night!

Every Tuesday, 6:30p at Adelante Studios we are sweatin' it up Groovefit World Dance style!

This class is dance aerobics taken to the next level! All of your favorite world rhythms set to sassy choreography! 

Our group is always fun and welcoming! This week we'll be bringing the Uptown Funk!

Come dance for the sweat of it!

Samba, Salsa, West African, Middle Eastern, Bollywood, reggae, and more....

venue.name: Microsoft

results.description:
Dan Hermes speaks about navigation and how to give your users what they need to get around your Xamarin app quickly, moving from screen to screen with confidence and ease. Menus, tappable icons, buttons, tabs, and lists all offer a user ways to navigate your app. Dan will discuss industry-standard approaches for tying an app’s screens together in an elegant and usable way called navigation design patterns, based upon the concepts in his new book, Xamarin Mobile Application Development. Here are the most common mobile UI navigation patterns used in Xamarin development:

• Hierarchical

• Modal

• Drill-down list

• Navigation drawer

• Tabs

• Springboard

• Carousel


Learn how to use these navigation patterns in Xamarin.Forms and how to approach them in Xamarin.Android and Xamarin.iOS. Moving between screens also requires passing data between them. Dan will talk about different ways to maintain state during navigation.


You will learn about how to:

• Create navigation to get your user from screen-to-screen

• Create many kinds of menus

• Manage state and passing data between pages

• Combine navigation patterns to form a complete app

Speaker

Dan Hermes is a Xamarin MVP, software consultant, and founder of Lexicon Systems, an award-winning Xamarin and .NET consulting firm. Dan helps developers create great mobile apps and helps businesses develop a winning mobile strategy. His firm's recent Xamarin projects include a cross-platform app for Thermo Fisher Scientific which won a W3, a Davey award, and was a finalist for a Xammy award. Dan’s clientele includes dozens of software-building firms such as Fidelity Investments, EDS, and Computerworld Magazine. He speaks at conferences and teaches software development at colleges, developer user groups, and corporate training centers. A contemporary Renaissance man, Dan is also active in the arts. He is a recognized composer, his classical crossover music having aired on National Public Radio (NPR). He is also an active digital artist, exhibiting his work internationally, and a founding director of Art Technology New England (ATNE).

Dan is the author of a new book entitled Xamarin Mobile Application Development. His blog is http://mobilecsharpcafe.com/.
results.how_to_find_us: 6th Floor - Central Park East
results.name: Xamarin Navigation Patterns

results.description:
Join us at the Sony Wonder Lab on Madison Ave. for a screening of the documentary "Big Dream" + Q&A panel discussion featuring Cassidy from Big Dream, Shawndra from Microsoft, Rachel from Jet and a student from Pace University. 

Big Dream follows the intimate stories of seven young women who are breaking barriers and overcoming personal challenges to follow their passion in science, math, computing & engineering. From small town Iowa to the bustling streets of the Middle East, Big Dream immerses viewers in a world designed by and for the inspiring next generation of girls. 

Learn more about Big Dream.  

Attendees are welcome to bring their middle school- or high school- age daughters. Please message the organizer. 

Microsoft is pleased to underwrite and co-produce the Big Dream documentary directed by Kelly Cox and co-produced by Iron Way Films. This event is also sponsored by Jet. 

This screening is FREE, but we do need you to RSVP. Please join us on Sept. 15.  

###

Meet the Panel:

• Rachel Reese is a long-time software engineer and math geek who can often be found talking to random strangers about the joys of functional programming and F#. She currently works for Jet.com in NYC. She has helped run the Nashville F# User group, @NashFSharp, and the Burlington, VT functional programming user group, @VTFun. She's also an ASPInsider, an F# MVP, a Xamarin MVP, a community enthusiast, one of the founding @lambdaladies and a Rachii.


• Cassidy Williams is a software engineer and developer evangelist at Clarifai. She comes from a software engineering and developer evangelism background, after graduating with a computer science degree from Iowa State University. As an avid public speaker and one of Glamour Magazine's 35 Women Under 35 Who Are Changing the Tech Industry, Cassidy has worked with hackathons, meetups, conferences and events around the country.

• Shawndra Hill is a senior researcher at Microsoft Research NYC and an adjunct associate professor in the Operations and Information Management at the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania, where she is an Annenberg Public Policy Center Distinguished Research Fellow, a Wharton Customer Analytics Initiative Senior Fellow, and a core member of the Penn Social Media and Health Innovation Lab and the Warren Center for Network and Data Sciences.


• Briana Vecchione is a senior CS major at Pace University in NYC with an interest in data science for social tech. She's previously worked for Microsoft Research and the Federal Reserve Board of Governors and has presented at the ACM SIGKDD at Bloomberg and ACM Richard Tapia Celebration of Diversity in Computing, where her team was awarded 2nd place nationwide for undergraduate research.
results.name: "Big Dream" Screening at Sony Wonder Lab

results.description:
Speed Dating - Ages 26 to 39
WHEN: Tuesday, September 15th , 2015
6:30 PM - 8:30 PM (Check-in at 6:20)
WHERE: Playwright (27 West 35th St.)

Get Your Tickets At This Link: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speeddatingnewyork.html

PRICE: $34  (Must Pre-Pay Online. No Tickets Sold At Event Door)
(We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because once we fill up for a certain gender we will list event as sold out for that gender. Sign up now to secure your spot).

The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup

EVENT DETAILS:
Speed dating is so much fun and a great way to meet quality, single professionals in the busy city of NYC. Most people know within a few minutes if they would like to see someone again. We may be biased but we definitely think this is a much better way to meet people than online dating or at a random bar.

You will go on between 8 and 15 mini dates lasting between 4 and 7 minutes each (we lengthen or shorten the date time according to how many people attend). Women stay seated and the men rotate from table to table until they meet each woman.

You will get a match card and at the end of each mini date you'll discreetly indicate whether or not you'd like to see the person again. At the end of the evening you will hand your match card in to the event host. If you both select each other, we will send you each others' email address the next day so you can set up a future date!

GET YOUR TICKETS AT THIS LINK: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speeddatingnewyork.html

FAQ:

WHAT IS THE DRESS CODE?
Please no sneakers, t-shirts or gym attire.

CAN I PAY AT THE EVENT DOOR?
We do no accept payment at the event door. You must pre-pay online.

WHEN WILL I GET MY MATCHES EMAILED TO ME?
We will email you matches within 48 hours after the event.

IS THERE A REFUND POLICY?
If you need to cancel, please email us and we can transfer you to a future event. However we do not offer refunds if you cancel on the day of the event or don't show up.

WHO IS ATTENDING?
The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup. You can feel free to RSVP page to let the group know you're attending but you still have to go to the above link to pay for the event.

GET YOUR TICKETS AT THIS LINK: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speeddatingnewyork.html

You will get a match card and at the end of each mini date you'll discreetly indicate whether or not you'd like to see the person again. At the end of the evening you will hand your match card in to the event host. If you both select each other, we will send you each others' email address the next day so you can set up a future date!

GET YOUR TICKETS AT THIS LINK: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speeddatingnewyork.html

FAQ:

WHAT IS THE DRESS CODE?
Please no sneakers, t-shirts or gym attire.

CAN I PAY AT THE EVENT DOOR?
We do no accept payment at the event door. You must pre-pay online.

WHEN WILL I GET MY MATCHES EMAILED TO ME?
We will email you matches within 48 hours after the event.

IS THERE A REFUND POLICY?
If you need to cancel, please email us and we can transfer you to a future event. However we do not offer refunds if you cancel on the day of the event or don't show up.

WHO IS ATTENDING?
The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup. You can feel free to RSVP page to let the group know you're attending but you still have to go to the above link to pay for the event.

GET YOUR TICKETS AT THIS LINK: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speeddatingnewyork.html

results.description:
Please join us this month for an open night of lightning talks!

This is a great opportunity to show off a recent project you've been working on or expose the group to an XP practice that you're excited about. Want to talk about how your team runs retros? Great! Built a tool to improve your team's efficiency? Outstanding! Let's hear about it!

The topics will be wide-ranging and fun. Anything that XP enthusiasts might enjoy is fair game. Talks should be roughly 5 - 10 min in length with time for questions. No need to get your talk pre-registered or approved - just come prepared with a topic and we'll put you on stage!

results.description:
This is such a fun wine tasting and sells out every time! If you are new to wine or a die hard fan, it's a great experience for all! Walk table to table at your own pace to sample each wine. 

You will get a wine glass that you can have filled as many times as you'd like.  There are 3 tables or stations where they will be pouring the wines and explaining each one.  There is also a table full of appetizers! 

Socialize and network in a relaxed atmosphere during one of our very popular walk around wine tasting events. Unlike other wine tastings where you are stuck at one table, this walk around format gives you the opportunity to easily meet other members and wine enthusiasts.  

You will enjoy up to 24 different wines all carefully explained by Vinoversity’s friendly and knowledgeable sommeliers. Just $29 to taste 24 wines (normally $33).  Price will go up as event gets closer.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT. Must purchase ticket in advance at this link below (limited space and no tickets sold at door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Sep-15-2015_at_0630PM

What kinds of wine/apps?  24 whites, reds, sparklers, rose's, & dessert wines. These wines will not disappoint, and will amaze you with their unique flavors, styles, and mineralities. A super tasting from an incredible wine region! Complimentary cheeses, dips, olives, & flatbreads will be served. 

Can I come alone?  Yes 90%  attending come on their own. 

Do I need to know about wine? No, most come for socializing, learning and the enjoyment of wine.

What's dress code? Wear what you had on at work.  It is a casual and comfortable atmosphere. 

Who will be there? This is a multi-Meetup event so don't just go by RSVP's here. There will be 40+ others there.

What are the ages?  This is non-age specific event.  We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang and taste with. 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance?  Yes.  Space is limited. This a Prepay Only Event. Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Sep-15-2015_at_0630PM
results.name: Wine Tasting Social - Enjoy 24 Wines + Light Apps (PREPAY ONLY EVENT)

results.description:
The new and fun way to find your new roommate. Whether you want to meet some people to find a new place with, or if you have a spare room you'd like to fill, this is a fun and social way to get it done.

Why sort through hundreds of e-mails to set up roommate interviews, only to get rejected?

Why spend an entire weekend letting strangers into your house?

It's a casual and fun event that allows you to have a drink with potential roommates and see if there is any roommate chemistry brewing. Best of all, there is no charge to come to the event. Yes, it's FREE.

This is a casual session where members are invited to show off what they're working on or are interested in.  What you demo doesn't have to be your own work!


• You don't have to demo - you can simply attend to watch others demo

• You can demo something you think is cool, but that you didn't write

Demos are limited to 5 minutes and should be presented as a mini lighting talk. The best demo of the evening will receive a gift certificate to Amazon! If you'd like to demo, please send a brief description to: [masked]

Members are also welcome to bring problems for group brainstorming.

results.description:
Hello everyone!


     This is an email reminder that The Down Town Glee Club will be holding its regularly scheduled rehearsal on Tuesday (tomorrow) at 6:30pm.  Please reply to this email, text, or call me to confirm that you will be attending.  


     You may also reply to let me know whether or not you will be singing with us for the season, just so I have that information updated for future emails.


     Finally, please bring your binder(s) to rehearsal.  We have a number of binders missing from our last concert, so if you happen to have a music binder at home, I ask that you bring them in soon!  

      I hope to see some of you who have joined our Meetup group at our rehearsal tomorrow!  Attending regular rehearsals is key to a great performance, so don't be shy and come on downtown to sing with us!


Sincerely,


Michael Tedesco

President, DTGC

<a>[masked]</a>

Our September meetup will give us a peek into the digital transformation of financial services (FinTech) from some of the leaders in NYC’s most important financial institutions. Speakers from Bloomberg, Morgan Stanley, Code2Work, and Infor will share insights on the financial services industry embracing the evolution and growth of FinTech and how to get front and center for internships at their companies.


RSVP to reserve your spot for the event. It will be held at CUNY’s own BMCC Fiterman Hall. There will be a chance to network and have snacks on their lovely rooftop (weather permitting).

ALL ATTENDEES MUST BRING ID.

results.description:
Come out and play some games, hang out, have fun and may be make some new friends.

Leave a comment if you are bringing any games. But it's totally OK if you do not. We'll most likely have enough games for everyone to play. If you are new to games, we'll teach you how to play. New-comers are always welcome.

If your plans change and you can't make it, please update your RSVP.

The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there. Please support them by making purchases of food & drink while we are using their establishment. Do not bring outside food/drink. And don't forget to tip the wait staff. We want to keep a good relationship with them so we can continue to hold our meet ups there.

Come join our board game Facebook group to stay in touch.

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/

Note: On some occasions the Steinway Billiard Cafe has special events or is simply too crowded to accommodate our group, we would move to the Panera Bread a block away on 35th Ave. When this happen there'll be an announcement in the comment section of this page.
results.name: Tuesday Astoria Board Game meet up

results.description:
Let's "Dance like nobody is watching!" Annia aka Q-heat, takes her dance training, heritage, and fitness goals to create an hour of "A whole lotta happy." Annia's judgment free-dance-fitness zone is jam packed with cardio, calorie blasting moves, songs to sing along to, and smiles (you must smile)! There are no excuses for not having a good time. Moves are designed to be modified for all fitness levels.  Annia has fitness goals of her own and understands her students-so let's do this!

Let's embark on this journey together...NO excuses!

results.description:
Would like to invite you to come discuss in a relaxed, comfortable and informal setting ways to make a difference in moving your organization ahead.

Learn strategies at our upcoming workshop and event that will provide pragmatic ways to handle your business challenges. This event is free no admission will be charged to attend.

Bring your business plan, executive summary and pitch us on why we need to invest in your company. Please share this with those interested in connecting & gaining access to funding. Come meet funding experts from Level FIVE Consulting.

Level Five is a Management Consulting firm with practical, real life, C-Suite leadership experience across various industries and specialize in helping organizations go from good to great by providing strategy, execution, and funding support.

Level Five clients include both for profit and non-profit organizations desiring sustainable breakthrough results.

If you would like to find out strategies to transform your business from “good to great” and build a foundation for growth, then attend.

6:30 - 7:15 Networking.

7:15 - 7:20 Speaker Introduction.

7:20 - 7:40 Guest Speaker.

7:40 - 8:00 Q & A with Guest Speaker and more Networking
results.name: Building on Your Greatness. We Want To Invest In Your Business, Come Tell Us Why

results.description:
The DBA meetings have grown recently and they are a good place to meet other people interested in building a community network. These meetings are very informal social gatherings. No technical knowledge is required. We welcome new members!

Our network is expanding quite fast and there are a lot of exciting ideas floating around. If you want to see what we've been doing lately you can follow us on twitter.com/nycmesh.

We have a FAQ that helps to explain our network. If you are ready to buy and install a router you can fill in our form.


We will have a few preconfigured routers available to purchase at the meeting. You can take them home plug them in, and be on the mesh. Please send us a message here to reserve one. $33 for the indoor router, $55 for the new dual-band indoor and $95 for the outdoor model. Bitcoin and paypal also accepted.

Our latest interview was published a few weeks ago in Technical.ly.
results.how_to_find_us: out the back in the garden

results.description:
A product roadmap is your vision for how a product or product line will help achieve your organization's strategic goals. It is a map of the steps involved in taking your business where you want it to go. It also keeps you from getting lost chasing every shiny object that crosses your path.

A good roadmap inspires buy-in from executives, inspires confidence from customers and salespeople, and commitment from development teams to produce the groundbreaking products that drive significant growth.

A product roadmap is not a project plan, but a communications tool, a statement of intent and direction, and a way of getting everyone in your organization moving in the same direction. It is a map of the road ahead for the value you intend to deliver to your chosen customer.

In this hands-on session, Bruce McCarthy will help you set strategic goals, prioritize initiatives, and learn how to get the buy-in you need to inspire your team to success. Bring your Clark Kent glasses, because this session will make you into the roadmap superhero you always knew you could be!

Outline
- Diagnosing Shiny Object Syndrome
- Deriving product goals from strategy & vision
- Product goals diagnostic
- Objective prioritization
- Quantifying value
- Estimating effort 
- Developing a roadmap 
- Creating benefit-oriented themes 
- Telling a story

Bruce McCarthy, Founder + Chief Product Person at UpUp Labs. Having spent a lifetime as a builder and innovator, Bruce has a passion for understanding customer needs and bringing compelling solutions to market. He has founded three companies and has led teams in organizations ranging from startups to market leaders such as Art Technology Group, Oracle and D&B. His executive-level positions include, most recently, VP of Product at NetProspex. He has demonstrated his leadership in areas ranging from marketing to acquisitions (on both sides of the table) to product management, development and design.

Bruce founded UpUp Labs in 2012 to help product development teams work better together to deliver great products to market faster. He also applies his expertise to building innovative new tools like Reqqs, the smart roadmapping tool, now in limited beta. Bruce is a prolific blogger, as well as an organizer and internationally sought-after speaker at product development, management, and innovation events. He is a regular judge at the Harvard Business School New Venture Competition, and is the organizing force behind the BPMA's PRODiE awards. All of Bruce’s many ProductCamp sessions at locations around North America have been standing-room-only.

---

results.description:
Speed Dating - Ages 26 to 39
WHEN: Tuesday, September 15th , 2015
6:30 PM - 8:30 PM (Check-in at 6:20)
WHERE: Playwright (27 West 35th St.)

PRICE: $34  (Must Pre-Pay Online. No Tickets Sold At Event Door)
(We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because once we fill up for a certain gender we will list event as sold out for that gender. Sign up now to secure your spot).

GET YOUR TICKETS AT THIS LINK: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speeddatingnewyork.html

The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup

EVENT DETAILS:
Speed dating is so much fun and a great way to meet quality, single professionals in the busy city of NYC. Most people know within a few minutes if they would like to see someone again. We may be biased but we definitely think this is a much better way to meet people than online dating or at a random bar.

You will go on between 8 and 15 mini dates each lasting between 3 and 6 minutes each (we lengthen or shorten the date time according to how many people attend). Women stay seated and the men rotate from table to table until they meet each woman.

You will get a match card and at the end of each mini date you'll discreetly indicate whether or not you'd like to see the person again. At the end of the evening you will hand your match card in to the event host. If you both select each other, we will send you each others' email address the next day so you can set up a future date!

GET YOUR TICKETS AT THIS LINK: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speeddatingnewyork.html

FAQ:

WHAT IS THE DRESS CODE?
Please no sneakers, t-shirts or gym attire.

CAN I PAY AT THE EVENT DOOR?
We do no accept payment at the event door. You must pre-pay online.

WHEN WILL I GET MY MATCHES EMAILED TO ME?
We will email you matches within 48 hours after the event.

IS THERE A REFUND POLICY?
If you need to cancel, please email us and we can transfer you to a future event. However we do not offer refunds if you cancel on the day of the event or don't show up.

WHO IS ATTENDING?
The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup. You can feel free to RSVP page to let the group know you're attending but you still have to go to the above link to pay for the event.

GET YOUR TICKETS AT THIS LINK: http://www.ClickMixers.com/speeddatingnewyork.html

An Introduction to NLP 


With Doug O'Brien, NLP Master Trainer


** As of 9/15 @5pm we are closing online RSVPS, please come directly to the event at 247 West 36th St and pay at the door. ($20) **

“There are only a handful of people in the country whom I have personally trained and am totally confident in recommending. Doug O’Brien is one of these few.”
- Anthony Robbins, Author of "Unlimited Power" and “Awaken the Giant Within"

What does Tony Robbins know that most of us do not?

What communication technology is the backbone of what people now refer to as "Tony's technology?"

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lyen3clbTV0

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lyen3clbTV0

Tony Robbins learned NLP from it’s creators back in the 1980’s and used it to create his signature “Firewalk” experience (and all his other programs and techniques). His first book, “Unlimited Power,” is considered by many to be the clearest, most useful introductions to NLP ever published.

Now Doug is here to teach YOU.

Doug now conducts trainings around the globe in success strategies, "Sleight of Mouth," Neo-Ericksonian Hypnotherapy and NLP Certification Training.

Here's what Richard Bandler, the CREATOR of NLP, says about Doug...   “I Highly recommend Doug O’Brien of Doug O’Brien and Associates. He is continually updating and training with the most up-to-date skills I have developed.”

results.description:
There are new rules and <a>regulations</a> concerning the Tuesday <a>night</a> games. Please scroll down and read them all before signing up for the event.


There may not be space for you if you don't.


<a>Table</a> Top Role <a>Playing</a> Game Night!


This is the official <a>RPG game</a> night of the NY SciFi/Fan Meetup Group.

Every Tuesday night we get together to indulge in <a>Table Top RPGs</a>. There are <a>multiple games</a> going on at once, so getting involved in a game is <a>easy</a>.


For those of you unfamiliar with the term, a Table Top RPG (Role <a>Playing</a> Game) is a type of game where the players create characters based on the  story/system available and one person acts as a storyteller. Everyone interacts and works together to <a>create a story</a> and have a few laughs as well.


New Rules for Signing Up:


How to <a>sign up</a>: There will be at leas two <a>games running</a> each week.  You will be able to see who is running, what games are being <a>played</a>, and who is <a>playing</a> below. There will be a total of six spots <a>open</a> in each game, so if a game has filled up you will not be able to join that game. 


When you <a>sign up</a>, leave a comment stating which game you would like to participate in and your name will be added to the roster. If you would like to leave a game or switch over to another game in <a>progress</a>, simply speak to Justin or Cat. They will let you know if there is <a>open</a> space to do so.


If it is your first time <a>attending</a> a game, we have pre-made characters for you to <a>select</a> from. Beginning on your third RPG event, you may choose to make an original character for whatever game you're currently participating in.


Can I run my own game?: If you would like to run your own game, please contact Justin or Cat to reserve a slot.


Need Dice?: Please bring yours if you have some if you need extra I will provide some.

Games Currently Running:

Jutin: Full Steam Ahead 

A new steampunk-inspired RPG by Justin.

Cat: Monster of the Week

A game of investigating and fighting the things that go bump in the night. This campaign is set in a fictional California city a few years after WWII

Current Roster:

Liz

Joseph

Mike

Alden
results.name: NY SciFi & Fantasy Tabletop Role Playing and Game Night

results.description:
Turn up the heat and own your Summer with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your SUMMER with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call

results.description:
The meeting is in the Dorothy Young Arts Center at Drew University. See my notes below for a link to the map and parking information.

Speaker: Dr. Jessica Ingrassellino

Python offers excellent frameworks for unit and integration testing. However, many people don't realize that Python also has tools that have been built for Acceptance Test Driven Development. This talk will focus on Behave, an acceptance test development tool similar to Cucumber. Behave uses Python and Selenium, making available the libraries of both to create robust testing for front end applications.

Dr. Jess Ingrassellino is the Lead QA/Software Engineer in Test at Bitly. She has worked at several startups in lead positions performing exploratory manual testing as well as creating automated frameworks to aid her testing process, and delivers tech talks at many conferences about these testing experiences. Jess is active in the Python Education community as the co-chair of the Pycon Education Summit and as the Founder of Teach Code, a non-profit devoted to helping underserved communities implement code classes as a part of the regular school day. Prior to her career in testing, Jessica was a music teacher for ten years, and currently teaches music for fun on the weekends.
results.name: Acceptance Test Driven Development with Bitly's Lead QA Engineer

results.description:
We're elated to have Ryan Zezeski, kernel hacker and Baltimorean, presenting on The Slab Allocator: An Object-Caching Kernel Memory Allocator by Jeff Bonwick. 

Intro 

In 1994 Jeff Bonwick presented his Slab Allocator at the USENIX SummerTechnical Conference. Over two decades later Google reports 35-thousand results for "slab allocator". CiteSeerX reports 93 citations. And many modern kernel allocators are based on his design, such as illumos, Linux, and FreeBSD. Jeff's design, along with the original paper, remains just as relevant today as it was 21 years ago. Join me as I tell the tale of the Slab Allocator: where it came from, what it is, why it's important, and where it's going.

Bio

</a>Ryan Zezeski (<a href="https://twitter.com/rzezeski">@rzezeski) is an aspiring kernel hacker working at Lucera Financial Infrastructures. A primary contributor to the Riak distributed database. Author of the try-try-try Riak Core tutorials. And creator of project Yokozuna: a program which combined the powers of Riak and Solr. He once wrote a blog post on POSIX Real Time Signals that made a bunch of people mad and caused a bug to be filed against Oracle Solaris. Ryan loves reading about arcane operating system stuff and occasionally writes about it at zinascii.com. His spirit animal is W. Richard Stevens.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

TwoSigma - Platinum Sponsor of the New York chapter

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Details

Doors open at 7 pm; the presentation will begin at 7:30 pm; and, yes, there will be refreshments of all kinds and pizza. 

After Ryan presents the paper, we will open up the floor to discussion and questions.  

We hope that you'll read the paper before the meetup, but don't stress if you can't.  If you have any questions, thoughts, or related information, please visit our *github-thread* on the matter.

Additionally, if you have any papers you want to add to the repository above (papers that you love!), please send us a pull request. Also, if you have any ideas/questions about this meetup or the Papers-We-Love org, just open up an issue.

September's meetup is sponsored by
results.how_to_find_us: Tumblr's office is located between 5th Avenue and Park Avenue South on 21st Street. We're on the Ground Floor.
results.name: Ryan Zezeski's Memory by the Slab: The Tale of Bonwick's Slab Allocator

Claim your own divinity, become attuned to higher energies and learn tools to transform your life. Award-winning author and channel Paul Selig will lead a deeply transformational, channeled workshop where you will work directly with his guides to achieve new levels of healing, self-awareness and life purpose. Through lecture, attunements and energy activations, he will introduce us to techniques for healing ourselves and others, for developing and sustaining higher levels of consciousness, and for releasing emotional blocks that keep us from manifesting our higher nature. Don’t miss this opportunity to work with an inspiring teacher who can help you make transformative breakthroughs on your spiritual journey.


Paul Selig, award-winning author, psychic, and channel, had a spiritual experience in 1987 that left him clairvoyant. He studied a form of energy healing, working at Marianne Williamson’s Manhattan Center for Living and in private practice. Paul began to “hear” for his clients, and much of his work now is as a clairaudient, clairvoyant, channel, and empath. He has led channeled energy groups for many years and, in 2009, he was invited to channel at the Esalen Institute’s Superpowers symposium, where he was filmed for the documentary Authors of the Impossible. His books include I Am the Word, The Book of Love and Creation, and The Book of Knowing and Worth.

results.description:
The New York City Sea Gypsies 


Present

“Return to Adventure: Submarines, Underwater Robots & more… ”  

By Erika Berman


"Submarine Piloting 101"  -  Join submarine pilot Erika Bergman as she takes you deep into the open sea. Discover an antique sunken aircraft and learn how it was captured in 3D it with sophisticated modern software. Come face to face with life in the deep ocean, and learn the ropes to prepare for a dive day. In addition to a brief Submarine Pilot Ground School, Erika will share her passion for expanding the future community of submarine pilots, through Girls Underwater Robot Camps. Then you will have an opportunity to get hands on experience with an OpenROV, and take it out for a spin in a nearby pond. 

About the Speaker:

As a lifelong storyteller turned manned submersible pilot Erika Bergman is a passionate ocean explorer. She studied chemical oceanography at the University of Washington while working as a diesel engineer aboard the tall ship S/V Lady Washington and a steam ship engineer aboard the S/S Virginia V. Since then she has worked as a submersible pilot for exploration, research and filmmaking. Erika is the editor of OpenExplorer.com, a site dedicated to supporting and curating a new era of connected, citizen exploration. She is also the co-founder of Global Engineering & Exploration Counselors, providing a network of engineering camps to girls around the world.

This running group is for anyone who just wants to go for a run and make new friends. If you're looking to get into better shape or become a better runner we can help you with that. But our main focus is to enjoy the run around Central Park.

We run anywhere from 3-6 miles depending on what everyone is looking to do. We will meet at Columbus Circle behind the Gold statue (The Maine Monument)to warm up stretch and have a chance to meet everyone and coordinate the run.

The New York Running company at the Time Warner Center (located on the 2nd floor) has changing rooms, and free bag check also has lockers but you have to bring your own lock and closes at 9pm.

We can start off as a group and run as a group if everyone wants to run at the same pace but others are more than welcome to break up into smaller groups for those of you who might want to run a little faster.

After each run we head to our local bar DJ Reynolds to grab a drink or two and get something to eat and it gives us a chance to get to know each other.

I will post what I'll be wearing and my number in the comments section the day of the run.

results.description:
VENUE: Microsoft, 11 Times Square (8th Avenue between 41 & 42 Streets)

Many of the most popular WordPress commercial plugins started as side-projects. What makes those plugins different than the other 34,000 plugins in the repo? 


During this presentation, Vova Feldman will share his journey as a plugin developer. What started as a side-project in late 2010, turned into a successful lifestyle business with a team of five members. He'll cover his entire four-year experience, how he got into WordPress and the things he learned about commercial plugins economics. He'll also share about the thin line between keeping your users happy and making money. And will explain why freemium plugins are great for the WordPress economy.

Presented by Vova Feldman

OPENING PRESENTATION: WordPress from the perspective of a newbie

This talk discusses Varoujan's experience with WordPress and how he started to get familiar with themes and plugins. He will discuss the challenges he faced when tweaking or modifying layouts. Although initially coding is not required when designing with WordPress; he will eventually have to learn CSS, PHP and HTML, which will become necessary to fine tune the functionality of the site.


Presented by Varoujan Froundjian

WANT TO SWITCH TO HTTPS?

If you would like help safely migrating your WordPress site from HTTP to HTTPS, an HTTPS Bar will be open offering one-on-one support as part of the help desk.

GET ONE-ON-ONE ASSISTANCE AT OUR HELP DESK:  

Our experts will be available throughout the evening to help you with your WordPress issues and answer your questions.

ABOUT THE SPEAKERS:

Vova Feldman is a serial entrepreneur, and full stack developer who loves to provide simple solutions to complex problems, by leveraging technology. He co-founded Senexx (acquired by Gartner) and built a successful plugins business with Rating-Widget. Currently, Vova is focused on Freemius helping WordPress plugin developers around the globe make a living doing what they love. By providing an all-in-one, monetization platform, to commercialize any plugin in minutes.


Varoujan Froundjian is a graphic artist, digital painter using Procreate App on iPad, and writer. He had designed logos, PR material and worked on branding of business ventures. He completed his graphic novel, “A diary of a Doodle Man” which is in process of revisions.  He got into WordPress only recently and finds the software both exciting and challenging. He enjoys learning about WordPress and to share his beginner’s experience with the WordPress community.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Image is Everything:  How to Style and Create a Killer Lookbook

Lookbooks are one of the most important marketing tools for emerging designers to show their new creations to prospective buyers and PR.  Your brand has a distinct personality and image to portray to existing and potential customers.  Styling plays an integral role in how brand and product messages are communicated and in turn interpreted by an audience. 

About Gemma:

Let us introduce you to Gemma Sherlock.  Gemma who is Ireland born and bred, living in New York, is a Stylist and Image Consultant knows a thing or two about style.

With a solid grounding in marketing (in which she worked for many years), Gemma has long-cultivated her knowledge of brands and image and their influence on the world around them.

This one thing she learned: Image is everything.

Over the course of her career, she has worked with global and local brands alike, ensuring that their marketing communications succeeded in making people think and feel about them in a particular way.  Gemma has worked on numerous commercial and editorial projects, for both start up and more established brands - her client list includes:

ABSOLUT Vodka, Jameson Irish Whiskey, Powers Irish Whiskey, PADDY Irish Whiskey, Beefeater Gin, West Coast Cooler, Belfast Fashion Week, Three Mobile, Baileys Irish Cream, Siopaella, Raw Art Chic, Gráinne Maher, Blondedge.com, Coldlilies.com and major luxury retail stores.

Here’s What You Will Learn:

In this workshop, Gemma will teach you the fashion industry insider tips and tricks for creating a killer lookbook while leaving you with the tools you need to create a lookbook on your own that best represents your brand.  This is perfect if you are launching your fashion brand, creating your ecommerce site, or if you’re an aspiring fashion stylist, everyone is welcome!

Some topics that Gemma will cover:

•  What makes a great lookbook?

•  Digital versus Print Lookbooks?  Do you need both?

•  Creating an inspiration board

•  Casting a production team

•  Preparing a shooting schedule for your lookbook

•  Creating and styling the looks that best represent your brand

•  Shooting the lookbook


When:  Tuesday, September 15, 2015

Time:  7:00pm-9:00 pm  (Q&A session at 8:30pm)

Where:  The Fashion Potential HQ

    116 West 23rd Street, 5th floor

    New York, NY 10011

Cost:  $39

results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:50 pm, Thu. 11 am – 12 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

 

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

results.description:
On September 15th, we will be taking a break from working out for a great night at the REI SoHo store in NYC, come join us! Paul Rosolie will be giving an exciting and informative presentation about the Amazon Rainforest. Check out the description below:

Few places on the planet are as mysterious and awe-inspiring as the Amazon Rainforest. Join naturalist and explorer Paul Rosolie for an interactive report from the field - rare wildlife, new-to-science ecosystems, uncontacted tribes, and how you can go where few ever have. Paul founded Tamandua Expeditions and will discuss his past experiences leading groups, his solo treks deep into the jungle, and give ground level perspective of the conservation effort in the Amazon Rainforest. Paul is a United Nations award winning wildlife film maker, author of the book 'Mother of God: An Extraordinary Journey into the Uncharted Tributaries of the Western Amazon,' and was featured on the Discovery Channel this past year. Join us to learn what is needed to protect our planet's most important biome.

Sign up for free and get more information here:

http://www.rei.com/events/a-journey-to-the-amazon-rainforest/new-york/123893


Pick up and bring a copy of Paul's book and he will be available to sign it after the talk is over. Check it out here:

http://www.amazon.com/Mother-God-Extraordinary-Uncharted-Tributaries/dp/0062259512


This event is organized by Tamandua Expeditions (http://tamanduajungle.com/). I hope to see you there for this fun night!

results.description:
Open Office Hours

Meeting every Tuesday evening, 7:00PM - 10:00PM

This month's host: iHeartRadio (http://jobs.iheart.com/)


Office hours is open to developers of any background and skill level. Newcomers to programming, Python, or NYC are all welcome, as well as experienced programmers and locals. The purpose of this event is to promote learning and community involvement within the NYC Python community.

Activities vary and may include (but are not limited to):

Informal tech talks: Topics can be anything related to Python or programming. Have a topic you'd like to see presented? Leave a comment starting with "Talk topic suggestion". Want to present? Message the organizers.

Technical discussions: Bring your code and / or questions about any relevant topic, and there will most likely be someone present who can help. For questions about a specific topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Need help with Django / Nginx / SQL". If you're able to help with a particular topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Can help with Flask / Apache / NoSQL".

Note: Recruiting and other solicitation are not allowed at these events. These are run for developers by developers. Behavior that makes others uncomfortable will not be tolerated, and offenders will be asked to leave.

Profuse thanks go to our sponsors for loaning us this space and providing refreshments.

Thank you, and see you Tuesday night!

results.description:
There's a technological convergence happening now that may people are missing, and it's happening right under our noses. 


Healthcare Data & Wearable Technology

We've entered a time period in which we're collecting more data in more ways about more things than ever before, and that data is beginning to build up.

With the introduction of wearable technology, the sources of that data have rapidly increased, and will only continue to do so.

With all of this data comes an epic opportunity to use AI and computer algorithms to spot trends in massive data sets and USE those trends to tell you more about yourself.

Tracy Ingram

Tracy is an entrepreneur and fellow Think Tank leader in Tampa, Florida, and he has experience directly related to this arena. He runs BioscanR, a personal health monitoring service that uses wearable devices to track - and even forecast - your health.

Tracy and his team were part of the Qualcomm Tricorder XPRIZE and are now focusing on the path of custom predictive algorithms for early detection.

Imagine getting a notification that tells you that you're about to have a heart attack - and which can even call 911 automatically if it's happening. This is the kind of stuff Tracy and his team are working on.

Tracy will be joining us for this Think Tank to talk about his work and the healthcare tech world at large. Don't miss this one!

Special thanks to Breather for a great space to meet!

Exclusive Breather Benefit for XPRIZE Member Groups & Meetups 

The Think Tank is proud to partner with Breather for our amazing venue space!

Breather offers over 96 beautifully-designed private and productive office spaces throughout New York City, San Francisco and Boston, starting for as low as $15 an hour. Whether you're on-the-go meeting with clients and potential partners, need a space for a group meeting and a coffee shop won't do, Breather spaces are the perfect solution when you need a quiet place to work, meet, relax or recharge. 

As a special perk for being an XPRIZE member, you get 1 free hour to try Breather. Simply download the app and use the promo code XPRIZE to try it out for free, or visit http://brt.hr/XPRIZE.

PLEASE NOTE that we limit attendance to better insure that all get a chance to have their writing critiqued.  If our maximum for the week is reached, you have the option of being notified when someone changes their RSVP to no.  PLEASE DO NOT RSVP YES UNLESS YOU ARE AS SURE AS IS HUMANLY POSSIBLE THAT YOU WILL BE ABLE TO ATTEND AND CHANGE YOUR RSVP TO NO IMMEDIATELY if your situation does change, for the sake of those waiting for a spot.  


Join us for a weekly get together of sometimes frank and hopefully always constructive criticism of your literary work. There is no restriction on the type of genre and only a few rules:

1. Bring up to 6 double spaced typed pages of your work for reading. Additional copies would be helpful in order to allow others in the group to follow along.

2. The author is not allowed to speak while feedback is being provided.

3. The same piece should not be reread at a future workshop.

We will meet every Tuesday at 7 PM on the first floor of the Central Library, unless a meetup is not scheduled for that date due to a holiday or other event. A floor plan link is available at http://www.brooklynpubliclibrary.org/sites/default/files/files/pdf/central/floorplan.pdf.

More information about the Brooklyn Central Library, including available public transportation options, can be found at http://www.brooklynpubliclibrary.org/locations/central.

Hope to see all of you there.

David
