results.description:
Skinners Loft Convivial Bar:

Skinners' Wine Tasting Room Fully-Loaded :

Skinners Upstairs Dining with Stairway to its Rooftop Garden:


And 337 Photos of Skinners Loft on Yelp!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/skinners-loft-jersey-city

Jim Summers has been a long-standing favorite of our Wine Group & this Meet-up gives us a chance to meet him up close & informally while tasting four (4) of his wonderful hand-crafted wines paired with carefully prepared hors d’oeuvres for a bargain price of only $40 including tax & gratuity!


LOCATION...LOCATION...LOCATION...

Just 1.5 miles southwest of Chateau Montelena Winery, only a mile northwest of Peter Michael Winery and just a half mile from the Napa River lies a spectacular 35-acre vineyard in a panoramic valley Jim & Beth Summers call home: Jim Summers Estate Winery!  

Summers Estate Winery is 2.5 miles northwest of the Silverado Trail North where that much celebrated road begins its leisurely ramble southward in parallel to the Napa River winding through billions of dollars of vineyards where you can find Sterling Winery & Duckhorn Winery.

Other local gems within 10 miles to the south include Rombauer Vineyards, Heitz Wine Cellars, Freemark Abbey Winery, Diamond Creek Vineyards, Charles Krug Winery & Beringer Vineyards.

Suffice it to say that vineyards are very much about real estate which accrues value based upon “LOCATION, LOCATION & LOCATION!”

Summers Estate Winery has primo location yet its wines are tremendous value, always over-delivering quality for price.

However, you would be hard pressed to find a nicer guy than Jim Summers to achieve success in Napa Valley. Come join us at Skinners Loft on Tuesday, September 15th by meeting with Jim Summers and tasting 4 of his delicious wines.

BELOW: Skinners' 2nd Floor Sun-filled Wine Tasting Room

ABOVE: Wine Tasting Room on the 2nd floor at Skinners Loft


Beginning at 7:00 pm on Tuesday, September 15, Jim Summers, the living definition of an artisanal vineyard owner & wine producer in Napa Valley, will host an intimate tasting of his Summers Estate Wines at Skinners Loft @ 146 Newark Avenue @ Grove Square Path Station in Jersey City.  Hors d’oeuvres will be paired with 4 Summers Estate wines as outlined below. Jim will be signing any bottles purchased by patrons. 

Attending this exclusive wine tasting event only costs $40 (price includes tax & gratuity). 

For Reservations, call Skinners Loft at[masked]

ABOVE: Rooftop Dining at Skinners Loft

Skinners Loft - Elegant Yet Casual Dining

Since about 2007, Skinners Loft has been in the vanguard of the Grove Square – lower Newark Avenue fine dining renaissance when restaurateur and Kelly family matriarch Margaret (Maggie) Kelly, together with support from her brothers, purchased the property at 146 Newark Avenue. After some very tasteful renovations, Skinners Loft opened its two story restaurant as the first venue in Jersey City to offer scenic roof-top dining in temperate weather. The first level is a “Cheers”-like bar space with casual dining. More formal dining is offered on the second floor where Jim Summers will host this wine tasting. And, of course, Skinners Loft roof-top garden is available for “al fresco” dining during temperate weather. Maggie son Will Kelly is the Beverage Manager while her daughter Erin Kelly is the Menu Manager. Will Kelly will be on hand for the evening while Erin promises several delicious hors d’oeurvres. Images of the Skinners Loft can be found on its website:  www.skinnersloft.com

ABOVE: Skinners Loft first floor bar

BELOW: 12 Craft beers on Tap


ABOVE: Entrance to Summers Estate Winery

Jim Summers

In 1987, Jim left a successful career in finance and with his wife Beth, followed their passion and purchased a 28-acre vineyard in Knights Valley located northwest of Calistoga, between Mount St. Helena and the Alexander Valley. Jim & Beth produced their first vintage in 1992. This property continues to produce Merlot.

In 1996, the Summers expanded their vineyard holdings to include 25 acres at the corner of Highway 128 & Tubbs Lane. This Napa Valley property carries the name Summers Estate Wines. While the property has been completely transformed to recognize its full potential producing Cabernet Sauvignon, the rare, yet delicious grape Charbono & small amounts of old vine Zinfandel (for sale only at the winery). With a winery/tasting room, entertainment center, bocce ball court, picnic area & 22+ acres of vines, Jim & Beth Summers think this property possesses the perfect balance of pleasure & productivity.

The signature, “unique” wine offered by Summers is Charbono. The name is thought to be an early Italian immigrant version of Charbonneau, a French varietal. Some strongly believe that this variety is a close relative to the Dolcetto variety, widely grown in northern Italy. The vine bears very large berries that are used to make a very dark red wine that, when subjected to extended skin contact during fermentation, is full of fruit flavor and low in tannins.

In addition, the Summers produce Chardonnay with grapes from artisanal producer Stuhlmuller Vineyards in Healdsburg, CA. 

Today, Summers Estate Winery produces less than 14,000 cases of wine, truly the very definition of an artisanal Napa producer with a strong emphasis on its unique expression of what the French call “terroir.” www.summerswinery.com

ABOVE: Jim Summers with Winemaker & Vineyard Manager Ignacio Blancas in the Tasting Room at Summers Estates Winery

Summers Estate Winery on Facebook:

www.facebook.com/pages/Summers-Estate-Wines/[masked]

Join Summers' Estate Bacchus & Bocce Wine Club:

www.summerswinery.com/theclub/

The Four Wines for Skinners Loft on September 15th...


Summers Chardonnay Reserve 2013    $27 

Stuhlmuller Vineyard, Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California   

www.summerswinery.com

2013 Vintage is not yet rated.

2012 Vintage:

91 Pts – Wine Enthusiast, April, 2014

Rich & delicious, this single-vineyard Chardonnay features ripe flavors of pears, mangoes, oranges, pineapples & new oak. The acidity is spot on. Flashy and opulent, it’s an impressive Chardonnay to drink now with lobster, scallop or a pork tenderloin. – S.H.

The 2013 Reserve Chardonnay (100%) is produced from grapes grown at Stuhlmuller Vineyards in Alexander Valley bordered by Russian River and Chalk Hill Appellations. This area has unique river bench land soils, which produce some of California’s most distinctive Chardonnays. This Chardonnay was fermented and aged sur lie for eight months in French Oak. The wine possesses a golden color and lovely fragrances. On the palate it balances medium acidity with integrated oak and a lush texture revealing layers of pineapple, pear, apple, and lemon cream pie. It offers a soft finish of nutmeg and citrus blossoms. Suggested Food Pairings: Scallops with tarragon cream sauce, Soft Cheeses, Apple Pie. Enjoy now or can be aged up to 4 years

Alcohol: 14.1% Total Acidity: 6.0 g/L Barrel Regimen: 8 months in French Oak, 40% New Oak; Cases Produced: 630 cases

Summers Calistoga Estate Charbono 2012    $27

Calistoga, Napa, California     

www.summerswinery.com 

Recent Critical Accolades:

2010: 90 Pts – Wine Enthusiast; Gold Medal – San Francisco Chronicle Wine Competition

These Charbono grapes, estate grown on the Summers’ “Villa Andriana” Vineyard in Calistoga grown in deep, loamy, volcanic soil. A very rare varietal, Charbono is thought to have originated between the borders of southeastern France and northwestern Italy. Now only found growing in less than 60 acres of California, Charbono thrives in the northern end of the Napa Valley. This vintage is a mid-full bodied wine with fruit aromas like blueberry with a hint of dried plum. It has a deep purple color and a robust, earthy flavor that makes Charbono different and distinctive from other wines. Great finish with surprising vitality from good acidity. A lovely wine of bold color and bright fruit. Suggested Food Pairings Rack of Lamb; Gnocchi with Tomato Basil Sauce Cellaring Enjoy now or can be aged for 7 to 10 years

100% Charbono; Alcohol: 13.6% TA: 6.0 g/L pH: 3.74 Barrel Regimen: 18 months in 80% American Oak, 20% French Oak; 50% New; 1,200 Cases Produced

Summers Andrianna’s Cuvée Cabernet Sauvignon 2013      $18 

California     

www.summerswinery.com

2012 Vintage

94 Pts – Double Gold – San Francisco International Wine Competition

A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon grapes procured from several select vineyards in Napa and Sonoma Counties, including Summers own vineyards. A medium-bodied wine with a deep ruby plum color and notes of black currant, cedar & spice. Salute!

90 Pts – Wine Enthusiast, May, 2015

This Cab-based blend sources 51% of its grapes from Sonoma County, including small amounts of Merlot, Petite Verdot, Malbec, Syrah, Petite Sirah and Cabernet Franc. Medium in weight, the wine at first is slightly muted, but upon opening it provides Syrah-like meatiness and peppery spice around an intriguingly brooding sense of tar & black currant. —V.B.

The Summers Andriana’s Cuvee is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon grapes procured from several select vineyards in Napa & Sonoma Counties, including the Summers’ own vineyards. A medium-bodied wine with a deep ruby plum color & notes of black currant, cedar & spice. This wine speaks to our standards of winemaking excellence & we hope that you’ll cherish it with your family as we do with ours. Suggested Food Pairings Roast Chicken, London Broil or Dark Chocolate. Enjoy now or can be aged for 7 to 10 years.

78% Cabernet Sauvignon; 12.5% Merlot; 4.5% Petite Verdot; 1.5% Malbec; 1.5% Syrah; 1% Petite Sirah; 1% Cabernet Franc; Alcohol: 13.9%; Total Acidity: 5.8 g/L; pH: 3.75; Barrel Regimen: 16 months in French Oak, 50% New Oak

Cases Produced 6,000; Release Date March 10, 2014

Summers Estate Cabernet Sauvignon Calistoga 2011    $28 

Napa, California     

www.summerswinery.com       

Recent Critical Accolades:

2010: 92 Pts Editors’ Choice & Cellar Selection – Wine Enthusiast

Summers Estate Cabernet Sauvignon Calistoga 2010 is a medium-bodied wine with fruity sweet, black cherry and black currant notes interwoven with notions of barbeque smoke, white chocolate and espresso. Salute!

2009: 91 Pts – The Wine Advocate

“One of my favorite value wineries…offers sweet blueberry & black currant fruit intermixed with cedar wood, damp earth & forest floor notes…rich with amazing intensity as well as silky tannins, it should be drunk over the next 7-10 years.”

A medium-bodied wine with fruity, sweet, black cherry and black currant notes interwoven with notions of barbeque smoke, white chocolate and espresso. 

Summers produces our exquisite & highly-rated Calistoga Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon from a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon grapes procured from several select vineyards in Calistoga, including the Summers’ own Villa Andriana Vineyard. It is a medium bodied wine with fruity sweet, black cherry & black currant notes interwoven with notions of barbeque smoke, white chocolate & espresso. We’re proud to bring you a wine that reflects the quality and care we’ve put into our own estate vineyards.

Suggested Food Pairings: Braised Beef Short Ribs; Pizza; Cheddar and all aged cheeses Cellaring Enjoy now or can be aged for 7 to 10 years

100% Cabernet Sauvignon; Alcohol: 13.9% Total Acidity: 5.9 g/L; pH: 3.66; Barrel Regimen: 20 months in French Oak, 50% New Oak; Cases Produced 4,500

See you at Skinners Loft!

Cheers!

Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this particular Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].


The Feast of San Genarro is one of NYC's oldest and largest festivals.  Join us as the streets of Little Italy come alive with food, drink, games,lights, live music and hundreds of vendors with cool things for you to discover with other members of our group.  Come alone or with friends as we'll set you up in teams then send you off on a fun and exciting evening with a chance to win great prizes!

How it works:

-Registration is from 7-7:15pm.

-When you arrive we will randomly team you up with 3-5 others (unless you join with a team) then send you out into the festival with clues that you will need to find along the way. (each team will have 1 hour to complete the task). -After you have found all the clues or your time has run out, you will head to the designated end point to see how your team did.  

You can stop to eat or drink along the way or wait and have a bite at the final destination bar/restaurant where the group will be set up to enjoy socializing and fun stories from the hunt.

What to wear: Most will be coming from work so business casual is fine but if you wish to go home and get casual that is perfectly acceptable (after all, it is a street fair)!

Experience Level: None needed

Refunds given only if the feast is canceled due to rain.

How do I pay?  Please bring exact change, $10

Can I come alone?

Yes 98% of those attending will come on their own.

If there does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?

  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

Note: This month's meeting location will be held at the main branch of the Clifton Memorial Library located at 292 Piaget Avenue, Clifton, NJ.

Come join us at our September meeting where we will feature the following presentations:

Louis Perez will give a in-depth overview of Apple Music, the new music service that allows you to stream music to your device on demand. In addition to the 30 million song library, Apple Music also includes Apple Music Radio, a 24 hour service featuring many genre based stations. 

Bob Helmond will give a demonstration of PortraitPro, a revolutionary application that allows you quickly touch-up and improve your photos just by moving sliders.

Bruce Mittelman will give a demonstration of Perfect Photo Suite 9.5, a suite of seven powerful tools for solving the most common problems faced by photographers.

Plus we'll discuss all of the latest Apple news and have our "Question & Answer" session where our experts will try to solve your problems.

As always, a meeting you won't want to miss! Hope to see you all there!

About NJMUG:  The New Jersey Macintosh Users Group (NJMUG) is open to all persons, whether they are a current or future Macintosh user. An individual membership in NJMUG costs $30.00 per year. If you are thinking of becoming an NJMUG member but would like to check the group out first, we allow non-members to attend two meetings as a "guest". Once you become a member of NJMUG you are entitled to attend all monthly meetings as well as gain access to all of the member benefits including member discounts on hardware and software, free USB flash drive, monthly distribution files, and eligibility in all raffles and member giveaways.  Check www.njmug.org for more information.

results.description:
Hi! For September, let's read The Sound of Things Falling by Juan Gabriel Vásquez.
In the city of Bogotá, Antonio Yammara reads an article about a hippo that had escaped from a derelict zoo once owned by legendary Colombian drug kingpin Pablo Escobar. The article transports Antonio back to when the war between Escobar’s Medellín cartel and government forces played out violently in Colombia’s streets and in the skies above. Back then, Antonio witnessed a friend’s murder, an event that haunts him still. As he investigates, he discovers the many ways in which his own life and his friend’s family have been shaped by his country’s recent violent past. His journey leads him all the way back to the 1960s and a world on the brink of change: a time before narco-trafficking trapped a whole generation in a living nightmare.
results.name: September Meetup (The Sound of Things Falling)

results.description:
IMPORTANT:  NOTE THE DATE CHANGE TO TUESDAY, 9/15.

The Invention of Wings, by Sue Monk Kidd

Hetty "Handful” Grimke, an urban slave in early nineteenth century Charleston, yearns for life beyond the suffocating walls that enclose her within the wealthy Grimke household. The Grimke’s daughter, Sarah, has known from an early age she is meant to do something large in the world, but she is hemmed in by the limits imposed on women.

Kidd’s sweeping novel is set in motion on Sarah’s eleventh birthday, when she is given ownership of ten year old Handful, who is to be her handmaid.We follow their remarkable journeys over the next thirty-five years, as both strive for a life of their own, dramatically shaping each other’s destinies and forming a complex relationship marked by guilt, defiance, estrangement and the uneasy ways of love.

As the stories build to a riveting climax, Handful will endure loss and sorrow, finding courage and a sense of self in the process. Sarah will experience crushed hopes, betrayal, unrequited love, and ostracism before leaving Charleston to find her place alongside her fearless younger sister, Angelina, as one of the early pioneers in the abolition and women’s rights movements.

results.description:
Now you can take a live Insanity class at Clove Lakes Park by Certified Insanity Fitness Instructors, Marie-Elena Aruta and Michelle McKenzie.  
This revolutionary cardio-based total-body conditioning program is based on the principles of MAX interval training. INSANITY pushes the participants to new training heights, resulting in more calories burned, faster results and more efficient metabolism. This interval training is the pinnacle of cardio training. You don't have to be in extreme shape - levels of each exercise are provided.
Insanity's not your traditional interval workout. It replaces traditional moderate-intensity exercise with maximum-intensity exercise, and trades short intervals of intensity for short periods of rest. The secret? Long periods of explosive intensity. You’ll do cardio and plyometric drills with intervals of strength, power, resistance, and core training. With Insanity, you can burn up to 1,000 calories in an hour. Participants experience faster increases in cardiovascular fitness and burn carbohydrates and fat more efficiently.

Class Description:
PLYOMETRICS for insane legs and gluts, UPPER BODY RESISTANCE for sculpted arms, shoulders, chest, and back. PURE CARDIO for crazy fat burn and CARDIO ABS with intensive core work so you can get awesome abs. 50 minutes: All Levels Welcome!
☆☆☆2 instructors for double the fun.  1 modifier to take out the impact and 1 to show you how it's done hardcore. $12.00 for all new members.  Your 10th class is on us.  Bulk packages are available for reduced price and more savings.☆☆☆
results.how_to_find_us: Directly in front of the Ice Skating Rink on Victory Blvd
results.name: Insanity Live

Team Packages

Better teams come at a higher cost. Which ever package you choose, you must play with those teams for the entirety of the tournament.

100 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10003

Injuries Off.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Are you looking to move your body in such a fun way that will help you stay committed to your workout once and for all? Shake Your Soul is an extremely enjoyable movement practice set to inspirational world music which calms your nervous system, energizes your body and awakens your soul! You will have so much fun you won't notice you're working out! 

Come for a FREE TRIAL Class at Movement Bliss Studio. Call[masked] or email [masked]

Shake Your Soul® is the experience of moving from the inside out. It’s having permission to dance without being a dancer. It’s a fun, soul-full class suitable for all fitness levels, ages and backgrounds. It includes easy- to-follow moves influenced by Yoga, Qi Kung, Jazz, Modern dance, African dance, Latin dance, Creative dance, and more, choreographed to inspirational music from around the globe.
results.name: Shake Your Soul FREE trial class!

group.name: Shake Your Soul - The Yoga Of Dance

results.description: The Fancy Show is the classiest and most hilarious comedy show you can find on a Tuesday night in Brooklyn. Come down to see some of the best comedians in the country, and share some good times with strangers. The Fancy Show regularly features comedians who have appeared on HBO, Comedy Central, NBC, FOX, TBS, FX and everywhere in between. The show is totally free, and we even give away a few drinks just for the hell of it. Hope to see you all there!
results.how_to_find_us: Downstairs of the Bar
results.name: Free Laughs and Free Drink Giveaways at The Fancy Show

results.description:
Two of the greatest gifts bestowed upon humanity in the last century are coming together to create the event of your dreams... Trivia. For Friends. And Harry Potter. At the same time. Also, tequila.

Come hungry, thirsty and ready for THE MOST EPIC TRIVIA EVER.

We do our best to begin promptly at 8pm, and we only delay if there are known guests who are running less than 15 minutes late. If your team is there, you can come late and join them! If you don't have a team, feel free to come anyway and join some of our friends... they will be happy to have your help :)

The food and drinks are awesome at La Flaca. You might even want to come early to eat so that you can focus on the game once we begin.

Can't wait to see you there!
results.name: Trivia Night at La Flaca on the LES!

results.description:
Screw Labor Day!!! Summer doesn't end until 9/15 as far as we're concerned.

Location:  we have our own court (#3) at Pier 6 in Brooklyn Bridge Park for one last night of the Summer 2015 !

Day: Tuesday 

Times: 8pm-10pm

Cost: $15 pp

To play:  18 yo +. You should be familiar with: bump set spike concepts, concepts of setter, hitter, etc...The ball should be hit 3 times on each side before it goes over the net, etc

Format: coed teams of 4, pick up games to 15 or 21. Organizers will set up teams when you arrive

How to register: www.brooklynvolleyball.com.  This is where you pay, register and sign waiver forms

Note 1 : we do NOT accept payment the night of play. You must pay through our website Sunday night 11:59pm BEFORE the meetup.  

Note 2:  do NOT pay unless you are on the RSVP list for that meetup.  Paying without being on the RSVP list does not get you a spot.
results.name: Last Sand Meetup of the Summer @ Brooklyn Bridge Park !!

results.description:
Join us for another thrilling Draw-mania! Draw-a-thon!
With every edition you can expect four great nude art models, a terrific DJ, astounding musicians and comedians and performers. It's four hours of pure inspiration, and if that doesn't whet your creative whistle, we're in the back of New York's coolest, funkiest, rock and roll tiki bar, Otto's Shrunken Head!

Come and leave when you like (most people stay for the full four hours!), bring your favorite art supplies and your most creative friends and expect to have a ball while you create great art. It's a fun and lively event for all levels of artistic experience, from pros to total beginners.

Think of it as a party that's also an investment in your creative abilities! What other event have you been to lately you can say that about?

All this amazement for a mere $20 smackers at the door!

As always:
Over 21 only--I.D. will be checked
Admission price does not include beverages
No outside beverages
No photography
Bring your own art supplies
results.how_to_find_us: Backroom!
results.name: Draw-mania! 44 TUESDAY, Sept. 15th., 8pm-midnight $20

results.description:
O'Connors has a great Trivia game going every Tuesday. Tom always has challenging and diverse questions, and our team usually wins! Game starts at 8:30, so let's try to arrive around 8 to get a good table and hang out a bit before it starts. Come to win a drink or two, make some new friends, see old ones, and play a fun and intellectually stimulating game of Trivia!

Great times and great friends!  New and returning members welcome!
results.name: Trivia Night!

results.description:
Join us every Tuesday at 8:30pm as La Luz hosts an ALL LEVELS, OPEN,  DROP-IN Improv Comedy Class!!!

We begin the class with a focus on group activities and fun games as we  move towards some individual character building, short and long form scenes, listening, supporting our partner(s), and performing in front an audience.

Each week is a bit different with various teachers from Upright Citizens Brigade, Magnet Theater, the PIT and places all over the world! Every instructor is a new experience and want our students to have a dynamic well rounded learning experience.

Classes are donation based so please come anyway. We ask $10-13.

Now get on over to La Luz and Let’s Play!!!!
results.how_to_find_us: We are on 135 Thames St. 11237 btwn Porter Ave & Varick, across from the GHETTY gas station and flushing AVE! just one block from the Loom! Take the Jefferson L (1 long block) or Morgan L (about 5-6 blocks)!!
results.name: Improv Comedy CLASS every TUES @ 830pm in Bushwick Brooklyn 11237!

results.description:
EVERYONE IN THIS GROUP CAN GET FREE TICKETS to a great comedy show at one of the BEST comedy clubs in NYC!! 

Tickets are normally priced at $15 each!  You can get your FREE ticket by RSVPing w/ group and using the online link below -

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/free-admission-gotham-comedy-club-tues-915-930pm-tickets-18506290814 

The show is called "Comedy Juice" and features all professional comedians (no amateurs), who you've seen on: Comedy Central, Saturday Night Live, Chelsea Lately, MTV, Late Night TV (Letterman, Conan, etc), HBO, Showtime, & More! This show definitely features some of the BEST comedians in comedy! 

In the past 2 months, this show has had HUGE special guests including: Kevin Hart, Dave Attell, Jim Gaffigan, Judah Friedlander, & Louis CK!!

There's a great bar next door called Jake's Saloon that everyone can meet up at before the show, this is the easiest way to find & meet the group! Meet there by 9pm and go in all together!!  We'll have a few Meetup groups joining us. Ask for Meetup (Chris Millhouse) when you arrive at Jake's. 

The show is 18+ & Gotham Comedy Club has a 2 drink minimum per person (drinks don't have to be alcohol)

Hope to see you all at the show!

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/free-admission-gotham-comedy-club-tues-915-930pm-tickets-18506290814

results.description:
So we have a better idea of who is coming for what, we're separating the meeting from the 101 and trash tour. Feel free to come to both!

At 9pm, we end our organizational meeting (see previous event), and have a brief introductory discussion about freeganism. Newcomers are always welcome and encouraged to attend our full meeting, but if you just want an introduction to freeganism, you can come just for the Freeganism 101 discussion. After, we will explore the area’s wasted food and other goods. We give advice on how to salvage these goods and comment on the reasons for such waste. The meeting is not open to media, but the trash tour WILL welcome media that has contacted us in advance.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll meet at the The High Line, 16th Street and 10th Avenue, NYC. Find us above street level, upstairs on the actual High Line under the covered area at about 15th Street.  If you have trouble finding us call Cindy at 718-318-9460..
results.name: Freeganism 101 and Trash Tour

results.description:
Hey Everyone!

The group is once again invited to a great night of comedy on Tues Sept 15th at 9:30pm at Gotham Comedy Club!

EVERYONE IN THE GROUP CAN GET FREE TICKETS!!! This is one of the BEST comedy clubs & voted one of the BEST comedy shows in NYC!!

Tickets are normally priced at $15 each! If anyone wants to go, just make sure to RSVP through the online link below to get your tickets.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/free-admission-gotham-comedy-club-tues-915-930pm-tickets-18506290814

The show is called "Comedy Juice" and features all professional comedians (no amateurs), who you've seen on: Comedy Central, Saturday Night Live, Chelsea Lately, MTV, Late Night TV (Letterman, Conan, etc), HBO, Showtime, & More! This show definitely features some of the BEST comedians in comedy!


In the past few months, this show has had HUGE special guests including: Kevin Hart, Louis CK, Jerry Seinfeld, Dave Attell, Jim Gaffigan, Colin Jost, & Judah Friedlander!!


The show starts at 9:30pm but they request you all arrive inside the club by 9:15pm. There's a great bar next door called Jake's Saloon that everyone can meet up at before the show, this is the easiest way to find & meet the group! Meet there by 9pm and go in all together!!

The show is 18+ & Gotham Comedy Club has a 2 drink minimum per person (drinks don't have to be alcohol)

Hope to see you all at the show!
results.name: Free Tickets! Comedy Night at Gotham Comedy Club!

Not sure how to do burpees? Pike jumps? Dragon Pushups? That's fine! We'll teach you. This is an awesome way to rock your body and get fit fast.

results.description:
Network solutions is one of the most important components included in the success of our business, yet it is not that simple to decide on what is needed.  After deciding the next step is to set up the appropriate system to satisfy those needs. As business managers and owners, we need to seriously consider what technology is appropriate for our particular demands.  We are pleased today to have Andy Coyle, President of Armadillo Services, an expert who can direct us through the maze of technological needs.  Andy is going to show us how to select the technology support we require for a small to a large network implementation.  He will also show us the different possible supports that become necessary as we work with our networks.  Specifically, Andy will explain the ways that security is implemented to maintain every system working properly.


Business owners, managers, and salespeople learn about each other's business and we share referrals.  First time attending? Enjoy breakfast on us!


Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI Crossroads provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to share ideas, contacts, and business referrals.

To avoid conflict, BNI chapters are allowed to have only one professional per profession - which mean that each of our members represents a specific category of business, effectively locking out the competition. Check out to see if your profession is currently taken at the following link: http://www.bninewjersey.com/chapterdetails.php?chapterId=1636&t=db3907f9cf60c71add464fcce0eddcfde87cc619cfe76e34c4aa5cb439f60347&name=BNI%20BNI%20Crossroads

If you or  someone you know  are looking to increase your sales and your sales force, we have plenty of leads to give out.  Check us out on Sept 16th and enjoy  breakfast on us.

Email with questions or for more information.
results.name: BNI Crossroads Breakfast & Networking

You may have attended networking group meetings before, but you haven’t seen ours!  We are a growing chapter that maintains a unique sense of partnership as well as camaraderie. Come to a meeting where you will meet other local business people as well as have an opportunity to tell us about your business.


We meet every Wednesday 7 :15am at the Maywood Pancake House, our meeting begins 7:30am.

We are seeking all professions to join our group. However our group is very unique and attractive as it is one seat per profession. We currently have the following seats filled:

 • Personal and Commercial P&C Insurance (Borbotko Insurance Group)

• Retirement Planner (Ameriprise) 

• Long Term Care and Life Insurance (Ameriprise) 

• Reverse Mortgage Banker (1st Constitution Bank) 

• Business Banker (Santander) 

• Mortgage Banker (Franklin First Financial) 

• Certified Public Accountant (KWC Partners, LLC) 

• Real Estate and Trust Attorney (Yaneixa Hermoso PC Attorneys at Law) 

• Realtor (RE/MAX) 

• Web and Graphic Design (Jersey Girls Creative)

• Promotional Items/Printer (Ramsey Graphics & Printing)

If your company is not part of the categories listed above and you're interested in growing your business with a local group on a weekly basis this may be a perfect fit! Come as a guest to see the power of our group!

Read more about us here www.LetipSaddlebrook.com

New York Real Estate Expo & Finance Conference is a trade fair for all real estate businesses local to the New York Area.  This semi annual business expo brings together executives to enjoy an opportunity of face-to-face networking.  If you are a Realtor, Mortgage Rep, Attorney, Title Company or anyone that works in the real estate industry in anyway, you should attend this expo. 

As for our Finance Conference, we will have conversations with the top hard money lenders in the tristate area, debt vs equity raising with Patch of Land and Share States, and raising money through business partnerships with Dave Lindahl from Creative Success Alliance. 

Schedule:  


  8:30 AM to 9:00 AM  Registration Opens 


  9:00 AM to 9:30 AM  Opening Remarks 


  9:30 AM to 10:00AM  Hard Money Panel 


10:00 AM to 10:30AM  Debt Raising with Patch of Land 


10:30 AM to 11:00 AM  Equity Raising with Share States 


11:00 AM to 12:30 PM   Raising Capital through Partnerships with Dave Lindahl 

Admission:  


- FREE ADMISSION for the First 100 RSVP on Meetup  


- $20 for everyone else 

*******************************************************  


Become a Vendor  


We project to have over 500 attendees for this event.  We have  space for 40 Exhibitors.  First come first serve.  Once the exhibitor space is sold out, they are sold out. 

CLICK HERE TO BECOME A VENDOR

Top Reasons to be a Vendor:  


- Network with hundreds of attendees and fellow exhibitors 


- Gain extra exposure and competitive edge 


- Free education seminars for you and your staff 


- Connect with current and new potential customers 


- Expand your customer base

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!
results.name: Sign-Up Soccer for Social Change

results.description:
Get your kayak out and come down to join us on the picturesque Long Island sound for a short tour along the coastline. On this short tour we will mark our way along the rocky coast of the sound and point out some of our favorite geographical features, beautiful homes and majestic wildlife.

ACTIVITY LEVEL: Easy to intermediate

WHERE TO MEET: We will meet near the waterfront at 5 islands Park in New Rochelle.

WHAT TO BRING: PFD (required), kayak (minimum of 12 feet long preferably with dual bulkheads for safety), paddle, weather appropriate clothing (layers; no cotton), hat with visor, closed toe shoes or water shoes, snacks, lunch, water, personal medications. 

OPTIONAL RECOMMENDED ITEMS: Sunglasses, camera, binoculars, paddle float, spray skirt, headlamp, bathing suit, towel, small day pack with extra clothes and change of shoes for after the paddle.

This outing will be in the sound, please come with a sea-worthy kayak.  Minimum of 12 feet long and preferably with a bulkhead in both the front and rear.  If you are unsure about your vessel, you may want to try one of our discovery courses first.  There will also be no kayak rentals available at this location.  If you do not have a kayak please join us on the weekends also on the discovery courses.

Please sign up for this outing on www.llbean.com/adventure so we have an accurate headcount of participants!
results.name: Kayaking on Long Island Sound

results.description:
Hello,

7v7 game, 90min+, bring a white & black tee-shirt.


This long running pick-up plays in Chinatown and has a long & storied history. The game has been going 12+ years, and was born by a group of Irish, English, Scottish and German expats who needed a mid-week footballing outlet. The group has now expanded to include players from around a dozen countries.

The group is looking for additional players to complement the game. The match is played in a sporting yet competitive spirit. This is for seasoned players - NO beginners please.

A good attitude, positional sense and a preference for passing is a must. We usually play for 1.5 hours year round.


Someone usually brings pinnies, but bring a white and black top just in case.

Note: RSVP is required to attend the game. There are a number of regulars who attend each week in addition to the meetup list - not all players are listed on the meetup.

See you there.
results.name: Chinatown Pick-up Wednesdays @ 12:00pm

results.description:
Lunchtime Chair Yoga & Meditation


Release  Relax  Reboot


Step away from your hectic day to quiet your mind and nourish your soul with a thirty-minute meditation experience.  Learn simple Kundalini Yoga breathing techniques and meditations that reduce stress, increase focus, and elevate your mood.

Each session will include simple physical warm ups in a chair, breathing techniques,deep relaxation and meditation.  Feel refreshed and renewed with time still to eat lunch and return to your busy life. 

Beginners and experienced meditators welcome. No change of clothes or yoga mat needed.

Rita London is a Kundalini yoga and mediation teacher with an extensive background in modern dance and creative arts education. She enjoys sharing the benefits of yoga with new audiences and showing how it can be easily integrated into everyday life. Ms. London is an IKYTA certified Kundalini Yoga teacher as taught by Yogi Bhajan  and is a certified Lakshmi Chair yoga instructor. 

In order to RSVP, you will need to register through the New York Open Center website not the Meetup.com's website or contact the New York Open Center Registration Department,(212)[masked] (ext 2) or [masked]

Le Français, ça ouvre des portes et ça donne des ailes !

Let's have a conversation in French! Join us as we work on our French speaking skills. Members can bring some materials for all to start with and then work from there.

I look forward to seeing you make some milestones as each week passes by.

Don will look for a table in the quietest area and will either get a small french flag to display or lay out a couple of French books on the table

We usually have the following weekly schedule:

- French Mondays with the Frenchies for a big multi-French-meetup party (an average of 7 meetup groups together). You are encouraged to join my other small group here:

http://www.meetup.com/frenchies

- Wednesdays Afternoons at the Atrium

- Fridays with French-Morrocan parties and/or International Clubbing at Cellar Bar


If you don't receive automatic notifications about our events each week, check your meetup.com email settings.

Merci et Bises à toutes et à tous !

Jean-Philippe

results.description:
Learn How to Rig Your Canon Cinema Camera

As a filmmaker, the camera is the center of your world no matter the size of your production. How you support, move and rig your camera will affect not only how your images look but also how smoothly your shooting goes.

Join Daniel Norton On Set as we build a camera set-up with the Canon C300 Mark II from the ground up, from lens selection, monitoring and rigging the camera for shoulder mount and tripod use.  

Learn: Ways to move your camera to increase production value.

Learn: Which tools (such as monitors and recorders) can and should be attached to your camera for maxium flexibility and usability.

Try: The NEW Canon C300 Mark II 

Having a properly set-up camera will save you both time and money in your production.

Sponsored by:

 Demos Start at 2:00 and 4:00pm Daniel Norton is a Photographer, Director and DP with over 15 years experience in the advertising and editorial markets. As Director of Content Production and Events for Adorama Pro, Daniel can help you with any questions you might have about lighting, studio and production. Daniel also produces and hosts FREE weekly in-store trainings every Thursday as well as the Adorama TV series On Set with Daniel Norton.

<a href="http://www.eventbrite.com/e/free-film-school-the-camera-for-cinema-featuring-the-new-canon-c300-mark-ii-tickets-18118914160"></a>

results.description:
If you want lots of excitement and something to do to get you through the week, come race with us Wednesday nights.   About 30 boats in 4 classes race around the buoys in Raritan Bay.   Boats range from J109s to J24's, Shields, Beneteaus.   Many of the captains are international racers and very competitive.

Races start at 6:30, but you have to get on the boat, get it ready,  and out to the race area, so plan to be there, if you have RSVP, by 4:30-5pm.  

Often, regular crew is on vacation during the summer and substitutes are needed.  Some of the larger boats can always use an extra hand and crewing is a great way to learn how to sail.  

Afterwards, join us at the bar and for supper.

If you want to come crew, let me know in advance with a direct email with contact info: cell# and email so I can find you a boat. 

Sail fast, live slow.

results.description:
We all know that React works, but being functional implies so much more than the typical dictionary definition would imply. Using React as an example, I’d like to walk you through some tenets of functional programming. A win much bigger than the words ‘virtual DOM’ exists in React, and through my examples, you’ll see what makes reasoning about functional systems such a treat.

Join us as John K. Paul walks us through the labrynth of React.

Agenda:

5:00 - 5:30

Come get some pizza and hangout!

5:30 - 6:15

Presentation on React and functional programming. 

6:15 - 7:30

Stick around and hang out with us! Especially John!
results.name: September Meetup - Why is React "functional"?

results.description:
This group is open to all Freelancer's, Consultants, Independent Contract Workers, AND anyone that wants to transition into self-employment. We will share resources, war-stories, and other experiences as well as help provide solutions to the challenges of being an Independent Worker.

Common Topic Examples:


• How much should I charge for my services?

• How do I deal with a client that won't pay?

• What is the best way to create a portfolio to show my work?

• How do I negotiate a contract?


We will meet twice a month at various locations in the city. If you have recommendations and/or location requests, let us know and we will try our best to accommodate.

The idea for a Freelancer's Support Group is credited to Lara Schenck, Independent Web Consultant & Educator.

If you have any suggestions, ideas, feedback, requests...please share HERE!

Come explore the world of wearable design. Bring your own project if there's something you are working on, or start something here! Want to brush up on your sewing skills and interested in learning about e-textiles?

Wearable Wednesday is hosted by Kate Sicchio. Kate works at the interface of technology and choreography. Her work includes performances, installations, web and video projects. She has presented work internationally across the US, Canada, Germany, Australia, Belguim and the UK at venues such as the V&A (London),  EU Parliament (Brussels), Banff New Media Institute (Banff) and Arnolfini Art Centre (Bristol UK).

results.description:
UPDATE: LOCATION CHANGED. Event will now be held in room 101 (first-floor auditorium) of the new Feliciano School of Business building. See below for directions.

A recent postdoc in astrophysics at Harvard, Alberto Pepe has transitioned from academia to entrepreneurship. Pepe is a founder of Authorea, an online collaborative writing tool for technical research where people can write and manage documents in one place, for free.

Researcher-turned-entrepreneur Pepe will illustrate how Authorea provides us with a platform for re-imagining the way that scholars can collaborate on and publish their research findings.

Event is presented by The Theresa and Lawrence R. Inserra Chair in Italian and Italian American Studies, Department of Spanish and Italian, in collaboration with the Feliciano Center for Entrepreneurship at Montclair State University.


Introductory remarks: Robert S. Friedman (Dean, College of Humanities and Social Sciences)

Moderators: Teresa Fiore (Inserra Chair) and Dennis Bone (Director, Feliciano Center)


Presentation: Alberto Pepe (Co-founder, Authorea)


Light refreshments will be served.

Parking and directions: Park in Red Hawk Deck, exit the deck on the 5th level (north side of deck, near the soccer field). Walk up the path (soccer field will be on your left) straight ahead to new Feliciano School of Business building. Once you enter the building, take the staircase straight ahead to the first floor and you will see signs directing you to room 101, which is the first-floor auditorium. Link to parking map (Red Hawk Deck is a rectangle that is half green, half blue, off Normal Ave., on the map): http://www.montclair.edu/media/montclairedu/facilities/parkingservices/parking-map.pdf

results.description:
A FREE and mostly vegan community meals we make together with love, mostly using food we rescued from the trash. We share meal planning, cooking, and other food prep skills, tell stories and jokes, meet new people and reconnect with old friends, and generally unplug from the current world order as we build community. If you are not a skilled cook, it is OK! If you are, that's great! You can plan a dish or two from the ingredients we have on hand, and get help if you want it. All participants should plan to help in some way, even if other commitments prevent you arriving on time. Media WILL be welcome with appointment, but journalists will be required to respect the wishes of those who do not want to be photographed.

It will be held at a volunteer's home accessible by NYC Transit. RSVP (at least a day ahead) for the location. We'll meet at 5:30pm to begin cooking and preparation.

results.description:
As always, we will have open networking from 6 to 7 pm as everyone comes in.  At 7 pm, we will have a speaker to present on a specific topic.

Based on the feedback from our members - many of us are struggling with public speaking for our small businesses. 
Things like:-What to say so people pay attention and listen? -How to attract more paying clients? -How to get more response from your "elevator pitch", emails and social media posts? 

So our next event will focus on Public speaking for small businesses. 

You can practice and improve your public speaking skills for your business objectives in a small and friendly environment, and start with creating your perfect elevator pitch 
(in case you meet Warren Buffet in an elevator next week - what are you going to say?). 

This event is a hosted by multiple meetup groups. The amount of RSVP's only represents a small number of the amount of people attending.

This event has 2 parts.  There will be our usual Wednesday Happy Hour/Mixer from 6-8pm.  At 8pm we will put on the debate with sound.


THIS EVENT IS NOT EXCLUSIVELY FOR MEMBERS OF ANY PARTICULAR PARTY, IT IS OPEN FOR ALL TO ENJOY. This is going to be an interesting evening!  Join us at Lexington's for our usual Wednesday Happy Hour then stick around for the 2nd of the presidential candidates debates for Republican Candidate.   You will see the top 10 candidates square off with each other.  Arrive beginning at 6pm for socializing and cocktails at our usual Lexington's Happy Hour, grab a bite to eat then sit back and catch all the action on the monitors.

This event is meant to be a fun and interesting way to kick off the political season. If you attend all we ask is that if you feel strongly about any candidate you keep your comments educated and dignified.  If you feel like you may get too passionate and cause arguing we would appreciate if you watched at home!

Do I have to be a Democrat or Republican  to attend? NO. NO. NO! This event is open to all to get an idea of what the candidates are all about.  We will have parties for the Democratic Debates as well

Can I come alone? Yes, 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What should I wear?  Most people are coming from work so they will have on their work clothes, business casual

Is there food available?  Yes they have an awesome menu, separate checks no problem.

.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
NYESN Business Expo is a trade fair for small businesses local to the New York Area.  This semi annual business expo brings together executives from all industries to enjoy an opportunity of face-to-face networking.  If you are a business owner, an entrepreneur or someone that works for a small business you should attend this expo & conference.

Along with the above, it’s no secret that massive results come from massive action. On Wednesday September 16 at Hotel Penn in NYC, Jill Wheaton from the Tony Robbins Organization will strategically breaks down the innovative approaches used by industry leaders like Apple, Zappos, American Express and Facebook, to help you discover where your business is now and how you can create a map to reach your goals!

Along with the above, there will be 20+ business vendors, and 1400+ people in attendance that want to do business with you.  RSVP now before we hit capacity! 

Time is Precious: 
- Event is from 6:00 PM to 9:30 PM. Please make an effort to come on time and stay as long as you like.

Event Schedule:
- 6:00 PM to 6:30 PM - Registration
- 6:30 PM to 7:30 PM - Business Mastery with Jill Wheaton from the Tony Robbins Organization 
- 7:30 PM to 9:30 PM - Vendor Networking

Admission:  
- FREE ADMISSION for the First 1400 RSVP on Meetup  
- $20 for everyone else

*******************************************************  
Become a Vendor
We project to have over 1400 attendees for this event.  We have space for 40 exhibitors.  First come first serve.  Once the exhibitor space is sold out, they are sold out.

CLICK HERE TO BECOME A VENDOR

Top Reasons to be a Vendor
- Network with hundreds of attendees and fellow exhibitors
- Gain extra exposure and competitive edge
- Free education seminars for you and your staff
- Connect with current and new potential customers
- Expand your customer base

*******************************************************

We play THREE, 25-30 minute games with a brief break between each game.

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
What to look forward to:

Four people at each table - with Nancy and Audrey -  your co-hosts, floating between tables, jotting down "overheard nuggets."  Come for the free-flowing conversation - without facilitators, speakers or an agenda. Count on a nice mix of ages, experiences, backgrounds: in other words, there's no such thing as a "bad table."

Location:

Death Café meets at the newly renovated Hunan Manor, 339 Lexington between 39th-40th Street. In exchange for your PayPal payment of $11, we enjoy their private second floor space, endless pots of tea and small plates of savory foods, vegetable-noodle soup and dessert. If you order beer, wine or sake or other dishes at Hunan Manor, that separate check is your responsibility.

Note: Hunan Manor's second floor is not handicapped-accessible.

No-Shows and Wanna-Be-There(s):

If you are not coming, even if it's a last minute decision, please have the courtesy of RSVP-ing "NO" on our Meetup.com page so your seat can be filled by someone who really wants to be here.

If you're looking for a Death Café closer to home (or a more structured version where the host leads the conversation), check out our Meetup page entitled "All NYC Death Cafés by Location" to join Death Cafés located in other parts of the city.

Stuff people say at our Death Café:

Co-host Nancy Gershman travels from table to table to capture what people say, and put it up on our Overheard Nuggets page. So if you hear some really memorable things at Death Café, please race home to write it down on our Facebook page. Or email your hosts through Meetup.com so we can add them to our collection.

FACEBOOK: 

Visit our Death Café Facebook page to get some of the brain-sharpening items and announcements we don’t broadcast on Meetup:

 News you can use (and haven't heard before)   Discount tickets to lecture series, art talks and more  Live Q&As with film directors   The Tragicomedia Interviews (where Death Café NYC’s Nancy Gershman interviews comedians about the healthy ways they process loss and regrets)    Early peeks at upcoming excursions (such as to 2014’s Metropolitan Museum of Art/ Costume Institute show, “Death Becomes Her”)

Make sure to visit and LIKE Death Café NYC on Facebook so that these goodies float in your Timeline and you can share them with others.

See you soon!

your hosts, Audrey and Nancy

>>> PURCHASE TICKETS HERE <<<

PLEASE BYPASS the RSVP button at right and register directly above. If you are a dues-paying Member of Out Professionals, this assures you no-cost or low-cost admission to this event. (Nonmembers are always welcome, but nonmember rates apply if you are just part of our Meetup group.) For a full year of Member savings and other career benefits, join Out Professionals here.

OP LOUNGE, THE OUT PROFESSIONALS NETWORKING SERIES, INVITES YOU TO ATTIC, MIDTOWN WEST’S GLAMOROUS ROOFTOP HIDEAWAY.

On Wednesday, September 16, Out Professionals welcomes you to Attic, Midtown West’s glamorous rooftop hideaway, for summer’s final edition of OP Lounge, our attitude-free networking series.

Fall’s impending arrival adds a new urgency to reconnecting with others socially and professionally. That’s why Out Professionals … OP.LYNX, our dynamic women’s network … and OP.PRIME, the network for up-and-coming LGBT professionals, are all coming together tonight. Grab some business cards and come savor the sunset panorama!

In his designs for Attic, Marc Dizon took inspiration from Hollywood’s Golden Era. On Wednesday, September 16, eye his bold, Beverly Hills patterns; relax into his plush, open-air seating.

WHERE

Attic, HK’s glamorous rooftop hideaway, at 251 West 48th Street (Eighth Avenue). Subway: 1/2/C/E to 50th Street; N/Q/R to 49th Street. Directions from where you are: hopstop.com

WHAT’S UP

Rain-or-shine, outdoor-or-indoor networking and socializing from 6 to 9 p.m. Happy Hour prices: beer, $6; wine, $7; well drinks, $8.

ADMISSION

Nonmember, $10. Pre-registered, dues-paying OP Member, free. OP dues-payers at door, $5. Print and pocket a copy of your online receipt. Walk-ins welcome; cash only at the door.

IT PAYS TO BE AN OP MEMBER!

Enjoy a 12-month Individual OP Membership (new or renewal) PLUS guaranteed admission to tonight’s event is yours for just $65. And remember, that buys you a year of low-cost or no-cost networking and socializing! Order here.

results.description:
6:00pm   Networking

6:30pm   Introduction of SoPE and attendees.  
           Li Liu, Stony Brook Life Sciences Summit
           Amanda Malan, National Life Group

7:15pm   The Art of Negotiation.  The goal will be to learn and experience negotiation using a mock negotiated discussion.  The scenarios will be one side looking to raise capital for their company and the other side will be investors considering how much they'll invest, how much stock they get, etc. We will have two teams made of volunteers and each will be given background information about their side.  All observers will also be given background information for one side or the other, and at the end we will critique ourselves.  

Negotiating team membership is open to any attendee regardless of negotiating experience.  Please let us know if you are interested as we are looking for volunteers. Anyone with on-hands negotiating experience may volunteer to be a moderator; please send us a brief note on  your qualifications in this regard.

9:00pm    Networking

Two free trial sessions are available for newcomers; membership and playing fees are due for everyone else ($175 for full year, all included; membership year begins May 15). results.description:
It's time to get kicking. Kick your neighbor. Kick your brother. Kick the big red ball. Just don't kick your dog. Game. On.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of kickball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game with rules similar to baseball -- except instead of using a bat to hit a little ball, you use your feet to kick a ball about 10x the size of a baseball. Kick the ball, run to the base, avoid getting your ball caught mid-air or yourself tagged out. Easy. And no athletic skill is necessary, just the ability to kick! Go out and practice now to get ready. Kick the postman when he delivers your bills. Kick that neighbor who won't turn down his stereo. Just get kicking!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/64476072/Kickball%20Rules.pdf.</a>

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be kicking and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.
results.name: Urban Athletics: Kickball for Grownups (Co-ed)

results.description:
CLICK LEARN MORE FOR AGENDA

The Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) is a 501(c)(3) worldwide not-for-profit charitable organization focused on improving the security of software. Our mission is to make software security visible, so that individuals and organizations worldwide can make informed decisions about true software security risks. OWASP does not endorse or recommend commercial products or services, allowing our community to remain vendor neutral with the collective wisdom of the best minds in software security worldwide. 

To access thousands of hours of video content, hundreds of projects visit www.owasp.org today.

===AGENDA===

6:00pm - 6:15pm - Check-In, 50/50 Social Networking

6:15pm - 7:00pm - Session 1

Saved or Sabotaged? Secrets of 20 Billion Software Components, Derek Weeks

Every software development organization on the planet has a software supply chain that is consuming a massive volume of open source and third-party components at extremely high velocity. To provide a much clearer perspective to this volume and velocity, we can see that a global population more than 11 million developers consumed over 20 billion components in 2014.

Those in AppSec who have pursued improved visibility, supplier choices, and control mechanisms across their software supply chains have boosted developer productivity by 15%, crumbled mountains of security debt, and shifted millions of dollars from sustaining operations to accelerating innovation.

Yet the vast majority of organizations developing software are blind to their free-for-all consumption volume, patterns, and velocity. Their software supply chain practices are silently sabotaging efforts to accelerate development, improve efficiency and maintain the integrity of their applications.

In May, I authored the 2015 State of the Software Supply Chain Report. It is a quantitative analysis of more than 160,000 software development organizations consuming billions of open source and third-party software components from over 15,000 suppliers. Included in my analysis is a deep dive into practices of the largest Financial Services firms. Your organization is most likely among those I analyzed.

While the average organization in the study consumed 240,000 open source and third party software components in 2014, the study revealed:

An average of 15,337 components consumed included known security flaws, impacting the integrity of operations

75% of organizations lack policies that control the use of open source and third-party components that are making their way through their software supply chains and into production

An average application has 24 known open source security flaws, electively built in by the development team

But this discussion is not intended to simply shed light on bad practices, it is about learning. Attendees will gain new visibility as to what’s happening in their own software supply chains, how to avoid these elective risks, and how leading organizations like eBay, ServiceNow, Blackboard, Aetna, the US Air Force, and Department of Homeland Security are applying proven supply chain principles from other industries toward improving their AppSec practices.

7:00pm - 7:45pm - Session 2

New York Chapter Global and Local Updates

Review of OWASP Project Process, Claudia Casanovas,  The OWASP Foundation, Project Coordinator


OWASP Foundation Community News, Noreen Whysel, The OWASP Foundation, Community Manager 

8:00pm - 8:45pm - Session 3


Trends in Financial Crimes - How insecure software, poor development practices and poor management enable cybercrime, Raj Goel

Why does SPAM exist? What types of crimes are we enabling by use and misuse of social media? How are small businesses, churches and schools being robbed of hundreds of thousands of dollars? And what do warehouses in China have to do with multi-billion dollar frauds? Listen as Raj shares with you what is fueling cyber-crime and what steps you can take to protect yourself, your family and businesses from the cyber-criminals.


==============================================


Special thanks to our venue host Protiviti, our meeting sponsors Hewlett Packard, Bug Crowd,  Sabey Data Centers and Sonatype and all of our local chapter supporters.  If you enjoy this community projects, events and activities CLICK HERE to join our membership today.

This month's speakers include: "Demystifying the Management Mindset" with Seth Purcell (VP Engineering at Signpost), and "Using JSON-Schema to Enforce RESTful API Contracts" from Mike Boufford, VP Engineering at Greenhouse.

results.description:
Despite billions of dollars in development assistance, many Africans face poverty and lack of economic opportunity. Clearly, policies have failed the people. Using the work of Daniel Bromley, Dr. Marty Rowland charts the failure of aid to achieve the desired results and crafts a framework likely to lead to long-lasting economic growth that actually improves the quality of life of the people.
Marty Rowland studied economics under Daniel W. Bromley, emeritus professor of applied economics at the University of Wisconsin at Madison, and used the theories of Bromley and Elinor Ostrom on common pool resource management systems. A Georgist since his arrival in NYC in 2009, Marty is active in presenting his ideas – most recently at the John Jay College’s Left Forum. His day job is with the NYC Department of Parks & Recreation as Senior Environmental Engineer. Marty is a licensed professional engineer, Certified Passive House Designer, and designer of permaculture systems.
results.name: Africa – Vulnerable People, Vulnerable States – Redefining Development Plans

About our host Hickory

Hickory (YC S15) makes educational software used by companies to train their sales and customer service representatives. The software can predict when users will forget what they’ve learned, and schedules individually-tailored reviews to keep this from happening. We use Django for our back end and React for our view layer, and we’re currently looking for our first two engineering hires outside of the founding team (see job descriptions).

results.description:
WEBSITE : TWITTER : FACEBOOK

Every Wednesday we bring some serious board game madness to Berg'n from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM. They like board games; we like board games... it's a match made in heaven!

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be either in the private room or the main room. Either way look for the people playing games!
results.name: Victory Pints at Berg'n Beer Hall

Hey Latin@ Techies!

To celebrate the start of Hispanic Heritage month we will be hosting our 1st annual NY Latino Tech Startup Pitch Competition at Tumblr (35 East 21st St) on September 16th at 6pm! Moderated by CNN Digital Correspondent, Tanzina Vega.

<<<RSVP HERE>>> RSVPs on this meetup group will NOT count.

Thanks to all of you that applied to pitch. We’re happy to see the awesome projects we’re all working on. We will be announcing the startups that were chosen on Monday 8/31, along with one other surprise (fingers-crossed).

Event: 6 NYC Startups will showcase their latest ideas in front of the audience. We will discuss the importance of diversity in tech to start it off, then the startups will pitch, followed by networking. Come hang out with us - grab a drink, eat some delicious food, chat with the pitch participants, VC’s, and other NYC Tech influencers.

Agenda:

6:00pm - 6:30pm Registration & Networking

6:30pm - 6:45pm Welcome

6:45pm - 8:00pm 8 startup pitches

8:00pm - 8:20pm Audience voting/VC voting

8:00pm  - 8:20pm Open Q&A w/ Companies

8:25pm - 9:00 - Winners announced + networking

Pitch Format:

Each startup will have 4 minutes to pitch to an audience of entrepreneurs and tech enthusiasts. After each pitch the VC’s have 4 minutes to give their feedback (they will only have nice things to say…) The VCs will choose one winner and the audience another (every participant gets a prize).

We have been hard at work this summer planning for the fall and have some great stuff in the pipeline for you all. Don’t miss the beginning of it!

<<<RSVP HERE>>>RSVPs on this meetup group will NOT count.

Cheers and saludos from the NY Latino Tech Organizing Team!

------------------------------

Thanks Tumblr for the venue, Digital Ocean for the prizes & food, and Swill for the drinks!!


------------------------------


Follow us to stay in the loop on the latest from NY Latino Tech

Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, Tumblr, Newsletter

*This event will be recorded and live streamed on Periscope*
results.name: 1st Annual New York Latino Tech Pitch Night

results.description:
Hello Everyone! We are thrilled to announce that Docker NYC will host Docker Global Hack Day #3!

AGENDA

6:00 Arrival

6:30 Form teams and start hacking // Sit in on Jesse White's Tutorial 'Introduction to Docker - The Basics' 

7:30 Break for presentations by the Docker Team via Livestream/Dinner and Beverages served

8:30 Continue hacking!

10:00 Event ends - hacking remotely continues throughout the week and weekend until Monday, September 21, 9:00 AM PDT!!

Rules:

As a team of 1-3 hackers, you will hack on a project using Docker as the central piece. You will have exactly from 4pm PDT on Wednesday, September 16th to 9am PDT on Monday, September 21st to complete this project. This window includes the time to create all materials needed for your submission.

Although it is not allowed to start your project before 4pm PDT on Wednesday, September 16th, we strongly encourage everyone to think about project ideas in advance. We will build a page with all the project ideas for everyone to see what ideas have already been submitted and help participants form teams.

Everyone will submit projects in one of three categories listed below:

1) Docker Plugins 
2) Docker Plumbing – runC, Notary, etc 
3) Docker Freestyle – must use features from Docker 1.8 and above (including experimental binaries). 

Submit Your Hack Ideas:

You will be able to submit through this form with:

• Hack Title 
• Brief abstract [masked] word description) 
• Hacker Name 
• Best way to contact project lead 
• URL describing the project idea 
• How can other people help you?

The Docker community will then vote on the best hack in each category in two different ways.

Winners:

1) Local Docker Meetup winners 

A jury composed of Docker Engine core maintainers will vote for the local edition winners from each Meetup group that organized a local edition of the Docker Global Hack Day.

Prizes for the local edition winners will be announced soon.

2) Global Docker Global Hack Day Winners

We will build a page with all projects and videos for the community to vote for the global winner. Note that Local Docker Meetup winners will be featured on this page.

Voting will be done through social networks – stay tuned for an update on how this voting will work.

The Global winning team will be invited to attend DockerCon Europe (conference tickets + accommodations for each member of the winning team).

</a>

<a href="http://europe.dockercon.com/">

</a>

<a href="http://europe.dockercon.com/">

</a>

<a href="http://europe.dockercon.com/">

</a>

<a href="http://europe.dockercon.com/">

</a>

<a href="http://europe.dockercon.com/">

</a>

<a href="http://europe.dockercon.com/">

Connect with the Docker hackers from around the world!

During the day the Docker team and the Docker community will be on IRC helping you hack your project or answering questions about Docker. The official back channel for this event on IRC is #docker.

The official hashtag for the event on Twitter is #dockerhackday. Everybody can tweet using this hashtag. You can also follow us on Twitter to receive news real-time during the day.

About DigitalOcean 

DigitalOcean is simplifying the cloud by providing an infrastructure experience that developers love. Launch an SSD cloud server in 55 seconds and scale your infrastructure with our simple API. Over 200,000 developers deploy their code to DigitalOcean and thousands more are joining every week. Read more 

About Docker


Docker is an open platform for developers and sysadmins to build, ship, and run distributed applications. Consisting of Docker Engine, a portable, lightweight runtime and packaging tool, and Docker Hub, a cloud service for sharing applications and automating workflows, Docker enables apps to be quickly assembled from components and eliminates the friction between development, QA, and production environments. Read more

results.description:
NYESN Small Business Expo is a trade fair for small businesses local to the New York Area.  This semi annual business expo & conference brings together executives from all industries to enjoy an opportunity of face-to-face networking.  If you are a business owner, entrepreneur or someone that works for a small business you should attend this expo & conference. 

Time is Precious: 
- Event is from 6:00 PM to 9:30 PM. Please make an effort to come on time and stay as long as you like. 

Admission: 
- FREE ADMISSION for the First 200 RSVP on Meetup  
- $20 for everyone else 

*******************************************************  
Become an Sponsor 
We project to have over 1000 attendees for this event.  We have space for 40 exhibitors for this event.  First come first serve.  Once the exhibitor space is sold out, they are sold out. 

CLICK HERE TO BECOME A SPONSOR 

Top Reasons to Vendor: 
- Network with hundreds of attendees and fellow exhibitors 
- Gain extra exposure and competitive edge 
- Free education seminars for you and your staff 
- Connect with current and new potential customers 
- Expand your customer base 

******************************************************* 
Posting in Comment Section 

No posting in comment section is allow. Any violator will be removed! (No exceptions, no excuses.) 

If there are any questions about the event itself, please contact the organizer directly via messaging.
