This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.

Please bring $4 cash to the game. 

• RSVPs close by 4:00PM on the day of the game. 

PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP by midnight the day before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Toastmasters International is a world leader in communication and leadership development. MINY Toastmasters is proud to be one of the 14,650 clubs in 126 countries that make up Toastmasters International Global network of meeting locations.

MINY Toastmasters provide a supportive and positive learning experience in which members are empowered to develop their communication and leadership skills, resulting in greater self-confidence and personal growth. By regularly giving speeches, gaining feedback, leading teams and guiding others to achieve their goals in a supportive atmosphere, leaders emerge from the Toastmasters program. Our goal at MINY Toastmasters is to empower individuals to become more effective communicators and leaders.

results.description:
iMakr will be offering free 3D printing training at the iMakr Store in New York.

This training is best suited for people who are looking at purchasing a 3D printer, or are just interested in the technology, and want to learn more about the machines and software.  

The iMakr Store is located at 152 Allen Street, Lower East Side.

The following points will be covered during the training session:

• Intro to 3D Printing - What to look for in a Printer?

• Intro to the printer - Ultimaker 2

• Intro to the Software (slicer)

• Ongoing maintenance 


• Common troubles

• Workflow, tips and tricks

If you have any question, please email us at [masked]

We look forward to meeting you!
results.name: How to 3D print with HyVision Cubicon

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

This event has 2 parts.  There will be our usual Wednesday Happy Hour/Mixer from 6-8pm.  At 8pm we will put on the debate with sound.


THIS EVENT IS NOT EXCLUSIVELY FOR MEMBERS OF ANY PARTICULAR PARTY, IT IS OPEN FOR ALL TO ENJOY. This is going to be an interesting evening!  Join us at Lexington's for our usual Wednesday Happy Hour then stick around for the 2nd of the presidential candidates debates for Republican Candidate.   You will see the top 10 candidates square off with each other.  Arrive beginning at 6pm for socializing and cocktails at our usual Lexington's Happy Hour, grab a bite to eat then sit back and catch all the action on the monitors.

This event is meant to be a fun and interesting way to kick off the political season. If you attend all we ask is that if you feel strongly about any candidate you keep your comments educated and dignified.  If you feel like you may get too passionate and cause arguing we would appreciate if you watched at home!

Do I have to be a Democrat or Republican  to attend? NO. NO. NO! This event is open to all to get an idea of what the candidates are all about.  We will have parties for the Democratic Debates as well

Can I come alone? Yes, 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What should I wear?  Most people are coming from work so they will have on their work clothes, business casual

Is there food available?  Yes they have an awesome menu, separate checks no problem.

If There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?

  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
Welcome back from  Summer! We will be having our first meetup of the Fall with three special guests from and SwiftStack, Arista Networks and Coho Data.

Title:

OpenStack Cinder Inside & Cinder Storage at Scale with Coho Data 

Abstract:


Coho Data’s architecture brings SDN intelligence into Storage layer to provide highly scalable and high performance Cinder storage to OpenStack environment.  First part is OpenStack cinder educational session to go through cinder basics and how internal services works.  Second part is to present how Coho cinder works at scale and lastly, we will share our vision using Docker microservices to inspire the Meetup community to architect data centric infrastructure. 

Speaker:

Masa Kawano (@masa_kawano), Coho Data 


Bio:

Masa is a Principal Sales Engineer for Coho Data, has 14 years storage industry experience. He is also a co-organizer of OpenStack NYC Meetup.
results.name: An Evening Of OpenStack With Swift PTL (SwiftStack), Arista Networks & Coho Data

results.description:
Come join us for a night of board gaming fun. We play all sorts of board games and card games. We tend to play more euro games so please keep that in mind. Bringing a game is not necessary, but if you have one you want to play bring it along.

Valley Stream train station is very close about three blocks.

For those who drive:

• Street parking meters are until 6pm. If you come early, W. Jamaica Ave has a free parking lot, behind the pizzeria.


We have permission from the restaurant owner to play in the restaurant on the condition that everyone consumes something. At least a soda. The restaurant also has a bakery attached with treats.

We play in the restaurant; to get there, you enter the bakery walk to the back, then make a right. There you'll find the restaurant, we are located by the front windows.

• The bakery is located across the street from Mitchell's restaurant. There is a lighted OPEN sign on the window.

• Be aware this group has an age limit, those who come to game must be adults under 40**

**Due to popular demand we will now be having a 3 no show rule. If you RSVP but can't make it please take the time to take yourself off. Our group is small and we do plan our games on how many members will be showing up. Even if you unrsvp right before we start, one of us is always checking and we appreciate the info. I'll send you a warning after the 2nd no show, but after the third I'll have to take you out of our group.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be located inside the restaurant section by the windows
results.name: Wednesday board gaming in Valley Stream

results.description:
Who was surprised & challenged by the quality of the US Open tennis. Italy's ladies beat strength through their unique game plan. Roger lost not because he was bad but Djokovic was too tough mentally, too consistent with his shots and very tough on offensive shots. I thought after he hurt himself with bruises and skin torn off, Novak would be hurt, but instead he wins the first set. He had a game plan and he stuck with it. Roger threw the kitchen sink at him and still lost. The sabr attack does work. I will try it myself.

It's beautiful weather,  come out & enjoy the game of tennis. 

Bring water, chair, new balls.  We r going 2 have FUN on the court.

results.description:
Host:  "Conversations New York"

http://www.meetup.com/Conversations-New-York/events/224709758/ 

“LET’S TALK, NEW YORK!”  

with Ron Gross and leaders of CONVERSATIONS NEW YORK


Wednesday,  

September 16, 2015, 

6:15 – 8:30 PM


Adelphi University - Manhattan Center

75 Varick Street, 

Room[masked] on the Second Floor

RSVP to [masked]

Please bring state-issued photo ID required for admittance to building

PLEASE SEE DIRECTIONS, ETC. AT END

Conversation is our most enjoyable, readily-available, and powerful way to stimulate our minds, nurture friendships,  and continue to learn and grow. 

Please join us to share NEW ways to enrich your life by having  great conversations more often – and to share that experience with our fellow New Yorkers.  


On the agenda:  


Celebrate the birthday of Theodore Zeldin, the Oxford-based  author of the book and BBC series CONVERSATION: How Talk Can Change Our Lives, by videotaping our “Happy Birthday” chorus and e-mailing it to him in England.

Share what we’ve learned about talking together in ways that encourage fresh thinking and nurture

friendships – including the premiere of the mini-play “Conversation Par Excellence”  starring CNY thespians.


What’s your Conversational Style? How to recognize and avoid Conversational Narcissism.

Six simple, powerful ways to enhance your conversations for greater enjoyment, creativity, and gratification.


How you can you find great conversations in NYC – or create your own!

We’ll also discuss CNY’s exciting Fall initiatives, including


a TEDx Salon with  Ron Gross on October 9th, and

a Seminar with Professor Sherry Turkle of MIT on October 20, to discuss her new book Reclaiming Conversation.


And of course as always we will honor an outstanding contributor with our prestigious Plato Awards ("...and this month's award goes to....")


75 VARICK is between Watts and Grand Streets, next to the Jackie Robinson Museum.


RSVP to [masked]

Please bring state-issued photo ID required for admittance to building


DIRECTIONS Subways: #1 to Canal, or  A, C. or E to Canal, exit next to the building.  J, N, Q, R, W, Z or #6 to Canal, are about 5 blocks southeast at Broadway and Canal. Bus: M20 stops at the front door.


COFFEE/FOOD/BEVERAGES/ETC. Excellent take-out food can be purchased at The Mill (www.TheMilltoGo.com), which is part of the same building, and brought to the meeting.


QUESTIONS OR SUGGESTIONS: Ron Gross at [masked]

About the Moderator: Ron Gross is the founder of "Conversations New York." He's been organizing exciting, important CONVERSATIONS for 20 years, and currently holds them regularly on the Columbia University campus and elsewhere through the city. He's the author of 23 books on LIFELONG LEARNING. He was recently honored for lifetime achievement in the field by the International Society for Self-Directed Learning. The late Buckminster Fuller said of Ron's work: “If humanity is to pass safely through its present crisis on earth, it will be because a majority of individuals are now doing their own thinking. Ronald Gross’ work has pioneered in improving the climate for such thinking in the United States.”

results.description:
Time-lapses are a great way to add visual interest to any project.

Let's face it ... they're cool looking. A time-lapse can show you things the naked eye can’t perceive: things like a growing plant, the path of the moon across the sky or a construction project from beginning to end.

Time-lapses aren’t terribly demanding technically, but take a little practice -- and in no time at all, you've added a great technique to your video arsenal.

Ditto with hyper-lapse, also known as motion time-lapse, which involves moving the camera during the time-lapse to create a totally unique look.

At this month's meeting we're going to discuss how time-lapses and hyper-lapses are done. Talk about the math that's involved, the type of cameras to use, intervelometers, filters, sliders … all the toys you need to make great videos. If you've never created a time-lapse or hyper-lapse before, this is a good place to start.

Presented by members Julie Conroy, Dave Hall and Bill Ivie, who’ll show some spectacular montages to get your creative juices going. Lots of Q&A, demonstrations, discussions and hands-on.

We encourage everyone to bring a camera, (especially a photo camera if you have one) so you can make your own video clips at the meeting. Or bring your GoPro or video camera. Great time-lapses can be created with them as well.

Plus, every meeting has the usual camaraderie, food and fun … Come join us Wednesday night, Sept. 16, at the Clinton VFW Hall, 491 Valley Road.

Doors open for networking at 6:15, presentation starts at 7.

$25 at the door for non members
results.name: Pro Secrets Unveiled!! Make Your Own Time-lapse and Hyper-lapse Video

results.description:
Tired of the rat race? We don't blame you... But no need to worry!!! Come to our CashFlow in Manhattan and learn how to get out of the rat race while having fun.

During the CashFlow in Manhattan you will see how to get out of the Rat Race and onto the fast track where your money works for you instead of you working hard for money to pay liabilities. You will also have the opportunity to network with local successful real estate investors and learn from their strategies.

Use this game to practice real world investing with play money. Cashflow in Manhattan is an educational board game that teaches accounting, finance, and investing at the same time. It makes learning fun and is recommended for adults and children age 10 and older.

We create a perfect environment to meet new people, make friends, and learn to make smart financial decisions so you can get out of the rat race for good. This board game teaches people how to think like a successful real estate investor. It brings out your investment style and shows you why you are successful or not. It is Monopoly on Steroids.

This meet up is by invitation only, so you need to answer the questions in the RSVP for us to be able to contact you with the details of this event.

http://www.youtube.com/v/uqZayPhdUJc?version=3

results.description:
Come Network & Play the CashFlow 101 Board Game! This is an entertaining evening of playing CashFlow 101 to help you think like a real estate investor. We will have a few tables going, and you are welcome to bring refreshments or snacks if you like. Learn how to get out of the Rat Race and onto the fast track where your money works for you instead of you working hard for your money. Use this game to practice real world investing with play money. CashFlow 101 (Monopoly on Steroids) is an educational board game that teaches accounting, finance, and investing all at the same time. It makes learning fun. If you're interested in attending please RSVP so a seat can be reserved for you.  


Meet new people, make friends, learn to make smart financial decisions so you can get out of the rat race for good. This board game teaches people how to think like a successful real estate investor. It brings out your investment style and shows you why you are successful or not. It is Monopoly on Steroids. Please RSVP and answer the questions asked.

Here are some of the things you will learn while you look at your life as you play CashFlow 101.


1. The game reflects your appetite for risk and how it affects your investing decisions. See how your appetite for risk is helping or hindering your financial journey. Do you hate risk, recklessly ignore risk or take calculated risks? When you take calculate risks, do you actually calculate the risk or are you just guessing?

2. It reflects your fears in investing. Are you afraid to lose money? Are you afraid of making mistakes? Are you afraid to try out things that you know nothing about?

3. It reflects your attitude towards money and wealth. Are you totally committed to the game of accumulating wealth? Or are you nonchalant and disinterested? Do you pay attention to what happens in the game or does your mind wander to other things? Are you really serious with learning how to accumulate wealth?

4. It reflects your mindset about opportunities. Do you believe that wealth is just luck? If you don't land on an opportunity, does that mean there are no opportunities coming your way? Do you make the most of the opportunities thrown your way?

5. And much more!

Seating is limited so PLEASE ANSWER ALL RSVP QUESTIONS TO HAVE A SEAT RESERVED FOR YOU!
results.name: Have Fun Practice Investing with CashFlow 101

results.description:
Find out how to protect your family from unexpected events with smart legal and financial planning!  

Few things in life are guaranteed.  That's why it's important to create a Plan B to protect your family in case things don't go as planned.  Things like losing a job, an illness, or the death of a parent can devastate an otherwise financially stable family.  Learn what you can do to protect your family if these events occur


Topics will include:

-  Life Insurance:  

     What type of policy should you get?  

     How much coverage do you need?  

     Should you create a life insurance trust?

-  Disability Insurance:  

We're far more likely to develop a disability during our 30s and 40s than to die.  Learn how disability insurance works and how it can protect your family.

-  Family Emergency Fund

Learn about the importance of an emergency fund, how much you should have in your fund, and the role this fund plays in a larger financial plan.

-  Legal Planning:  

Learn about the role legal documents have in building a strong safety net for your family.  

There will be a presentation on the topic, expert-led discussion with practical advice and guidance, and time for Q&A.

Space is limited.  Sign up to reserve your spot! 

We will be joined by Sara Stanich, a financial advisor who focuses on planning for parents with young children. 

Sara’s contact information:

Sara Stanich, CFP®, CDFA™, CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER™  Raymond James Financial Services, Inc. Member FINRA/SIPC 45 Broadway, Suite 1850 | New York, NY 10006 |[masked]  Raymond James is not affiliated with Shannon McNulty.

Raymond James and its advisors do not offer tax or legal advice. You should discuss any tax or legal matters with the appropriate professional.
results.name: Creating a Family Safety Net with Legal & Financial Planning

results.description:
What is it: In addition to the monthly "larger" meetups, this is a smaller but more intimate meeting with a looser agenda. Please come ready to share and discuss your problems. We will cap the number of attendees to about 20 for this one to keep the discussion intimate. We will also ask people to send things they may want to discuss ahead of time.


Here are some of the things that were talked about in this forum:

• One CTO was thinking through how to split out his teams as his overall technical team was growing and taking more projects.

• Shared a situation where his team wanted to adopt a new technology,

• A person who is launching his startup was figuring out how to hire first few people to expand the team. 

• Another person is hiring a very particular role of cloud sales engineer and was looking for ways to increase the pipeline, and also how to interview for intangibles like being very driven. 

• One person was struggling with a very significant downsizing of his team, and finding himself with more different technologies used across different projects than the number of people in his team. 

• Another shared experiences using a professional candidate vetter when hiring.
results.name: September CTO Roundtable

results.description:
Join us to discuss the ever growing security threat to Android, the world's most dominant operating system.

We'll start with a bit of the history of security threats and see how Android is faring. Then we'll dive deep into a few security topics relevant to Android. 

Specifically, we'll discuss the following:

·  Android’s security model

·  Permissions in Android

·  SSL

·  Credential storage

·  Device Security

·  Root access


Also we'll discuss what can be done about a few recent Android security exploits: 

·  Stagefright

·  Certifi-Gate 

·  Serialization vulnerability


The talk will be led by Aditya Narayan, TurnToTech's co-founder. He was head of Security Architecture at Starwood Hotels, one of the world's largest hotel chains.  He was a senior technology executive at Marvel Entertainment responsible for security. He has written and reviewed plenty of well regarded technical articles published by IBM. 

See you on Wednesday, September 16th.
results.name: Android Security for App Developers

results.description:
Karen Sandler

-on-

Freedom in my Heart

Note: WE ARE MEETING AT CIVIC HALL!! We'll need names, and you will need IDs. RSVP will open Wednesday Sept 2nd, 2015, 4:30pm.

When Karen discovered she had a life threatening heart condition, the last thing she expected was to have to worry about software. Now, with a heart device implanted in her body, she has come to understand not only how vulnerable medical devices are but how as a society we are making critical choices about all of our software. Karen will talk about the hacks which show how essential free and open source software is and will discuss her professional and personal view of the issues as a patient and as a cyborg lawyer.


Afterwards:
Join us afterwards at The Storehouse Pub where we'll continue the discussion over drinks and/or food. The Storehouse Pub is located at 69 West 23rd St, between 5th at 6th Avenues.

Speaker Bio:

Karen M. Sandler is Executive Director of the Software Freedom Conservancy, the nonprofit home of dozens of essential free software projects. She is known for her advocacy for free and open source software, particularly as a cyborg lawyer in relation to the software on medical devices. She co-organizes Outreachy (formerly Outreach Program for Women) and is a lawyer, providing pro bono legal counsel to the FSF, GNOME and QuestionCopyright.Org.
results.how_to_find_us: Use the far elevator bank to get to the 2nd floor.
results.name: Freedom in my Heart

HOST: 

Betterment is the fastest-growing automated investing service, helping people to better manage, protect, and grow their wealth through smarter technology. The service offers a globally diversified portfolio of ETFs, designed to help provide you with the best possible expected returns for retirement planning, building wealth, and other savings goals. Betterment is a CNBC Disruptor 50 and Webby award winner and has been featured in the New York Times, Forbes, and the Wall Street Journal. Betterment helps people to achieve a smarter financial future with minimal effort and for a fraction of the cost of traditional financial services.

DESCRIPTION:


This monthly meetup covers algorithms and other interview questions. We'll split attendees into two main groups:

Whiteboarding skills
You'll solve algorithms in small groups.

Common interview questions
You'll pair with another member and practice answering common interview questions, both technical and non-technical.

Our host will give a short talk about their interview process.

Schedule: 
6:30 Arrive/Network/Food 
7:00 Welcome from Women Who Code 
7:05 Welcome from Betterment and a short talk on interview skills and prep  
7:20 Meetup starts 
9:30 Event ends

Do you have experience interviewing software engineers? We'd love for you to join us!

Resources: 
http://www.ocf.berkeley.edu/~kelu/interviews/questions.html
http://katemats.com/interview-questions/
http://meetupresources.herokuapp.com/index.html

results.description:
This next meetup will be presented by Amit Sharma (@amt_shrma ), and will be focusing on causality in practice! 

Here's his write-up for the talk:

Here, there, causality is everywhere! Graphical models present a useful abstraction of causal pathways, but there are numerous causal pathways in the real world. It is often not clear whether a causal graph correctly models a given scenario, or when it does, whether we have enough data to estimate causal effects. In such a messy scenario, it would not be a bad decision to abandon the search for causality altogether, if not for the far-reaching, important effects of causality in almost all branches of scientific inquiry. 

Here are some examples: 

• Economic Policy: How much does the school you go to affect your future earnings? How bad is military transcription for future earnings or wellbeing of an individual? 

 • Political science: How do televised ads from presidential candidates affect voter turnouts? Does mandating quotas for women in local government lead to changes in policy?

• Human behavior: Does public recognition of scholastic ability lead to better performance? If you friend smokes, would you smoke too? 

• Biology and medicine: Does Vitamin-D deficiency increase chances of colorectal cancer? Are heart attack surgeries beneficial for future health of patients? 

• Web applications: How much does the Facebook newsfeed influence the information we are exposed to? How much do recommendation systems shape our purchasing decisions? 

In this talk, we will select a bunch of these as motivating examples and discuss the four main methodologies for estimating causal effects. All through, our goal will be make connections to bayesian networks/graphical models and show how they can serve as a unifying framework for dealing with causality. 

Outline:

• Controlled randomized experiments 

•  Conditioning on observable confounders (back door criterion) 

•  Stratification

•  Matching 

•  Regression(?) 

•  Mechanism-based strategies (Front door criterion) 

•  Natural experiments


•  As-if experiments

•  Instrumental variables

•  Regression discontinuities

Recommended Pre-requisites:

• Probability Theory (intermediate): Know what a joint and conditional distribution is.  Know what marginalizing is.

• Graphical Models (intermediate): Know what a graphical model is.  Know how to factorize a joint distribution given a graph.  Know the term "directed, acyclic graph". Understand the causal interpretation of a DAG. (check out the references from the last meetup!)

Logistical Notes:

• Be sure to be on time!  If you're more than 15 minutes late, you won't be able to get in.  

• The receptionist may be not downstairs with the guest list promptly at 6:00.  If you arrive and the security desk is unaware of the meetup, just hang out until she arrives downstairs to check you in!

• Be sure to bring ID for security! 

• There will be signs upstairs ("Math Meetup") directing you to the room.

Some references:  Here's a practical overview of graphical models for social science http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.364.7505&rep=rep1&type=pdf  Andrew Gelman's blog contains some interesting perspectives, from different camps of causal inference: Pearl and Gelman's final thoughts (for now)  http://andrewgelman.com/2009/07/23/pearls_and_gelm/  Causality and statistics (reviewing three books on causality)  http://andrewgelman.com/2010/03/04/causality_and_s/  Finally, for some recent applications, here's my paper on estimating the causal impact of recommender systems, in collaboration with colleagues at Microsoft Research. http://amitsharma.in/pubs/ec15_causal_impact_recommendations.pdf
results.name: Discuss Causal Modeling in Practice

results.description:
As a warm-up for World Maker Faire in NY later this month, we have two exciting speakers. Massimo Banzi is the co-founder of the Arduino project. He is an Interaction Designer, Educator and Open Source Hardware advocate, and started the first FabLab in Italy which led to the creation of Officine Arduino, a FabLab/Makerspace based in Torino. Massimo speaks globally, and will discuss how Arduino's easy-to-use hardware and software is an enabling piece of the Maker movement. 

Next we'll hear from Sherry Huss, VP of Maker Media and co-creator of Maker Faire. Sherry will give us a sneak preview of World Maker Faire and Maker Faire Week, and we'll discuss how the maker movement is taking shape from cities like NY to smaller communities across the globe.

Giveaways! Exclusively for IoT NY members at this month's meetup, the folks at Maker Faire generously offered to give away a pass to MakerCon and several day passes to World Maker Faire.

Agenda 
6:30-7pm: Sign-in, food, drink, and networking 
7-7:15: Welcome, member announcements and asks [Linda Drabik, IoT NY] 
7:15-7:30: World Maker Faire overview [Sherry Huss, Vice President and Co-Creator, Maker Faire] 
7:30-8:30: Arduino founder talk [Massimo Banzi, co-creator, Arduino project & CEO, Arduino] 

About Arduino


Arduino is an open-source electronics platform based on easy-to-use hardware and software. It's intended for anyone making interactive projects. Arduino senses the environment by receiving inputs from many sensors, and affects its surroundings by controlling lights, motors, and other actuators. You can tell your Arduino what to do by writing code in the Arduino programming language and using the Arduino development environment.


About World Maker Faire


Maker Faire is an all-ages gathering of tech enthusiasts, crafters, educators, tinkerers, hobbyists, engineers, science clubs, authors, artists, students, and commercial exhibitors. All of these “makers” come to Maker Faire to show what they have made and to share what they have learned. 

Maker Faire Week is 9/21-27, MakerCon NY is on 9/24, and World Maker Faire New York 2015 on 9/26-9/27. Tickets available here.
results.name: IoT NY #23 - Arduino founder talk & World Maker Faire warm-up

results.description:
Hi Nodesters! We've got a feature talk this month!

Feature Talk - Mikael Kopteff - Isomorphic Web with Reaktor

Server-rendered HTML+CSS pages leveraging proper caching are fast, but page changes are clunky and application state management is problematic. Single page apps promise a smoother user experience, but long initial load times and SEO are big problems. Combining React with Node.js into an isomorphic application gives us best of both worlds in a single DRY codebase that spans both the front- and backend. Using experiences spanning several projects, we'll tackle some of the inevitable gotchas like how to create clean components without polluting them with server-side or client-side code!

Lightning Talks - Valeri Karpov - Test-Driven Tech Writing Using Acquit

Maintaining npm module documentation is hard - many large modules' docs are littered with obvious bugs. In this talk, Val will provide a brief overview of acquit, a module he wrote to generate documentation directly from mocha tests. He'll also talk about acquit's new plugin architecture and show how you can write plugins to make your docs more clear!


Lightning Talks! Time slots for Lightning Talks available!

***Note on security***: As always, please ensure your full name is listed on your Meetup profile, if you RSVP yes to join. Building security will need it to grant you access to the event.

Thanks to Shutterstock for hosting! It's going to be a great event! See you there!

- Matt
results.name: Feature Talk - Mikael Kopteff - Isomorphic Web w/ Reaktor!

Join PresenTense for a Design Thinking Crash Course! This two hour workshop will teach you the fundamentals of Design Thinking, a human-centered approach to creating new products, services, or programs rooted in empathy. You will learn how to understand the needs of your consumers, prototype, and build new initiatives that are in demand. Instead of making people want things, the Design Thinking methodology guides you in making things people want.


What You'll Learn:

-The design thinking process

-Radical Brainstorming

-Rapid Prototyping


This Class is for You If You Are:

-a budding entrepreneur

-excited to bring social innovation to your workplace

-wanting to learn more about the Jewish social innovation ecosystem

-interested in applying to the PresenTense NYC Fellowship

Instructor Bio:

Sara Weinreb is a necessary troublemaker who has believed, since childhood, in challenging the way the world works, and subsequently dedicated her career to equipping fellow troublemakers in doing so as well. In her day job and free time, Sara supports individuals in taking action on critical issues by equipping them with the tools they need to create lasting social impact. Sara serves as Vice President, Programs & Strategy at PresenTense. Her focus is advising nine social impact accelerators across North America, marketing, branding and expansion across new cities and markets. Sara is also the founder of imby, an ethical fashion startup. Sara is passionate about sustainable fashion, design, impact entrepreneurship, travel, and the overall intersection of using business as a force for good.

Previously, Sara has served as the Director of Operations and Project Management at PurposeFuel, a social entrepreneurship pre-accelerator, as well as the Refugee Youth Program Volunteer & Mentor Coordinator at the International Rescue Committee’s New York Refugee Resettlement office, as the Assistant Director of Brooklyn Heights Synagogue, and volunteered as as a Guide Producer for the Social Good Guides, a collection of subject-specific guides created for startup change-makers. Sara is a StartingBloc Fellow and mentor and graduated cum laude and Phi Beta Kappa with a B.A. in Psychology and Jewish Studies with additional concentration in Social Policy from Tulane University. You can find Sara on her yoga mat, taking photos, eating her way around the world, blogging at necessarytrouble.com and tweeting @saraweinreb.

* Workshop starts at 6:30 PM sharp, light dinner will be served for your post-fast satisfaction.

PresenTense is a community of innovators and entrepreneurs, thinkers and leaders, creators and educators, from around the world, who employ entrepreneurship as a tool to enrich communal life, grow local economies and solve critical issues facing society.

Scott Heiferman is Co-founder & CEO of Meetup.  Meetup exists to help everyone, everywhere spread real, local community.

Today, nearly 20 million people create community as members of local Meetups.  People use the internet to get off the internet and get together with like minded people around the things that matter to them. Top Meetup categories include parenting, health, career, small business, and fitness Meetups.

Scott started the company in NYC after seeing the importance of local community on 9/11. Meetup's mission is for everyone on Earth to have access to powerful self-organized local community -- making a vitally more people-powered society.

Scott was the recipient of the National Conference on Citizenship's Jane Adams Award, and MIT Tech Review's Innovator of the Year. The art of selling a story to a dubious editor is the lifeblood of a freelancer, but is also critical for staff reporters who want to get the prime front-page/cover/top of the broadcast treatment they ALL know their ideas deserve.

This panel will explore winning approaches for pitching your story idea, how to navigate the editing process without losing your voice (or your self-respect), and how to turn a one time gig into a career-defining relationship. Participants:

• Timothy Harper. Tim's magazine credits include: Atlantic Monthly, Reader's Digest, TIME, Inc, Forbes, Sky, NY Times, Washington Post,Chicago Tribune, and many more. Tim has just started a new publishing venture at the CUNY Graduate School of Journalism, serving as editor of the new academic imprint, the CUNY Journalism Press. He is a visiting professor at the CUNY J-School, teaching the 6-hour core course The Craft of Journalism, serving as the school's writing coach and overseeing a popular workshop on longform nonfiction narrative.

• Jennifer Keishin Armstrong writes for several publications, including The New York Times Book Review, Fast Company, Vulture, The Verge, Dame, BBC Culture, and others. Her next book, Seinfeldia: The Secret World of the Show About Nothing that Changed Everything, will be published next year by Simon & Schuster. She  lives in Manhattan and teaches for Gotham Writers Workshop.

results.description:
*************

Important Notes

• Date Change: We typically meet the first Monday of each month, but have moved this back one week due to the labor day holiday. 

It has additionally been moved to Wed Sept 16, due to the Jewish Holidays.


• Book Voting Meeting. We will be voting on the next 3 books. Please nominate books in the discussion forum here.

(ALL MEMBERS are welcome to nominate books! A list of books previously read by the group is the discussion forum as well.)


• Agenda: We have booked the room starting 6:30 pm. Book voting will begin at 7:00pm and formal discussion about this month's selected book will begin at 7:30.  Please come early if you would like eat and socialize first. You are welcome to attend even if you have not read the book (but be prepared for spoilers! ) and would like to participate in book voting.


*************

About the Book


It starts with a question, a simple favor asked of a husband by his wife on an afternoon chilled by the Baltic wind while both are painting in their studio. Her portrait model has canceled, and would he mind slipping into women's shoes and stockings for a few moments so that she can finish the painting on time? "Of course," he answers, "Anything at all." With that, one of the most passionate and unusual love stories of the twentieth century begins."


"Inspired by the true story of Danish painter Einar Wegener and his California-born wife; this tender portrait of a marriage asks: What do you do when someone you love wants to change?


Einar dresses more and more as Lili - the name given to her by Greta - and what started off as a game becomes a way of life for Greta and Einar. With Lili as her muse, Greta's paintings begin to flourish. A French art dealer spots her work and the couple moves to Paris for the sake of Greta's career. In the permissive air of Paris between the wars, Lili is liberated and increasingly becomes Greta's companion on public outings. As Einar fades into memory they realize that a choice must be made: Lili or Einar. Greta finds a surgeon-psychologist at the Dresden Municipal Women's Clinic, and Einar travels to Germany to become, once and for all, Lili Elbe.

Amazon.com Review

Though the title character of David Ebershoff's debut novel is a transsexual, the book is less concerned with transgender issues than the mysterious and ineffable nature of love. Loosely based on the life of Danish painter Einar Wegener who, in 1931, became the first man to undergo a sex-change operation, The Danish Girl borrows the bare bones of his story as a jumping-off point for an exploration of how Wegener's decisions affected the people around him. Chief among these is his Californian wife, Greta, also a painter, who unwittingly sets her husband's feet on the path to transformation. While trying to finish a portrait of an opera singer who has cancelled a sitting, she asks Einar to stand in for her subject, putting on her dress, stockings, and shoes. The moment silk touches his skin, he is shaken

Einar could concentrate only on the silk dressing his skin, as if it were a bandage. Yes, that was how it felt the first time: the silk was so fine and airy that it felt like a gauze--a balm-soaked gauze lying delicately on healing skin. Even the embarrassment of standing before his wife began to no longer matter, for she was busy painting with a foreign intensity in her face. Einar was beginning to enter a shadowy world of dreams where Anna's dress could belong to anyone, even to him.

Greta soon recognizes her husband's affinity for feminine attire, and encourages him not only to dress like a woman, but to take on a woman's persona, as well. "Why don't we call you Lili?" she suggests. What starts out as a harmless game soon evolves into something deeper, and potentially threatening to their marriage. Yet Greta's love proves to be enduring if not immutable. As Einar inexorably transforms, he steps beyond "that small dark space between two people where a marriage exists" and Greta lets him go.

Ebershoff does a remarkable job of historical prestidigitation, creating the sights and sounds and smells of 1930s Denmark and making it seem easy. Even more remarkable is his treatment of Greta: he gets inside her head and heart, and renders her in such loving detail that her reactions make perfect sense. Einar is more of a cipher, and ultimately less interesting than his wife. But in the end, this is Greta's book and David Ebershoff has done her proud. The Danish Girl marks a promising fictional debut. --Sheila Bright --This text refers to an out of print or unavailable edition of this title. <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book_link/follow/8?book_id=543071&search=title&source=compareprices"></a>

results.description:
TOPIC:  Data Literacy Beyond the 3 V's


***PLEASE NOTE: We are trying a unique forum this time as our guest speaker will be presenting remotely to our live meeting at StackExchange. We believe this will facilitate an even broader array of top thought-leaders globally while still fostering our Skeptics community. This event will be recorded. Your feedback is much appreciated. Steven Mornelli. ***

Dr. Kirk Borne will address one of the fundamental building blocks of data science know-how and analytics capability that is often over-looked. That core competency is data and statistical literacy. There is so much focus on the abundant uses of data resources, analytics tools, and data science algorithms that we often overlook some of the unavoidable abuses and misuses that creep in.  A related problem that we frequently encounter is the lack of scientific literacy -- i.e., the lack of understanding that science is a process and methodology, based on hypothesis, experimentation, and testing -- science is not simply a collection of facts. 

Concepts that contribute to data and statistical literacies will be discussed. These may include: proper use versus the abuse and misuse of statistics, maps, and graphs; fallacious reasoning; deduction versus inference from data; bias versus objectivity in the interpretation of data. Additional data literacies include understanding of concepts like these: data types, modeling approaches (supervised versus unsupervised), training versus testing datasets, model accuracy versus precision,overfitting versus underfitting, and descriptive versus predictive analytics. 

As data scientists, we may take an understanding of such basic concepts as a given, and consequently assume that our corporate executives, clients, or data science initiates will grasp our jargon and appreciate the wonders of the support vector machine, or the random forest, or local linear embedding. The requisite data and statistical literacies could exist in some cases, but it is not a safe starting assumption when consulting, advising, training, and communicating data analytics benefits and results to a broader audience. 

Various data and statistical literacies will be illustrated through examples, including some classic cases and some real-life failures in the media. In order to communicate effectively the value and validity of our data analytics processes and results, let us keep in mind that we must first contribute to the data literacy of our audiences.

BIO:  

Dr. Kirk Borne is the Principal Data Scientist for the NextGen Analytics and Data Science workstream within the Strategic Innovation Group atBooz Allen Hamilton. He previously spent 12 years as Professor at George Mason University in the Computational and Data Sciences program. Before that, he worked 18 years on various NASA contracts, as research scientist and manager on large data systems. He has a PhD in Astrophysics from Caltech. He has applied his expertise in science and data systems as a consultant and advisor to numerous agencies and firms, focusing on the use of data for discovery, decision support, and innovation across many different domains and industries. He is an active contributor of data science and analytics information on social media, where he has been named consistently among the top worldwide influencers in big data and data science. Follow him on Twitter at @KirkDBorne and read his blog at 

http://rocketdatascience.org/
results.name: Data Literacy Beyond the 3 V's

apply to pitch your co at a future NJTM.

Follow @NJTech on Twitter/Meerkat/Periscope to watch LIVE!

More about Kevin: 

Kevin P. Ryan is one of the leading Internet entrepreneurs in the United States having founded several New York-based businesses, including Gilt, Business Insider, and 10gen/MongoDB. Kevin helped build DoubleClick from 1996 to 2005, first as President and later as CEO. He led DoubleClick's growth from a 20-person startup to a publicly traded global leader with over 1,500 employees.


Kevin is the Founder and Chairman of Gilt, an innovative online shopping destination offering its members special access to the most inspiring merchandise and experiences every day at insider prices.

In 2007, Kevin along with a founding team created Gilt as an invitation-only site for coveted women's apparel and accessories. Today, Gilt has over nine million members and has added business lines in home; baby & kids; men's apparel and gear; local services and experiences, and has founded the leading flash-sale site in Japan, a joint venture with Softbank.

Currently, Kevin serves on the board of Yale Corporation and Human Rights Watch, and is a member of the Council on Foreign Relations. He holds a B.A. from Yale University and an M.B.A. from INSEAD.

To CJK Experts and Native Speakers:

We practice like this (including, but not limited to):

Session 1 (7pm-8pm): Interpretation methods practice

For example, words, phrases or sentences interpretation, target language repeating, shadowing and summarization, etc.

We set two tables to practice Chinese and Korean separately (Japanese is on hiatus due to low membership). The session is basically for intermediate & above Chinese and Korean learners.

Session 2 (8pm-9pm): Topic-based speaking practice

Summary, speak or discuss the topic you are provided or you have prepared by your target language (Chinese & Korean).

Also, everybody can move to any table as they want.

If you would like to practice English, please join our regular Saturday meetup generously hosted by Carl.

Looking forward to practicing with you all!

Organizers

results.description:
We've got a brand new series called "Made for Mondays" that will be about our calling to be salt and light during the rest of the week, not just on Sundays.  That could mean in the workplace or wherever you may find yourself during the week.

This is a four-week series, divided into two parts. We will have a message on Sundays from 10:30am - 11:30am and supplement that with a weekly Wednesday night life class from 7pm - 9pm. 

You're welcome anytime.  Feel free to jump in on the series if you can't make the first week.  There's no obligation to be there on both Sunday and Wednesday.  You can attend either or, although we recommend joining both the Sunday message and Wednesday discussion to get the most out of the entire series :)

Let's be honest…does anybody really like Mondays?  Check out this funny promo video about the upcoming series:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FCcxw15GFbQ&feature=youtu.be

"Made For Monday" schedule:

- Sun, Sept 6th (Message #1)

- Wed, Sept 9th (Discussion #1)

- Sun, Sept 13th (Message #2)

- Wed, Sept 16th (Discussion #2)

- Sun, Sept 20th (Message #3)

- Wed, Sept 23rd (Discussion #3)

- Sun, Sept 27th (Message #4)

- Wed, Sept 30th (Discussion #4)

Please note: While we hold our weekly Wednesday life classes and Sunday services at the New York Society of Ethical Culture, we are not associated with their beliefs and values.

We encourage you to bring friends. The more the merrier!

Join us for an evening of open role classes and dancing. Whether you're straight, gay, lesbian, bisexual or transgender, you can explore tango without traditional gender fixed roles. Rainbow Tango promises a welcoming atmosphere to explore the dance of love and acceptance. We invite all levels of dancers; from the totally beginner to the very experienced. results.description:
Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

Join us on Wednesday nights for meditation and conversation about mindfulness. Learn how to bring mindfulness into daily life, and how to establish, maintain, and deepen a personal mindfulness practice.

Each class will consist of instruction in different forms of mindfulness meditation, and time for group discussion and connecting with the community. Depending on the week, the teacher may give a talk or share a reading about a related topic.

Check out our group guidelines.

Teacher for this night's gathering: Emily Herzlin 

Emily (also the MeetUp group organizer) is a writer, editor, and teacher. She has taught creative writing and mindfulness meditation at Columbia University, The Interdependence Project, Adelphi University, GreenspaceNYC, and Mission to (dit)Mars. Emily has been practicing mindfulness meditation for ten years, and trained in Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) through the Center for Mindfulness at UMass Medical School. She is also a graduate of the Yearlong Immersion and Teacher Training program at the Interdependence Project, where she currently teaches MBSR and a monthly contemplative writing workshop. 

Mindful Astoria

Every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.

All classes are drop-in, but RSVP. $5-$10 at the door to cover meetup dues and support the teachers and the Astoria Presbyterian Church. *Note that no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Email any questions to Emily Herzlin at [masked].

Looking forward to deepening practice and strengthening mindful community with you all!
results.how_to_find_us: The church is located at 23-35 Broadway, between Crescent St. and 23rd St. It is on the north side of Broadway, just past Trade Fair and Synergy Fitness. There is an awning over the front door. The church shares the space with Art House Astoria.
results.name: Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

venue.name: Magnet Training Center - Room F

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 7-10pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 14 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.
results.how_to_find_us: 32nd street between 5th & 6th Ave.  We are expected to be in Room F.  If there's any change in that, look on the screen for "Steve Ling" or "Improv NOW" for the room.
results.name: Improv NOW! - Wednesday Improv Scenework Class 7-10pm ($10)

group.name: Improv NOW! - NYC Weekly Improv Classes

Everyone knows about sushi, but let's explore other options in Japanese cuisine at various restaurants throughout the city with a series of Meetups called No Sushi. We're going to try new foods and restaurants you may love or hate. The only thing we can promise is great company.

I hosted a small meetup here previously and we all enjoyed it so much, I would love it if a bigger group got to experience the good food here.

Please note that they have two locations. We are going to the one at 19 WEST 52nd St.

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6-7 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
7:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
Join us while we watch the THINK tank with teeth!!


This is our small group networking/ socializing event. It has been our most popular and fun event each time we've hosted it so it is a regularly scheduled event.


Many entrepreneurs love to watch Shark Tank on TV to see the rich Sharks pound away at the ideas of various business founders. What wisdom does the Shark Tank impart? Some of the best shows are the follow ups where businesses the Sharks rejected go on to success anyway. Let's get together to watch some episodes over some light snacks and discuss the show afterwards.

And do you know who the MegaShark is that wins every single episode with every single deal?


Note that reception is closed after 5pm. When you get off the elevator please look for the Small Business sign and follow the instructions (either to wait in the waiting area, call, or proceed to a meeting room)


This event is "bring your own food" and "bring your own drinks". There will also be light snacks and water and/or soda.
results.name: Shark Tank Showdown!!!

results.description:
Truth is at best partial, at worst error. We are at best explorers, at worst believers. If we desire to fully grow we must keep exploring. . . Welcome Explorers! (And curious believers too!)

This is a group for exploring and testing each other's new ideas, and for the potential of creating even more together!

As a starting point we'll discuss the possibility of:

A natural morality based on our passion's values;

A politics that roots out resentment so we can enjoy

a unified diversity;

And a culture of 7 billion honest individuals---

with not one truth!

 

This morality, politics, and culture have one goal: That we each flourish--that we each fully bloom into all that we are--together.

 

Can it happen? Should it happen? What do you propose? Let's talk about it!

 

 

Note: Ripple Effect Photo by Segiu Bacioiu.
results.how_to_find_us: 29th St. & Park Avenue, Manhattan
results.name: What is your nature, and how do you nurture it? Let's learn from our ways!

group.name: Exploring New Ideas in Morality, Politics, and Culture NYC

results.description:
This is an open class that’s appropriate for both newcomers and those who have experience with Tantra. There will be a brief introduction to Tantra and to Ipsalu Tantra for those that are new… plus a short discussion on a topic. We’ll follow that with a longer, juicier practice than usual! Wear comfortable clothing you can move around in. There is no sexual contact in these classes, but you’ll leave with your heart open and a smile on your face!

$20 at the door

Namaste!
results.name: Open Tantra Night

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, September 2nd, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The September session of Cuban Salsa:

Wednesdays (September 2nd - 23rd):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino  - Level 1

This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner <a>safety in</a> an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 Classes: ONLY $60
that's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

LOCATION
Adelante Studios
25 West 31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor - Grand Ballroom (3,000 sq ft!)

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.
*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 15-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video link of our group doing Rueda de Casino
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class immediately following Level 1 on Wednesdays at 8:30pm.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (September 2nd - 23rd):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (September 1st) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:

Adelante Studios
25 W 31st Street between Broadway and 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.

*Can't find our room? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.
results.how_to_find_us: Take elevators to the 2nd Floor & make a left. We have the entire studio loft space, complete with brand new, clean rooms, hardwood floors, mirrors, 12’ ceiling, A/C, & sound system.
results.name: Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino Classes!

Date: Wednesday, September 16, 2015
Time: 7:30pm
Location: Soundview Cinemas, Port Washington

Directed by Oren Moverman. USA, 2015, 121 min.

Starring Richard Gere, Ben Vereen, Jena Malone and Kyra Sedgewick

Time Out of Mind, from Academy Award nominated writer/director Oren Moverman (The Messenger, Rampart), is a haunting look at life on the streets immersing viewers in one man’s daily quest to survive. Richard Gere delivers a soul-baring performance as George, a man whose struggle to find food and a place to sleep in New York City is beautifully captured with remarkable realism and heartrending compassion. Shuffled into the unforgiving bureaucracy of a men’s shelter, George seems destined to wind up as just another lost soul swallowed up by the system—until he meets a gregarious, down-and-out ex-jazzman (played by Broadway legend Ben Vereen) who inspires George to reconnect with his estranged daughter (Jena Malone). Cinematically stunning and shot in an eloquently observational style, Time Out of Mind is an unforgettable plunge into a world that is all too easily overlooked.

** Come celebrate the last Wed night improv class with us! We're canceling Wed night classes due to lack of demand. Maybe we'll do some on-site karaoke or go grab some food afterwards. **

** Not many improv classes are this affordable in the city. Beginners and experienced improvisors are all welcome! **


Ever wondered what it might feel like to go with your GUT and create a situation from NOTHING right on the spot? The feeling is extraordinary. From beginning to end, building a moment either that tells a story and engages the audience is a powerful achievement, indeed. And honing this skill will make you a better public speaker as well!

Work with professional comedian and improvisor, Dewey Chaffee, on the basic tools required to start making bold choices right off the top of your head!

Dewey has more than 20 years of improvisation experience. He spent 23 years perfecting his skills as an improv performer for the Walt Disney Company. He's also appeared on Nickelodeon Television and worked as their audience warm up guy for several seasons of TV production. 

Currently, he and his husband perform a live improvised comedy drag show, "The Lady Winifred and Didi Show."

More details here: www.PlayWithDewey.com

results.description:
D&D Encounters is an episodic-format event designed to allow new players to join in and learn D&D in a casual, pick-up game. Seasoned players with erratic schedules can easily hop in and out of Encounters; unlike a traditional campaign, DMs and players will rotate, resulting in a dynamic game experience. We are using the latest edition of D&D (5e) and each session lasts about 3-4 hours, easily fitting into your work or school schedule, and presents a new and exciting challenge each week. The $10 fee covers your use of the playspace, though committing to 10 weeks grants the player a discount.


We're always on the lookout for DM talent for this season-- volunteers keep programs like this one alive! However, more important than veteran DMs, Encounters is a place where even new players should feel comfortable testing out the DMing waters. Every Saturday we provide our DMs with that week's "adventure chunk", a set of 2-3 encounters in one simple, easy-to-read packet. This bite-sized DMing format is ideal for new DMs and veterans who don't have the time to create an entire campaign from scratch, and allow lots of room for alterations and improvisations as the DM sees fit. DMs who volunteer their time do not pay the $10 fee, and receive a steep discount on our D&D related products.


For our first session, we will be creating level 1 characters and running a brief "test run" of our new adventurers as they get their footing the world of the Forgotten Realms. It won't be long before we're on the road to great deeds, so you won't want to miss this great opportunity to get to know your fellow heroes!

Please private message Timm with any questions regarding DMing, the event, or anything else RPG related!
results.name: Brooklyn Strategist Presents: D&D Encounters, Rage of Demons

results.description:
A new day, new month and a new opportunity to get out there and reach new heights. We may not always feel like getting up and getting after it, and thats ok. Just know that some days you're gonna have to push yourself a little bit harder and do a little or a lot more to talk yourself into doing what you KNOW needs to be done. One bad day, one bad season, not a bad life! Push through the challenging times and you will be victorious! If you need a change, wanna step up your workout routine or need a little group motivation, and want to burn off those extra calories that you consumed over the summer, then join me Wednesday night  (9/16/15) at 7:00 PM.  

This class has got what it takes to make you DIG DEEPER!

During these classes, I will aid you in building speed, coordination, agility, strength and power. So, when that 5k, 10k, Marathon or Challenge Group Race rolls around, you will have an UNBEATABLE ATHLETIC edge! The exercises I provide will focus on endurance, plyometrics, strength, balance, agility, coordination, abs and core. We cover it all! And if you are just starting out, I will show you how to do each exercise at low impact and help you work your way up to an advanced level. But still getting in the most of the workout.

So who is ready to step up their workout routine, burn more calories, build more muscle and endurance and have a little fun with a great group of members who will help motivate you.

Class Description:

PLYOMETRICS for insane legs and gluts, UPPER BODY RESISTANCE for sculpted arms, shoulders, chest, and back. PURE CARDIO for crazy fat burn and CARDIO ABS with intensive core work so you can get awesome abs. 50 minutes: All Levels Welcome!

Parents, ok to bring your children. Although, there is no child care provided.  The children can sit in the waiting room where you can see them during your workout.  Just bring toys to keep them occupied :)

Whatever you love, somebody is making a living doing that very thing. Entrepreneurship is the wave of  the future. You can learn to earn your living by living your dream. What To Do With Your Life is a coaching experience designed to assist you in finding the pieces of your life puzzle and then putting them together to design the career and lifestyle that fits you. As the jobs continue to disappear, you will be one of those fortunate people who has the tools to build your own future.

Every person has something that they can do supremely well, the thing they were born to do. If you find your vital function, and create the support system that allows you to perform that function freely, you can earn a good living, because you will be delivering tangible value to your fellow human beings. But, most people have lost touch with what they love, and have given up hope of reaching that kind of fulfillment. 

We can't wait to meet you at our next event! Thank you.

results.description:
CHANGE OF PLANS! We'll meet in front of MP Taverna for a loop run along Buckout St to Mercy College, through Dobbs Ferry and back. Afterward, all those interested can head to MP Taverna to hang out and rehydrate.

Details about the run

Route: We’ll leave promptly at 7 pm from the parking lot in front of MP Taverna. We'll head south on Buckout St and Half Moon Lane and then we'll use the little wooded short cut to the Ardsley Train Station. We'll run past the station, veer right onto the lit walking path into the Mercy College campus, and through the campus, exiting on to Broadway at Landing Dr. We'll head south on Broadway and then we'll weave through Ardsley Park, taking Langdon to Belmont to Field Terrace to Osceola, before exiting right onto Broadway for the run back to Irvington. A tentative route map is available <a>here</a>. 

Modifications for a shorter/slower-paced run: At various points runners can divert east toward Broadway and head back to Irvington.

Water/Bag Storage: There are no water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.


Location: MP Taverna parking lot (One Bridge St, Irvington, NY)

Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

• If you missed RSVP deadline, and know our starting point, feel free to join us on the day – just this one time :)

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.
results.name: Irvington to Dobbs Ferry Loop

results.description:
Everything you wanted to know about .nyc domain and more. We are closing on 1st year of .NYC launch. Lets celebrate and welcome it with a bang

We will have speakers, cases, complimentary food, drinks and swag and goodies for the attendees. Join us to discover the new tech scene of NY being build on .nyc


Made in NY fashion.nyc opening reception photo

(With Mayor  DeBlasio, his wife and fashion tech leaders ).

RSVP to Reserve Your Spot. We Have Limited Space.

Results are in, New Yorkers have embraced .nyc and thousands of companies, start ups, real estate, retailers, non for profit and personal blogs have appeared what seems like over night.


Yet this is only the very start for .nyc and this event will give you what you need to know. 


We have speakers,swag, food, drinks, come and  join us! 


Speakers:


Ken Hansen - Former General Manager of .nyc 


Ken has 20+ years of experience in start-up ventures and growing Internet, telecom and domain name businesses.  He played key roles in two IPOs (Neustar, Inc. and Net2000), each with market caps in excess of $2B. Ken’s domain name industry experience spans the registry, registrar and the secondary market. 

Ken led the business development efforts that led to Neustar’s entry into the registry business in 2002 (.BIZ); subsequent strategic partnership with CNNIC (.cn); and, the Department of Commerce selection of Neustar to operate and administer the .US. 

Following the Neustar IPO he was a co-founder of a domain name registration, parking and auction service provider in Beijing, China.  Ken lead Neustar’s new gTLD program, and was most recently the General Manager of the .nyc gTLD before becoming the CEO of co.com<a href="https://www.registry.co.com"></a>

Natalie Raben - Director of Marketing and Communications at the Lower East Side Business Improvement District. 


She is a seasoned veteran of marketing and will show how you can use .nyc to really make your brand stand out by using  it strategically.


Here she oversees a variety of events on .nyc domain, such as: PickleDay.nyc and neighborhood-wide beautification initiatives, such as 100GATES.nyc project and will share her insights and findings.

Drew Moffitt - Serial Entrepreneur and current CEO of TailBus


Drew is a seasoned entrepreneur and proven growth hacker. He is a winner of start up battle in Alley NYC and brings insights of tech entrepreneur and serial start up founder into .nyc eco system and his predictions on a huge role it will play for tech field in a near new york future. 


His companies have been featured in Business Insider, ABC, Buzzfeed, CNN and many more.


He is a true beliver in .nyc and how it will play a critical part for NYC start up ecosystem. 

We will review a year of what has happened with it, and some of the amazing projects that has been developed on it.

There are corporations such as  (Ebay.nyc )with its local new york presence, redefining landscape though .nyc


There are conventions such as (DroidCon.nyc) - biggest nyc android convention.


There are real estate firms such as  ( ipg.nyc )and even retail stores with 39 years behind their belt such as (UltimateCollection.nyc )that moved to .nyc from .com with amazing name re-brand.


Through Start up Incubators such as loeb.nyc and bxl.nyc and start ups  link.nyc   there are just some of so many more stories in tech that are told through .nyc experience.


SUNY a giant school of NY state ( suny.nyc ), MCNY university creative campaign with  (WhatsYourPurpose.nyc)  and University arts centers such as laguardia performing art center ( Lpac.nyc ) 


There are Non for profit city initiatives such as foodhelp.nyc and dfe.nyc


There are fashion driven projects (fashionmadeinny.nyc) and Jewelry street shops and businesses (Enchanted.nyc)


And way way more, thousands of companies have launched  their site on .nyc this year. Many more to come.


This is a story of .nyc and how it is happening, it is waiting to be told. This is your chance to learn who, what and why of .nyc emerging legacy. Be a part of new york emerging trends.

We have speakers on how .nyc is changing business in new york plus we got deals on .nyc domains , if you have .nyc on go daddy you can save up to 20$ per domain by switching . And if you don't have any names yet, you can get one for 15 bucks. Save yourself some cash.  We would like to thanks our sponsor  HelloDotNyc.nyc for  Complimentary Drinks.


RSVP to Reserve Your Spot. We Have Limited Space.

results.description:
The Songbird Series brings you some of the best singer-song writers and women-fronted bands in NYC and beyond, including lesbian/queer artists, every THIRD WEDNESDAY of every month at the Branded Saloon -- great food, full bar, and the best bar staff anywhere, ever. As always, house band DK & the Joy Machine warms things up with smart and quirky alt-folk and queer core acoustic punk on Mountain dulcimer. Ashley Phillips brings her soulful and spiritual storytelling on percussive and rhythm-driven guitar. Lindsey Wilson closes us out with her memorable mix of 70′s style urban folk rock and conscious lyrics. See you there!

$8 ADMISSION + one drink minimum
*No one turned away and show your love to the artists! *

Thanks to the woman-owned FUNKADELIC STUDIOS for being our sponsors!

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * 7PM - DK & THE JOY MACHINE
DK&theJoyMachine's album, SHY ONE, has been described as "...very intense, colorful and diverse ... a novel of sorts. Dark, light, humorous & humble. " Her "quirky and smart" songs celebrate all the crucial things in life: unrequited love, falling in love with feral cats, and treating yourself with kindness. Known for her sultry, expressive voice, well crafted songs, and genre-blending, innovative work on mountain dulcimer---plucking, strumming, bowing and “rocking out” on this trad instrument, “DK”'s music is at turns evocative, moving and playful and fun.
www.dkandtheJoymachine.com
https://www.facebook.com/dkANDtheJoyMachine
https://www.reverbnation.com/dknthejoymachine

8PM - ASHLEY PHILLIPS
APSoul is a soulful singer/songwriter with a deep affinity for 90's R&B, funk and classic soul standards. Her style draws on these influences with a sound described as "soulful and spiritual storytelling that is both universal and timeless". Her often percussive and rhythm-driven guitar playing creates a full sound that adds depth and supports the delicacy of her delivery.
www.apsoul.com

9PM - LINDSEY WILSON
Lindsey Wilson is a singer-songwriter with a flare for nostalgia with her memorable mix of 70′s style urban folk rock and conscious lyrics. Throughout her career, she has embraced issues of the heart and mind within her original music. Lindsey has performed at some of New York’s most popular venues, such as Joe’s Pub, The Living Room, BBKings, Arlene’s Grocery, Shrine NYC, and CBGBs.
www.lindseywilsonmusic.com

results.description:
Meet experts Judith Grimaldi, Esq. and Joanne Seminara, Esq. and learn more about "5@55", a slim, easy-to-read guide to the five most important legal documents you should have by age 55: Healthcare Advance Directive, Living Will, Power of Attorney, Last Will and Testament, and Authorization to Access Electronic Records and Media Sites. 

Many people discover too late that they need some essential legal documents to deal with common health and end of life issues. Failing to prepare these documents ahead of time can create major legal headaches that often require expensive trips to court to resolve.  These are the documents that everyone says they’ll get to “eventually.” But “eventually” all too often turns to “never.” Setting a deadline of age 55 to draft these essential documents ensures that they’ll be ready before you need them―and avoid nasty and costly surprises. With full descriptions of each document, explanations of why you need it, and sample documents you can adapt to your own needs, “5@55” is a must-have manual for the second half of life.
results.name: Learn about 5 essential legal documents recommended by expert attorneys
